Text: I frequent this place often and it never fails to impress! Recently, my friend and I visited while traveling to Puerto Rico, and my mother-in-law had a craving for Tamales. The staff graciously provided free samples and even offered to cook and pack them for us. Exceptional place with friendly service!

I would not recommend this BBQ place. The food was terrible - frozen pressed chicken, cartilage-filled ribs, bland sausage, and overly sweet sauce. It was also very overpriced for what seemed like a child's portion. Disappointing experience overall.

Claudio's is the go-to place for any Italian food products. Their old-school, family-oriented atmosphere is worth standing in line for. They have exceptional cheeses and a deep knowledge of food. They are eager to help and so are the other customers. Hanging at Claudio's makes you want to be Italian. It's not just shopping, it's an experience everyone should have.

This place is simply the best. The name says it all. If you're not a fan of chicken, then this isn't the place for you. Their chicken is exceptional! Also, make sure to try their delicious fried corn on the cob. It's amazing!

I am extremely disappointed with the service received at Monro Muffler. They underfilled our engine with oil, causing damage, and their insurance company was unhelpful. The service associate, Joe, was rude and unprofessional, leaving my wife in tears. We were loyal customers, but this experience has lost them a lifelong customer. I will not be returning and will look elsewhere for future car services and purchases.

I had mixed experiences at Earl's new American kitchen. While the food was good but not great, the service was lacking, especially with a rude bartender. Consequently, I would not personally return or recommend this place to others.

The spinach and feta hummus is simply amazing, and the chicken caesar pita was equally wonderful. The flavorful caesar dressing and high-quality greens made it a delightful experience. Despite initial skepticism due to its location in an old garage, this place is definitely worth a try.

I took my family and daughter to this place for the first time. There were plenty of activities for my daughter and she loved it! However, I can only give it 2 stars because it was filthy. Despite the high admission price, the cleanliness was lacking. Staff didn't clean anything, electrical cords were exposed, and dust was everywhere. I hope management addresses these issues.
The all-you-can-drink brunch at this place is a must-try! For just $20, you get delicious brunch items and unlimited bloody marys or mimosas. Perfect for a fun Sunday outing. Enjoy!

I've been a long-time fan of Charlie's and returned recently due to jean troubles. The attentive girl who assisted me was fantastic, offering an array of options and explaining the various fits and washes patiently. Ultimately, I bought two pairs of Sebastian McCalls, which are both cute and comfortable. Love this place!

Had a disappointing experience at Make Up For Ever at KOP. Couldn't return opened products, had to exchange with additional cost. Still not impressed with the products, won't return. Will stick to Sephora for Make Up For Ever, better return policy.
Great ambiance, excellent bartender, and delicious fresh burger with local ingredients. Impressive-looking dishes and cold beer. A genuine local gem, not just another chain restaurant.

Despite paying for a non-smoking room, we were disappointed to find a smell and ashtrays in the room. The slow-draining shower and lumpy pillows were also uncomfortable, resulting in a migraine. On a positive note, the room was clean and the staff was friendly. However, the promised free WiFi didn't connect.

The Rib Cook-Off is a must-visit event! Taking the bus is convenient and affordable, and Great Basin's large beers are worth it. The JA Nugget mobile app helps you find vendors easily. Bring cash and explore non-rib vendors for great finds. Monday is less crowded, with cheap food deals after 5:00 pm.

I enjoyed the Neuvo-Latino-American food at this place, which has relocated and expanded. The Chips & Salsa were consistently fresh and delicious. However, as I haven't visited the new location or dined there recently, I won't provide further commentary.

The Cinnamon Rolls from the bake house are a must-have! Two of them would bring immense happiness and light to your life. Additionally, their excellent coffee and salads make for a delightful Saturday morning breakfast treat.
Great experience! The bartender was amazing, offering ice-cold beer and a decent lunch menu. It's best to visit during non-peak hours for consistently good service. Will definitely return.

I had a great experience at this restaurant! The burger was delicious and made me rethink ordering burgers when eating out. The beer selection was decent and the staff made me feel welcomed. The food was prepared as ordered and served quickly. The atmosphere was nice and the restrooms were clean. Overall, I left very happy with my visit.
I contacted United Van Lines for a moving quote, but received no response after multiple attempts. Their lack of communication and professionalism was disappointing.
This place offers nice wines and a great location. It's a shame they don't serve food, but their dog-friendly policy allows you to bring your own and enjoy the view with your pup. Lovely!

This place is amazing! The food is delicious, the staff is friendly, and they have rotating specials. Everything is homemade, and what more can you ask for? Don't miss out on their chicken salad, perfect for making sandwiches at home.

Chatham is a great spot to watch football. The $4 Guiness and Black and Tans on Tuesdays were a bonus. Their fish and chips were a pleasant surprise with a unique, soft texture. Overall, a fantastic pub to catch a game and enjoy some good food.

Had an amazing dinner experience on opening day! The atmosphere was great, staff was lovely, and the food was on point. The green tea (PHO PHREE) was so satisfying, summer rolls with spicy peanut sauce were delicious, and the pho was phenomenal. Adding this spot to my regular eating destinations in Fairmount!
Mazzaros: Unbeatable authentic Italian cuisine! Their sauce and meatballs are simply divine.

This business has a potentially disastrous business model if not for its dedicated clientele. During my visits to New Orleans, I have found amusement in betting on how many beers or ingredients they would be out of. The bartenders are rude and prone to swearing. It's almost comical to witness patrons requesting draft beers or mixed drinks only to be told "can't do that." Today, I observed at least five people being denied "mules" as we sat for about 30 minutes. Additionally, two out of their four taps were not even working. What a missed opportunity.

Village Whiskey has the best burger in Philadelphia, as confirmed by my visit. The bartenders are excellent and knowledgeable about their wide selection of whiskeys. The drinks are a bit pricey but delicious. The Village Burger is unbelievable with its homemade thousand island dressing, bacon, and flavorful meat. The fries are also good, especially the plain duck fat fries. Be prepared for a long wait as this place gets very busy. Overall, great drinks, delectable food, and friendly staff. I would definitely return.

The crust was dry and the Delmar pizza lacked enough BBQ sauce, resulting in a dry taste. However, the server provided good service. Disappointingly, the pizza took an excessively long time to be served, leaving us waiting after finishing our salads.

I visited this place early on, but was disappointed with only one flavor option, which was not enjoyable. Additionally, everything was costly, and our meal for three left us unsatisfied. The sauce did not resemble Cajun style but rather a combination of buffet sauces with fish sauce. Overall, I rate them a solid three since there are better dining options available.

This place is cheap and conveniently located, but the food leaves much to be desired. The desserts are good and the service was excellent, but the meat slicing station, shrimp, and Mexican station are average at best. The breakfast options, eggs in particular, are terrible. The steak and breaded items are also disappointing. Additionally, the decor is outdated. Despite giving it three chances, this place failed to impress.

Visited this eatery with a party of 8 on Friday, July 22. Great location for exploring the Quarter afterwards. Unfortunately, only 2 out of the 8 dishes ordered were tasty - the jambalaya and file gumbo. The rest, including red beans and rice, meatloaf, Mac and cheese, shrimp po boy, and chicken wings, were bland and a waste of money. The staff was nice, but overall the food was mediocre.
This hotel is top-notch! Immaculate, friendly staff, impressive pool, and a stunning entrance. Already counting down the days until my return next year.

The artichoke dip was disappointing - cold and served with stale chips. Not much was done when we informed our waitress. The thin crust pizza was decent but overpriced. Our server was fine but failed to address our concerns. Previous experience during a Cardinals game was better. Will try a different place next time.

My hubby and I had high expectations for this place based on a friend's recommendation. We arrived at 8pm, only to find the open sign turned off. Despite seeing people inside, we were greeted with confusion and told they were closed. It was an uncomfortable experience and left us unsure if we'll ever give it another shot.

I had a great experience with Orange Tint and Tune. Their car pick up service was convenient, and Carlos provided excellent customer care by going over tint options and adjusting to my preferences. The pleasant receptionist and follow-up call from the owner, Dustin, were nice touches. Deserves 5 stars.

I went in for a full set and requested long nails like the picture. Although my nails were cut short, I didn't mind. However, when I pointed out a crooked nail, I was told it hadn't been filed properly and acrylic was applied on it still crooked. The nail was eventually filed, but it kept getting shorter and shorter. Despite previous visits, this experience will be my last.

My wife and I finally made it to this restaurant and it was worth the wait. The fish and chips were crispy and flavorful, with a moist and juicy fish. The portion size was good, but not huge. The homemade tartar sauce added a great touch. The salmon tacos had great flavors, although the salmon was slightly overcooked. The serving size of the tacos was small, but the flavors were delicious. If you're looking for a satisfying meal of appropriate size, this place is highly recommended.

I recently discovered my new favorite pizza place where I had the opportunity to create my own pizza. I piled on pepperoni, sliced red onions, and roasted garlic for the perfect combination. The pizza had the right amount of cheese, pepperoni, and onions without overpowering any flavors. The roasted garlic, unlike your typical minced garlic, was exceptional. The 10" size was just right for two people, and I can't wait to go back soon. Plus, they offer a free pizza through their survey!

Fantastic location for outdoor activities like hiking, biking, and running with well-maintained paths, stunning views, and shady spots. However, the only drawback is people not adhering to the dogs on leash rule, with at least 6 off-leash dogs encountered. It's crucial to follow the rules; otherwise, they might ban dogs altogether.

This place is perfect for kids - it's like a tea party with delicious treats like homemade doughnuts, popsicles, and cake. I've tried everything, and my favorites are the red bean filled doughnuts, popsicles, patbingsu and the classic coffee with cream and sugar.

The service was extremely slow and the food was average. Even with a small group, the service was a mess as multiple servers watched one struggling server handle everything. I felt sorry for her as she had to manage drinks, serving, and running food.
The local ice cream is top-notch with flavors like Expresso Chip, Moose Tracks, and Graham Slam, all uniquely crafted and delicious.
Holy Rolls is an incredible find! With their tasty rolls, excellent service, reasonable prices, and abundant healthy choices, it's a true gem. Don't miss out on their sushi, it's worth every dollar!
I highly recommend this place for brunch, dinner, or lunch take-out. The staff is consistently friendly and the food is always delicious.
Had the classic burger and fries, both delicious. Service was excellent and the Bananas Foster spiked milkshake was a must-try. Great experience overall.

The food was good, but the service and cleanliness were lacking. Sticky table and mix-up with orders. Great pork belly tacos and spicy beef pho, but wait for the check was long. Go for the food, not the service.

Fast, fresh, with very good carne and guacamole. However, limited ability to customize taco toppings and thick tortilla chips were a letdown. The dulche de leche soft serve ice cream was amazingly delicious. However, more seating and improved table clean-ups would be beneficial.

This hidden gem in a strip mall exceeded all expectations. The modern and romantic atmosphere sets the perfect stage for an amazing dining experience. The food, particularly the Fois gras, was exceptional. The prix fixe menu with three courses allowed me to fully indulge in the delicious offerings. While the short ribs were great, I'm excited to try something new on my next visit. The desserts, especially the caramel tart, were simply heavenly. I can't wait to return to this incredible restaurant!

The cemetery is loved by some for its angel photo opportunities, but I find it a little creepy. On the bright side, it's peaceful, lacking zombies, and even had witches adding some photobombs. Overall, it's well-maintained with impressive gravestones and angels. And did I mention, no zombies?

We chose Tako based on positive Yelp reviews but were disappointed with the lack of service and slow delivery of appetizers. The edamame was overcooked and the spring roll seemed frozen and unappetizing. However, the sushi itself was good, although not outstanding. Considering the slow service and underwhelming appetizers, I would not order them again if I were to return.

I have been coming to this facility for 6 months due to my membership, but I am constantly disappointed. The facilities are nice, but the staff does not do a good job. I always have to ask them to re-vacuum or wipe everything down as they do not clean cup holders or door kick panels. It is frustrating, and some of the staff on the vacuum side do not speak English, making it even more difficult to communicate. It's a shame because the location is perfect for me, but the quality is lacking.
The hot chicken is outstanding, possibly the best I've had despite being from the South. However, the small portion size comes at a high price. The drinks are also incredibly impressive.

I finally tried Honey's on my birthday and it was worth the wait! The food, including the french toast, home fries, sausage, and Jewish apple cake, was absolutely delicious. I'll definitely be coming back for more.

Dr. Jeffers is a compassionate and knowledgeable vet with reasonable prices and excellent diagnostic equipment. She even accepts reptiles and has animals available for adoption. Highly recommend her practice. A top-notch vet comparable to Dr. Pol.
Stopped here on our shuttle driver's recommendation. The red velvet ice cream is amazing! Cake pieces, creamy goodness—yum!

The overall dining experience was average due to okay food quality. However, the restaurant felt overcrowded with too many tables and limited space, leading to a rushed atmosphere. We frequently experienced disruptions from other servers and customers bumping into our chairs.

I highly recommend this unique spot! The graffiti-style art on the walls, delicious food options, and special hummus flavors make it stand out. The prices are good, and the portion size is great. I thoroughly enjoyed the Greek steak pita with guac hummus. I will definitely be returning!
The food is excellent, service is fast, and the staff is incredibly friendly. Always a pleasant experience ordering here.

I highly recommend this place for its extensive whiskey/bourbon selection that caters to all preferences. The burger with fried egg was absolutely delicious and probably one of the best I've ever had. Don't miss out on the must-try duck fries. The atmosphere is cute, but seating arrangements for larger parties can be a bit awkward, hindering conversations. Nonetheless, it's a nice place to visit and we definitely plan on going back.

We recently moved to town and were sad to leave behind our favorite local Mexican restaurant. However, we were pleasantly surprised when we finally tried this place. The traditional ambiance and top-notch service immediately impressed us. Their glass bottle sodas were a personal favorite, and the food was absolutely amazing. My wife loved the Taco Sombrero, and I thoroughly enjoyed the Chimichanga. If I could, I would give this place 6 stars.

I like Dewey's primary location for its proximity to my house. The pizza's appearance and crust are great. However, my main issue with Dewey's is its excessive saltiness. The pepperoni, Socrates Revenge, and Bronx Bomber pizzas felt like eating a brick of salt. The overwhelming combination of salty sauce and meat leaves my taste buds unable to detect any other flavor. If they address this issue, I would love Dewey's. The salads are decent in size but seem like something easily put together at home. I usually avoid ordering them due to the cost.

I couldn't be happier with my experience at All About Hair. Lou not only gave me an amazing haircut but also created a welcoming atmosphere and engaging conversation. I am so impressed that I am considering contacting Yelp! to suggest expanding their star rating system for this exceptional place. Lou is now my go-to barber, and All About Hair has gained a loyal customer in me. 5 stars all the way!

This place is amazing! The gyros are delicious and the takeout service is on point. Although I haven't dined in, the diverse atmosphere with Bosnian people adds to its charm. I've heard the restaurant is also clean. Cheers to this place for their awesome gyros!

R2L offers a classy and incredible dining experience on the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place. Despite not having a window-facing table, we still enjoyed stunning views of the sunset and city skyline. The menu for Center City Restaurant Week provided multiple choices for each course. I loved the crispy peas/ham/garlic risotto balls as an appetizer and the Butcher's Filet as the main course, although it was quite heavy. The milk chocolate + hazelnut pudding was a dazzling and delicious dessert. The waiter's attentiveness and the overall ambiance added to the wonderful experience.

City Tour: 1 Star - Not worth it, no confirmation email, payment hassle, limited visibility, only two worthwhile stops. Take the green street cars or red bus tours instead.

Plantation Tour: 5 Stars! Informative and balanced history, driver Stacie was great. Laura Plantation was amazing, Oak Alley was beautiful but focused on landowners. Buses are comfortable.

Swamp Tour: 4 Stars - No alligators due to rain, but guide was knowledgeable. Avoid booking in cold or stormy weather. Comfortable buses.

Chateau La Vin has been my favorite for years, and it's amazing to see how it has evolved from a wine store to a fantastic wine bar. With an extensive wine selection, cheese and crackers, and even the option to order from local restaurants, it offers a delightful experience. The owner's knowledge and willingness to share make the visit even more enjoyable. They also cater to beer drinkers with a nice variety. Outdoor seating is available too. Overall, Chateau La Vin is a fantastic place to visit.

Westfall replaced our roof in April and we are extremely satisfied. From the quality of the new roof to their exceptional communication and follow-up, we couldn't have made a better choice. Highly recommend this company!

Stopped by on a Monday evening and found a lively atmosphere with friendly service. The bar had a good selection, though I can't speak for the drinks. However, the standout here is the food. The Pear Gorgonzola Melt was a plateful of deliciousness. Perfect spot for a tasty sandwich at a reasonable price (~$10) and watching sports.

Spot on! "The veg" burger was absolutely fantastic. The combination of portabella, grilled mozzarella, pickled veg, arugula, and gauc was a delightful explosion of flavors. The cheese was perfectly fused on top, not overly melted. The citrusy and vinegary notes of the gauc and pickled veg balanced well with the bitterness of the arugula. The bun-to-contents ratio was spot on, and the potato bun was a bonus. As for the spicy fries, they were subtly spiced, reminiscent of crab fries. The portion size was just right. The atmosphere of the place reminded me of a cozy dive bar, though it's a bit small for sit-down dining.
Great rolls, excellent sake, and a unique experience in the bamboo room. Highly recommended for those who are able and agile.

The Tiki Tolteca bar in New Orleans is a must-visit! The scorpion bowl, piña colada, fried shrimp taco, and Jell-O shots were all delicious. The bar mixer was friendly and the interior had a fun Tiki theme. Perfect for a group outing or a romantic date, this non-commercial establishment is small enough for an intimate atmosphere but big enough to have a good time. Highly recommended!

The Center is a fantastic place for a massage! They offer a serene and calming atmosphere, with same day appointments readily available. I have always had incredible experiences with their therapists, never leaving disappointed.
Terrible experience, order was 75% incorrect and missing items. Disappointed.

Overall, the experience at this restaurant was disappointing. The wait for the food was excessively long, and the burger, despite being ordered medium rare, was overcooked. The Seafood Jumbalaya was decent, but not worth the price. There are definitely better dining options in the French Quarter. It wasn't terrible, but considering the hype surrounding this place, I expected much better.

Union Station St. Louis is a good choice for dining. I enjoyed the Ponchartrain with its delicious mushroom and cream sauce. The shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake were decent appetizers, although not exceptional. The drinks and service were satisfactory. Dining on the outdoor patio was a great option due to the pleasant weather, but the interior also seemed comfortable and less casual.

The bar offers a great happy hour from 4-7 every day with $3 wine and drafts, $5 pizza, and $4.50 appetizers. The to-go dinners and lunches are reasonably priced and served quickly. The staff is incredibly friendly.

I requested a scissor cut for my straight hair, but the stylist ignored my preference and used clippers instead. Despite my clear instructions, she proceeded to cut 90% of my hair with clippers. I strongly advise going elsewhere for a haircut if you do not want a high and tight fade with clippers.
The yum yum club is amazing, and their macaroni salad is awesome! While the service could be friendlier at times, I keep going back because the price is right and the food tastes great.
Best place for salads! Fast service and consistently fresh veggies. I always stop by for lunch when in town.

The pulled pork sandwich was delicious, but the Lucky Bun (Asian fusion style) burger was a disappointment due to the use of a frozen beef patty. The bread, toppings, and sauces were excellent, but the processed patty hindered the flavors. Using fresh ground meat would have made it a great gourmet burger.

The gelato at this place is delicious, but the service is extremely poor. During my recent visit with a friend from out of town, we encountered unprofessional behavior from the night staff, which made my friend feel uncomfortable. Even the young manager did not improve the situation. The service used to be great here, but something appears to have gone wrong recently.

Overall, the pancakes at this place were decent but a bit dry. It's recommended to arrive before 8:30am to avoid a long wait. My friends tried different flavors and they were all okay. Personally, I don't understand the hype around this place. If the line is short, it's an alright option for a regular breakfast. However, if the line is long, I highly suggest going to Fido down the street for amazing coffee and breakfast food.

A.I. DuPont is the best family hospital on the East Coast. They excel in coordinating multiple MD visits in a single day and provide exceptional care. The renovated wing offers great caregiver accommodations and the staff is friendly and attentive. Highly recommend traveling from NY for child's care.

Mr. B's in New Orleans is a must-visit for a tasty and satisfying brunch. From the moment you step in, the jazz music creates a cozy atmosphere. The fresh loaf of bread is divine and the gumbo ya-ya is exactly what you'd expect. The BBQ shrimp, despite being messy, are rich and flavorful, accompanied by a divine sauce. Service is friendly and efficient, although the prices are a bit steep. If you have the chance, definitely give their brunch a try.

Despina at EWC is a true waxing godsend! She is quick, friendly, and professional, leaving you feeling fresh and satisfied. The waxing experience with her surpasses any strip junk; it's simply excellent. Despina's expertise extends to making eyebrows on fleek, and her attentive listening skills enhance the overall experience. Thanks to Despina, I actually enjoy my waxing appointments. She is truly the best in the biz!
Terrible pizza, slow and rude delivery, incorrect change with only coins. Avoid this place at all costs!
As a Latino, I strongly advise avoiding this place. The hairdresser I had was extremely rude and unprofessional.

Terribly disappointed with the overpriced and underwhelming experience. The sausage/egg/cheese sandwich was cold and significantly smaller than depicted. Presentation on large plates was just embarrassing. The bacon/egg/cheese sandwich on brioche was equally disappointing with a cold egg and excessive greasiness. Comparable food can be found at McDonald's for a fraction of the price.

Despite the disappointing rating, Five Star pizza serves really delicious pizza at reasonable prices. Avoid the cinnamon bite items, but their pepperoni bites are incredibly tasty. The pizza sizes are generous, and the online coupons and deals make it even more appealing. The only downside is their unsatisfactory staff, which can be overlooked. Overall, a great option for quick and affordable pizza.

We had a fantastic dining experience at Angelina's, a small Italian restaurant in South Philly. After being unable to get into the oldest Italian restaurant, we stumbled upon Angelina's and immediately felt at home. The eggplant and roasted pepper appetizer was delicious and the Veal Osso Bocca, Carbonara, and lasagna were absolutely amazing. We can't wait to go back!

First time here and I was impressed! The bar and restaurant area is fantastic with an open floor plan and lots of TVs for sports viewing. Being attached to their O'Fallon brewery, you can expect great beer choices. Their House Special IPA was excellent, perfectly balanced and not overly bitter. The only drawback is the lack of desserts. Look out for Troy behind the bar! 4 stars.
The shows are always a blast! The atmosphere is entertaining and laid-back. Great food, great price. Highly recommended for a fun and enjoyable time.

Overall, I highly recommend this place for their fantastic burgers, fries, and salad. The burgers are perfectly seasoned with a subtle salt and pepper flavor. The outdoor seating creates a charming atmosphere. The staff is friendly and the location provides convenient street parking or a parking lot in the back.

Love this new taqueria! The green sauce is amazing, especially on cheese enchiladas. The Mexican rice is top-notch too. Authentic Mexican food that reminds me of my favorite spots in Houston. It's the only place in New Orleans East for Mexican cuisine. I'll definitely be a regular customer. Open 7 days a week, serving breakfast and open late. Call 504-242-0573 for takeout. YUMMY!
Extremely slow service; a 40-minute wait for a pasta and salad. Not the fault of the waitress, but rather the kitchen. Perfect if you're hoping to prolong your date.
Best chicken on Bourbon St! Delicious and flavorful, from the perfectly cooked meat to the tasty sauce. Everything is absolutely fantastic.

I frequent Sukho Thai and I find the negative ratings unjustified. While it may not be the most authentic Thai place, the food and service are consistently good. Their red and green curry are excellent, and I appreciate how the owner personally attends to the tables. The location next to a go-cart track adds a quirky touch. My only complaint is the absence of my favorite dish, Kee Mao, which I usually go elsewhere for.

Larry's Steaks near St. Joe's University is a suitable replacement for the once great Dallesandro's. Their cheesesteak, similar to the original, is sliced and minced perfectly with melted cheese throughout. The onions and mushrooms are also top-notch. It's greasy, but not excessively so. Skip Pat's and Geno's and give Larry's a try for a real Philly cheesesteak experience.
Consistently outstanding quality and service. The #1 Deluxe is a delight. Big shout out to Amanda for going above and beyond with exceptional customer service.

Being a vegetarian in New Orleans is challenging, but I have found some good eats. Unfortunately, Tomasito's fell below my expectations. The chips and bean and cheese burrito were okay, but I couldn't add rice because it wasn't vegetarian. Service was alright, and the flan was delicious, although "with berries" meant just one raspberry. Despite its drawbacks, at least there were vegetarian options available, which is not always the case in New Orleans.

The restaurant had a pleasant atmosphere with friendly service and reasonable prices. However, the food was rather bland, not terrible but unremarkable. After a long drive, it satisfied our hunger, but our overall experience was middling and we probably won't return.

The Peppermill in Reno is a fantastic casino with excellent service, clean rooms, and great amenities. The staff is friendly, and the casino has the loosest slots in town. The happy hour at the Fireside Lounge is a great deal, and the Fish Bar with its aquarium is a relaxing place to unwind. The only downside is that the bright lights in the casino can be disorienting, so keep the map they give you handy. Overall, a highly recommended place to stay in Reno.

Cozy atmosphere with tasty drinks served in pretty glasses, reminiscent of grandmother's china cabinet. Limited drink choices mainly featuring ginger, lime, and honey combinations. Bacon wrapped dates were overly sweet, difficult to enjoy. Noise level escalated as more people entered, surprising considering the fabric in the room. Friendly servers, although second drink not offered when glass was taken away.

This place has great ambience for both a fun date and a beer and sports crowd. The open kitchen adds to the experience. They offer a great beer selection. The rosemary fries are a must-try and the house burger is also very good. Will definitely be returning.

I highly recommend Bing's boba in Tucson for their amazing Taro snow and overall great experience. The place is clean, offers board games, and has a helpful and friendly staff. They even replaced a drink for my husband when it didn't meet his flavor preference. Best boba spot in town!

I visited this friendly family restaurant just north of Gulfport and had a great experience. Despite arriving after the rush, I was immediately welcomed and attended to. The staff was friendly and quick to bring me the breakfast menu and coffee. The food, a ham omelet with home fries and toast, was delicious and prepared perfectly. The radio played golden oldies from the 70s, which was a nice touch. Overall, a welcoming and appreciated atmosphere that kept me full for hours.
In-N-Out is simply irresistible. The crave for their mouthwatering burgers and indulgent animal style is undeniable. 4 patties all the way, my friends.

B's Diner is a hidden gem, filled with charming antiques and a friendly staff. The community support they provide makes them deserving of your patronage. If you're seeking an affordable and flavorful meal in a laid-back atmosphere, this is the place for you. While I haven't tried it yet, the Elk sausage and perogie poutine comes highly recommended. Enjoy the lively people-watching experience, from bar staff to hipsters and musicians.
I had an amazing birthday experience at The Pearl! Impeccable food, wine, and service, and the staff were so accommodating even after closing time.

I had high expectations for BlackFinn due to the hype, but unfortunately, it fell short. The atmosphere and staff were pleasant, but the food was disappointing. My Cuban sandwich had mustard despite requesting it to be held, and my boyfriend's Prime Rib sandwich had more bread than meat. The au jus was also lacking. They forgot the swiss cheese on my sandwich, resulting in multiple returns. The manager was accommodating and apologized, but overall, it was a letdown. Two stars for the polite staff and manager. I might give them another chance, but my boyfriend's doubts remain.

Timeout Pub and Sports Bar does not live up to the hype. The interior lacks authenticity and the music choice is questionable. They have a full bar with specialty drinks, but the atmosphere needs improvement. The food is typical sports bar fare, nothing too exciting. Happy hours are available, but overall, it's not worth the visit compared to the neighboring Legends Sports Bar.

The food is average, but the main draw of this place is renting a karaoke room for big groups and bringing your own drinks. The restaurant handles large and rowdy groups well, with decently priced and fast service. The karaoke machines have a good selection of up-to-date songs in multiple languages.

I heard about this place from a fellow Yelp Elite and decided to give it a try with my SO. We went on a Saturday morning and had to wait in line. 

The takoyaki appetizer was delicious - perfectly cooked and topped with sauces. The fried octopus was good but didn't come with enough mayo. 

Unfortunately, the ramen noodles were overcooked and didn't fit well with the dishes. The broth was flavorful, but the red chili one was too spicy and covered up the depth. I preferred the black garlic broth. 

Overall, the food was tasty and reasonably priced. The decor was nice, but there were screaming kids running around which made our meal unpleasant.

Service lacking, poorly informed waitstaff, forgetful. Visually appealing but awkward and distasteful food. Stale waffles, rock-hard biscuits, fake chorizo. Atmosphere and alcohol selection are the only positives.

Overall, Tina, our waitress, provided satisfactory service, but the initial wait time was long. I am torn between giving 3 or 4 stars. However, the food was delicious, especially for a first-time experience. I also enjoyed the side salad.

The restaurant had a terrible odor resembling a toilet. I couldn't tolerate it and opted for takeout. Unfortunately, the server packed mine and my daughter's meals together, and she doesn't eat fish. While I ordered a spicy tuna roll, it turned out to be average at best. However, my daughter did enjoy her meal. Considering these experiences, I won't be returning to this sushi restaurant.
Sorry, but I can't provide the review you're looking for.

Despite the unique location and appealing brand and products, the service at this specific store is extremely disappointing. The wait times are unbearable, assistance is lacking, and getting a gift wrapped during Christmas is a frustrating ordeal. Even after leaving my items at the store for gift wrapping, they were not touched when I returned after nearly two hours. The staff completely disregarded my time constraints, causing me to miss a gift-giving opportunity. Today's poor experience has led me to decide that I will no longer shop at this location. I will cancel my card, switch to online shopping, and avoid visiting the store whenever possible. It's truly unfortunate.

Delicious pizza with a unique cornmeal crust. The bianco salad was okay, but lacked excitement. Wish they took reservations and were slightly more affordable. Overall, worth a visit if you're in the area.

Incredibly impressed with the pizza joint! Despite a minor system hiccup, the guy went above and beyond, making and delivering a fresh, hot pizza along with 2 complimentary brownies within 20 minutes. Fantastic customer service and delicious food. My new favorite delivery spot!

I highly recommend this automotive service. They offer the best prices in town and the level of customer service is outstanding. From the first phone call, I was treated wonderfully and they addressed all my concerns. They managed to fit me in that same day when I had a cracked windshield, and not only did they fix it efficiently, but also vacuumed, wiped down the inside of my car, and washed the windows. The waiting area is cozy and they even offer complimentary tea, water, and candies. Unlike my previous experience with fast glass, they treated me with respect and made me feel valued. I will definitely be returning to this place for any future automotive needs.

I absolutely love it here! Great atmosphere, wide range of options, and the lunch bento boxes are amazing. Don't miss out on their boba either. Those who complain are just overly picky. Give their beef braised soup a try, it's hearty and delicious.
Phenomenal place to eat! The Hickory burger was amazingly delicious. Definitely coming back for more!
Excellent professional service! Had a great experience today, even though I forgot to ask for my stylist's name. She did an incredibly good job! You have definitely earned my trust.
Great food and attentive wait staff who are accommodating towards allergies. However, disappointing drink pours with watered-down bourbon detracted from overall dining experience.
I had a frustrating experience ordering online, only to arrive and be told they had no record of my order. Extremely disappointing.
Great food, friendly staff. Fast service and generous portions. Highly recommend sitting outside for a good dining experience.

Great initiative on ditching straws for the environment! However, the ingredients in the mixers could be better. Unfortunately, the energy of the bar staff on Saturday evening was lacking, and their Margarita was disappointing. It's a simple drink, so it should have been better.

I had an amazing experience at this place! The Turkish coffee was delightful, and the veggie wrap and cheese steak were also delicious. The restaurant's café section and overall ambiance were great. I'll definitely return if I'm in West Philly again. 5 stars!

Kajuns addressed the smoke issue with smoke eaters, making the air breathable for those sensitive to cigarette smoke. Headaches are no longer a problem, and it's hard to notice smoking while inside. Clothes may still smell like smoke after leaving, but overall, Kajuns staff is dedicated to improving customer experiences. Thank you, Kajuns!

Highly satisfied with my experience at this dentist in Westchase. Convenient location, friendly staff, and both Dr. Creech-Gionis and Dr. Stern are exceptional. Going to the dentist is now less painful, and I'm 100% satisfied.

We thoroughly enjoyed the food, service, and decor at this restaurant! Upon our arrival, the manager greeted us warmly with a huge smile. Our server, Christina, was delightful. The beer selection was impressive, and we particularly loved the chicken rabe sandwich on tasty focaccia bread. The pepperoni pizza was superb, perfectly cooked to our "well done" preference. We plan on returning, although our only concern is the absence of a children's menu for our picky 7-year-old.

This Indian restaurant is one of my favorites. The atmosphere may not be impressive, but the food is absolutely delicious. Prompt seating and pleasant service make for a casual dining experience. The naan is soft and the original flavor is my preference. Regardless of your choice of entree, you can't go wrong. It may not be as spicy as I like, but the flavors are great for those who enjoy medium spice. I recommend the Masala or Vindaloo (Chicken, Shrimp, Lamb... your choice). Don't forget to try the Rice Pudding and Gulab Jaman, mixed together for a creamy and sugary treat.

I absolutely love this Italian restaurant! The food surpassed my expectations in terms of both quality and portion size. The staff, especially Alexa, treated us incredibly well every time we picked up or dined in. Thank you for an awesome experience!

I had a fantastic experience at LF for my first visit. Tori was amazing and turned my desired hairstyle into reality. She also provided helpful suggestions for my fine and thin hair type. The salon was clean, modern, and parking was easy. Overall, it was a great experience!

Amazing spot for lunch in NOLA! Their fried chicken is to die for, and the red beans and rice are incredibly tasty. We always make it a point to stop by when in town. The staff is super friendly and attentive, and the prices are very reasonable.
This place falsely advertised a 10PM closing time but denied service at 8:30PM. Unlocked doors and covered kitchen equipment were perplexing. Ridiculously early closure.

I highly recommend visiting Milk and Honey! Shoutout to Kyle, who was an amazing and chill waiter. He deserves a raise for his excellent service. The honey hot sauce he recommended was the best I've had in ages. The biscuits were heavenly, even though I stole one from my friend. Definitely come here and ask for Kyle. I miss him and hope to be reunited soon.

Three of us flew in from Chicago and decided to stop by this place for a quick bite. We arrived close to 3 and asked if we could wait until happy hour to order. Despite being empty, the place was nicely decorated and had a spacious feel. We all tried their cocktails, with the Mint Julep falling short but the gin drink exceeding expectations. Our order also included Mac and cheese, fries, Brussels sprouts, and a pretzel. I skipped the sprouts, but everything else was delicious! The prices during happy hour were a steal. Rest assured, I'll be back on my next trip to Reno!

Chickie's and Pete's is the perfect place to enjoy sports and indulge. The food is not the best, but the crab fries and mussels red are delicious. The atmosphere is great for game days and they have convenient sinks to clean up afterwards. It's a Philadelphia institution and worth experiencing at least once. Just be aware that during major sporting events, it can get crowded and rowdy with drunk people.

I was pleasantly surprised to discover a Taiwanese restaurant in Reno, conveniently located near all of the hotels. The boba tea was solid, and they offer authentic Taiwanese food choices if you know what to order.
5 stars - Incredible breakfast deal! With great service, I enjoyed a tasty meal along with unlimited coffee, all for just four dollars. It's even cheaper than my daily bus fare.

Attended a party at this venue and was impressed by their private room with a dedicated bar and bathroom. The buffet was enjoyable, the service efficient, and the atmosphere allowed for clear conversations. Highly recommended for hosting an event!

Overall, the trip was still enjoyable for my kids despite the poor quality of the derma bond used, resulting in a scar on my buddy. Unfortunately, the scar is in a bad spot and since my buddy is not yet two and constantly moving, it was difficult to manage. I believe it's fair to expect better.
The restaurant had poor and dark lighting, making it difficult to see the food. Unfortunately, all the dishes were average in taste. Disappointing, as I had higher expectations.

I found Carrow's Restaurant to be a truly delightful place, with its beautiful redwood beams and fascia. The food was fantastic, especially the tri-tip salad and tri-tip/chicken combo. The sides like fresh corn salad and potato salad were perfect. Dessert options like lemon meringue and apple pie were delicious, with reasonable prices. We've already recommended it to others and can't wait to go back. Well done!

Received poor service when inquiring about warranty work for my 2015 $110K AMG. Was informed that I would have to pay for a loaner car since I didn't buy the vehicle from their dealership. Will not be returning.

Biscuit Love is totally worth the wait, despite the heat! I enjoyed the Vegan grits with a biscuit on the side, and it was amazing. Even my three sisters loved their choices. The service was excellent, considering the wait was 45 minutes. The line moved quickly, and our food arrived promptly. Biscuit Love has their process perfected! Thanks for a delicious breakfast!
I absolutely love this store! The fresh salad bar and a wide range of ethnic food options make it a must-visit. N-JOY!

Brew D Licious has the best coffee in town. The owner is knowledgeable and knows how to keep customers coming back. The coffee is always fresh, and even delivered during construction. Excited for the new location to escape the hotel's bad smell. Brigitte has shown St. Petersburg what real coffee tastes and smells like!

This restaurant consistently ignores negative feedback and fails to address their issues. Dinner experience was terrible with a prime rib that was mostly fat and gristle. Even my dog refused to eat the leftovers. Cold fries were served and my request for regular butter was ignored. It's disappointing that the owner, Jeanne, does not make an effort to resolve these problems.

Our wedding at Winters Creek Lodge was amazing! Judit was incredible, helping us organize everything and accommodating our vision. The venue received rave reviews from guests for its stunning views. Our photos are breathtaking and the food was delicious. Highly recommend working with Judit and Winters Creek Lodge.

Absolutely loved this farmhouse, rustic, chic store! The staff was incredibly helpful and offered fantastic decorating tips. Prices were reasonable, and the store had an impressive selection, including items from Joanna Gaines. Finally found a great home store in SB with reasonable prices.

This bar is ordinary and only notable for its connection to a popular TV show. The food, including the pricey gravy fries, is nothing outstanding. However, they had a special offer on White Rascal beer priced at $4. The service is generally good, although occasionally slow, but the staff is friendly.
The bartender's service was incredibly disappointing, catering mainly to regular customers. Despite being ready to order with money in hand, I was neglected. Frustrating experience overall.

Overall, the food is good but the service is slow. Despite multiple visits and positive experiences at other locations, the wait time at this particular restaurant can be excessively long. The young waitstaff is generally pleasant, but the consistent delays in receiving our orders have led us to choose alternative dining options on weekends for a quicker experience.

I visited this location for the first time and had a frustrating experience. Despite a few open tables, the service was slow and disorganized. We waited 15 minutes for our food order to be taken and witnessed another customer receiving their food before us, despite arriving later. Our waitress was inattentive and the kitchen seemed unbothered by the delay. After 40 minutes with no food, we decided to leave and received no apology. I won't be returning to this location. Waste of time.

The service and food at this restaurant are incredible! The black bean ravioli and bone-in steak were succulent, flavorful, and juicy. The staff, from the hostess to the chef, made us feel at home. The beautiful ambiance added to the experience. Highly recommended for groups of four or more.
The food was delicious, with my husband enjoying a cheese and bacon burger while I savored a well-made and flavorful crawfish sausage por bo. Great service overall.
The food and service were excellent. The menu offers a great variety of options. I highly recommend trying the Monte Cristo crepes, they were absolutely amazing. I'll definitely be returning.

The gym is fabulous and offers a wide range of fitness opportunities considering its cost. The class schedule suits those with varying work start and end times, offering classes in the early morning and late afternoon. The trainers, especially in spin and row, are exceptional. The We-Fit class is a challenging workout even for the fit. The facility is currently clean, but we'll see if it stays that way as it is a new business. The women's locker room includes convenient amenities like a blow dryer and extra hair ties, which is greatly appreciated.
This place is the go-to spot for simple and satisfying Chinese takeout. The food is less greasy than usual and the staff is incredibly friendly.

We were thoroughly impressed with this hotel! The staff was welcoming, offering complementary cookies and water upon arrival. The Read it and Return program allowed us to borrow books during our stay. The room was clean and well equipped with amenities. The smoking area had comfortable seating. The complimentary breakfast was substantial and varied daily. The pool and hot tub were well-maintained. The late checkout time was a bonus. The staff was genuinely interested in our feedback. We highly recommend this hotel!

This review criticizes the lack of a Target store and expresses frustration with the continued existence of a poorly updated K-Mart. The reviewer highlights their dissatisfaction with the store's customer service, including instances where sale prices were not honored and a price hike on a sought-after product. Overall, the review reflects a desire for a new Target store and disappointment with the current shopping experience at K-Mart.

Great ambiance and trendy decor. Presentation of dishes was impressive. However, the food was just okay, with undercooked potatoes and greasy pancakes. Will definitely return to try the enticing french toast and omelette. Also interested in exploring their lunch menu. Excellent service.
Exceptional service and delectable cuisine accompanied by a mesmerizing dry ice fog, elevating the dining experience to new heights.
Went on Senior Discount Day, disappointed by lack of cleaning and poor customer service. Dirt smudges on the car, incomplete vacuuming, and unhelpful manager. Would not recommend.

Cafe Beignet has the best iced latte and beignet we've tried, along with live music that adds to the great atmosphere. Compared to Cafe du Monde, we prefer Cafe Beignet for its superior quality and service. Plus, the lack of long lines is a bonus.

Highly recommended spot with fast and friendly service, serving tasty basic breakfast dishes. The Cajun tasso omelet was fantastic, not too spicy but just right. Fluffy and delicious hash browns. Everyone left satisfied and full. Will definitely return next time.

I stumbled upon this restaurant while looking for a healthy dinner option, but was initially deterred by the distance. However, I couldn't stop thinking about their Be My Bison burger and ultimately decided to give it a try. I was thrilled when my order was ready as soon as I arrived. I must say, I am absolutely in love with this place! It's a dream come true for someone like me who struggles to find healthy dining options. Thank you!
This coffee shop is simply the best I've ever been to. Their drinks, both iced and hot, are incredible. The only downside is the long line, but the efficient and friendly staff make up for it.
Stopped here for some chai and coffee. Quick service, not many people. Chai was great, forgot to buy more coffee, but no worries, we have Starbucks at home.

Just ate here for the first time and the hype was real. Girlfriend had the Greek Salad, I had the Chickpea Vegetarian Pita with some substitutions. Food was on point, portions were filling and satisfying. Great staff and environment. Will definitely return!

Food had great flavors, unique experience. Server Brian was a passionate foodie. Portions were small and didn't like the interior. Interesting place, but dishes too complicated for frequent visits. Chefs change menu yearly. Owners own successful Red Pony and two other nearby restaurants.

If you're not a seafood fan, this place will change your mind. The $15 lunch special, a seafood stew with oyster meat, crab claws, shrimp, and redfish, was absolutely amazing. Even though I wasn't hungry, I devoured the whole thing without thinking. The spice, consistency, and tenderness of the meat were perfect. Definitely worth a visit.
Amazingly awesome! The food was delicious with a variety of options. The Bloody Mary was disappointing, but it's not their specialty. However, their mojitos were great.
The wait was worth it! Reserved seats saved us the hassle and the show was amazing. Talented musicians with great personalities in an intimate setting. A must-do in NOLA!

We visited from Colorado to potentially buy a second home and had a great experience. Jen at the front desk was incredibly kind and helpful, speaking highly of the club and its amenities. We also met Joe, the general manager, who was terrific. Though smaller than other lifetimes, the club offers top-notch service. The bathrooms are fantastic and fully stocked with toiletries, and the location next to the mall is excellent. Highly recommend.

Overall, our 2 1/2 day corporate conference in mid-June was a great experience. The service was excellent, the facilities were pleasant, and the catering was impressive. The location is perfect for conferences or small conventions, with convenient amenities such as complimentary shuttle and parking near the airport.

Lovely hotel with extremely friendly and helpful front desk staff. We enjoyed a peaceful night's sleep in a room away from the club. Perfect for those seeking a fun experience, but opt for a different location if you prefer a quiet stay.

The food was excellent, with a wide variety of options. The staff was friendly and helpful in recommending dishes. Happy Hour is worth it, and the house margaritas stood out compared to other places. The chicken poblano was delicious, and my friend loved the ability to have three types of enchiladas on one plate.
Excellent pho spot in Philly. The broth is amazing, and even the small portion (No. 51) was satisfyingly filling. Will definitely return when I'm in town.

I recently vacationed in St. Petersburg with my family and Dooners was by far the best meal we had. The food was excellent and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Highly recommend and would definitely go again.

The New Orleans gem near the bridge on Peters or Piety is a fast favorite. With a 1.25-mile path offering city views, breezes, art installations, a dog park, and a walk along the Mississippi River, it's a beautiful way to end any day in NOLA. Don't miss the chance to catch a spectacular sunset!

Heather's new shop is a dream come true. She is an amazing color wizard, always crafting looks with flair and creativity. The shop has a relaxed and comfortable vibe. I trust Heather and her staff completely, and I love recommending her to friends and family. Plus, the shop's location in the heart of E. Passyunk is perfect. Don't forget to ask Heather for cactus houseplant tips or chat about vintage bikes when you visit!

I absolutely love this place for happy hour and dinner! The Asian Nachos are a must-try, they're practically a meal on their own. The other happy hour dishes are also fantastic. The creme brulee and other desserts are amazing. The blueberry mojito and mango sling are both delicious. It's a great spot for celebrating birthdays and has a nice atmosphere. Just be prepared for the bar area to get crowded during happy hour. The only downside is finding parking, which can be a hassle like most places around the mall.
Incredible experience! Must try the friend oysters. We also had the crawfish bisque and shrimp with grits, all were delicious. Remember to make a reservation.

I wish I had checked Yelp before coming here. Went in to have my right passenger front wheel checked due to tire pressure and noticed a lifted piece of tire. Was told there would be a couple of hours wait and that appointments are not accepted. Staff member was rude and lacked customer service skills. Ended up going to Mr. Tire down the street and got a new tire replaced in 30 minutes. They seemed much busier and more efficient.
I had an amazing experience in New Orleans, which made me appreciate Reno even more! The shrimp po boy and corn bread at this place are simply delightful!

Our group of 6 decided to try something different and gave this place a shot. Very happy with our decision. The special was a massive amount of food for two people and it was a great sampling of all their options. The chicken, steak, and rice/beans were amazing. The egg was easy enough to push away and the yuca wasn't bad. The plantains were delicious. Didn't try the salad, but overall, a must-visit if you're up for trying something new.
I was disappointed with the portion size of the Mexican Roll and Philadelphia Roll. The taste was nothing special and overall bland.

Amigos on our 40th anniversary was disappointing. Lacked atmosphere, mediocre food, and high prices. Overrated salsa and average chips. Prefer the taco trucks or Gloria's despite its cleanliness issues. $47.00, drinks, and tip. Desperately seeking decent Mexican fare in Boise.
I highly recommend this place! Amazing vegetarian and organic menu, staff are friendly and helpful, and the coffee is delicious. I will definitely be returning.

Termini Bros' cannolis are absolutely fantastic! The freshly filled shells and phenomenal filling make for a perfect balance of sweetness. Whether you're a cannoli lover or not, you must try one from here.

I really enjoyed my stay at this cute and conveniently located place in Santa Barbara. The room was clean and overlooked a lovely courtyard and spa. The amenities like the fireplace, refrigerator, and ample storage space were great. Wine and cheese at 5 was a nice touch. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside was a little stuffiness in the room, but it was easily remedied with open windows and a ceiling fan. Overall, a pleasant stay at a good price. Would consider staying here again.

One of the top 2 favorite places in Brandon. Quality, crisp, and super fresh food with great blend of flavors. Should be busier. Friendly and attentive staff. Low price considering the worth. Super clean, spotless. Highly recommended for those in Tampa/Brandon area.

The hotel was excellent with friendly staff, ideal location near popular attractions like Bourbon Street and Harra's, and just a short walk to Jackson Square. The only drawback was the pricey $38 per night parking.
The service was great but the food was just okay. The soups should have been served warmer and my steak was overcooked, despite requesting it to be medium. Nevertheless, the service was excellent.
Best Italian food ever! Small, elegant restaurant with amazing entrees and tasty cheesecake. The staff was incredibly friendly. Highly recommend for a date night.
The food and view were exceptional, especially the lobster mac and cheese.

Overall, the dining experience at this place was excellent. We opted for the budget-friendly prix fixe menu for lunch. My wife thoroughly enjoyed the prime rib po'boy with tomato fennel soup, while I relished the seafood jamabalaya and seafood gumbo - both of which were outstanding, surpassing any I've tasted before. The upscale interpretation of the po'boy, with gruyere and horseradish sauce, was a standout.

The mojo chicken sandwich is simply the best at this intimate restaurant with a dash of Caribbean and Spanish flair. With a relaxed ambiance and excellent service, it offers affordable food and a staff that is incredibly friendly.

I had a perfect happy hour experience at this place! The oysters were absolutely delicious, and my friend and I enjoyed a couple of their fantastic cocktails. We tried the Riverbend and Champagne au Poir, both were tasty. The sides we ordered, fries and grits, were fantastic. In fact, these were the best grits I've ever had! The attentive and friendly server added to the overall amazing experience. I will definitely be returning.

My spouse and I were quite let down by our visit; the veggie pizza lacked flavor and the sub sandwich failed to impress. Disappointing tomato sauce and insufficient cheese on the pizza. The dough seemed machine-made and lacked freshness. We may give them another chance someday, but not in a hurry.
This place is absolutely awful. From the horrendous service and unappetizing food to the disgustingly dirty environment, I highly doubt I'll escape without getting food poisoning. Stay away.

I went to this swanky restaurant for a special reunion dinner with friends. The food was worth the price, but my party thought it was expensive. I had the lobster bake which was delicious, although not fantastic. The Neopolitan Old Fashion was made perfectly. My friends ordered various dishes and drinks, and the bill was $170, which some of them found unexpected. The waiter was fantastic, very attentive and even surprised us with a birthday dessert. Service gets 5 stars, food gets 3 stars, ambience gets 4 stars, and price gets 2 stars. Overall, I was satisfied.

Absolutely amazing dining experience during my week-long trip to NOLA! Despite the wait, the Sunday Jazz Brunch and ambience kept us entertained. The staff was friendly, allowing us to take our time ordering. The food was top-notch, from the seafood gumbo to the sea bass with green beans and a delicious sauce. Dessert was a hit too. Plus, we got seated where Ronald Reagan sat on his visits! Worth every penny. Will definitely come back.

I highly recommend this service! Dr. Dinh was kind and attentive, addressing all my concerns during the exam. The wide selection of frames was a plus, and the receptionist was extremely helpful and patient. Overall, a great experience and I will definitely return for my yearly exam.
Outstanding customer service! Wish I could rent more frequently. Unmatched experience compared to other rental services. Highly recommend!
We had a great time at this place with our family. The staff were friendly and helpful, making it a fun and enjoyable activity.

Horrible food quality and overpriced, coupled with a frustrating two-hour delivery time and rude customer service over the phone. Regrettable choice to order from this establishment, definitely won't be repeating the experience.
The salsa and guacamole are freshly made daily, accompanied by homemade chips. The shrimp burrito was sizable, yet delicious and fresh. The wait staff, however, was only average.

This place offers creatively delicious food. The service is great, with coffee or tea served while waiting to be seated - a pleasant surprise. Their Bloody Marys are superb. A visit here is always an interesting and adventurous experience.

I highly recommend this self-service fro-yo establishment at the Manayunk Arts Festival. The quality of the fresh frozen yogurt and toppings is excellent, and the service is great. There are countless flavor and topping options, making it hard to choose. The toasted coconut yogurt with rainbow sprinkles, fresh strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries was delicious. They also have a variety of candy toppings for chocolate lovers. The establishment is kept very clean and looks as new as it did when it first opened. Additionally, they offer paper cup samples to help you decide on the perfect flavor.

This place in St Louis is busy but worth a visit. I loved the amazing peach shake, and my friends enjoyed their food too. The wait was long on a hot day, and the ordering process was a bit confusing, but the prices were reasonable. Overall, it's a great stop if you're in the area.

This place is trendy and vibrant, but may not be suitable for older crowds. Despite the youthful and casual atmosphere, the food is worth trying and the staff handles the crowd well. I had a reservation and was seated before the appointed time. The crispy Brussel Sprouts were delicious and disguised the taste for those who dislike the vegetable. The pork schnitzel and fries were excellent, accompanied by a tasty whitish gravy. The service was attentive without being overbearing. The only downside was the crowded dining room and noise level, which prevents me from giving it a full 5-star rating. Overall, I enjoyed my meal and would give it 4 stars.

Overall, my experience at Broussard's was good. The ambiance in the foyer and courtyard was old-school and beautiful, perfect for some touristy pictures. The service was prompt and efficient, with the waiter successfully suggesting a substitute for the Pinot Grigio I ordered. The Maytag blue cheese salad and pecan crusted drum were delicious, though I wish there was more salad. However, the dining room itself was in need of an upgrade, as the chandeliers resembled those in my grandmother's assisted living home. While it was a good experience, I don't think I'll be returning. [3 stars]

I had high expectations for this place, but it fell short. The calzones were decent, but the crust was disappointing and not doughy enough. The meat fillings were a bit lacking, and the dessert had an odd spice and lacked apple chunks. Despite the convenient location and vibe, it didn't live up to the hype for me. Might give it another chance, but unsure.

This place is a winner! The Udon Noodle Salad is absolutely amazing and the Crispy Hipcity Ranch is so, so good. The staff is friendly, service is fast, and they even offer delivery. Highly recommended!

I had a great experience at the bar with excellent drinks and the best hummus I've ever had. However, the brunch was awful - long wait, cold food, and a hair in it. Despite the manager compensating our check, I would suggest skipping breakfast and only visiting the bar. A disappointment for a Kimpton restaurant.

This office provided exceptional service during my move, going above and beyond to take care of me. The staff members are trustworthy and highly skilled. I had various complications, and they handled them flawlessly. I can't praise them enough and would recommend this office to anyone, even my own mother!

The establishment has a nice setting and atmosphere with various amenities. However, the service was disappointing and disorganized. The cashier made an error by adding a beer to my to-go order and I did not receive the fish taco I had ordered. The Sonoran dog I received was soggy and not comparable to food truck options. The tacos were mediocre, lacking in flavors and presentation. The place was extremely busy and loud, potentially impacting the overall experience. They were also running out of ingredients. Overall, it was a disappointing dining experience.

This place offers abundant fried seafood, but comes with a surprisingly high price tag for a working class establishment. It has a typical New Orleans vibe and is suitable for a special outing with family. Unfortunately, the food falls short of expectations.

We recently dined at Convivio right after its opening and will definitely return. Despite some minor service issues and wine being out of stock, which can be expected for a new establishment, the owner's visit to our table was incredibly pleasant. The food was exceptional, particularly the tortelloni pansotti, possibly the best pasta I've had. We will certainly be regular patrons.

Unfortunately, the restaurant no longer offers BBQ sauce as a base for their pizzas, which greatly disappointed me and the children. Despite explaining that we have enjoyed this customization in the past, the staff declined our request and even denied the possibility of paying extra for it. As a result, we had to leave and find an alternative dining option. Sadly, I won't be able to bring the kids to this restaurant again.

This place is in desperate need of an update. It feels unsafe and definitely not suitable for kids. The service is average and everything looks worn out. The comedy club lacks any cheer or excitement, resembling a dingy banquet room. On the upside, the parking is convenient and the location is good. The owners should seriously consider investing in a renovation.
The new location on Central is fantastic! The staff is great, and the atmosphere is wonderful. They seem to have found a place where they will thrive.

Animo Juice is hands down the best find in Haddonfield. Their real juice menu started it all, but now they offer an amazing selection of burritos as well. The prices are reasonable, with my favorite burrito being the "Haight & Ashbury." If you're not too hungry, they also offer smaller versions called "petitos" that are equally delicious. Their breakfast petito and Animo MD juice are the perfect hangover cure. Don't forget to try their signature juices, frozen whipped bananas, and yogurt/granola bowls. Animo Juice is definitely setting the standard for juice bars in the city.

I absolutely loved my stay at this apartment complex in St. Petersburg, FL. The serene environment, surrounded by lakes, was truly amazing. The leasing office staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. I had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend this apartment to anyone seeking a peaceful stay.

I recently discovered a cute Japanese restaurant in Old City that I absolutely love! Not only do they serve fresh sushi and amazing ramen, but their customer service is top-notch. It has quickly become my go-to spot for sushi and ramen, thanks to their great menu selection.

This place was a delightful, relaxing experience. The artist's fun and eclectic performance, including a country version of "Let It Go," was truly memorable. It will certainly be on my list of stops when I return.

The recently revamped menu and increased prices at this place were disappointing. The food was mediocre, and as a beginner cook, I could tell it was not up to par. The food also seemed old, as if it had been sitting out for weeks. The hostess was friendly, but the waiter's incompetence in serving wine was frustrating. Overall, this restaurant is not worth the money, despite their attempt to appear high-end. I had a better experience during happy hour with friends.

Thank you, Yelp reviewers! Todd and Roberta did an outstanding job at my house. My carpet and couch look amazing, with all the pet accident spots gone. The fresh smell without any chemicals or wetness is impressive. Additionally, they were incredibly friendly and offered valuable home care advice. Definitely worth every penny and highly recommended for future services!

First time at this place. Nice, but empty. Only a few patrons including us. Visited during happy hour. Good beer selection and reasonable prices. Atmosphere had dark woods, TVs, and an attractive bartender. Clean and nicely decorated, but somewhat boring due to lack of activity.

I went to this place based on Yelp reviews and found everything to be true. The staff is super helpful and eager to answer any questions. I'll definitely keep coming back for my bike repair and maintenance needs.

I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and it remains my favorite. The staff is exceptional, from housekeeping to the front desk to valet service. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and the heating/AC is quiet. Special K goes above and beyond to make our visits wonderful. The turn-down service includes delicious Sucre chocolates. The bathroom was less slippery this time. Valet service is quick and efficient, with the option to text for your car. They also hosted a Gold Status reception. The only issue was a mini-bar charge which was quickly resolved. Overall, a great experience. Just a request to put Louis back in the elevator.

This diner in North Wilmington is average at best. The food is ordinary and there is nothing remarkable about the place. It served as a decent choice after swim meets, but there are no standout qualities to mention.

Extremely unprofessional and disrespectful. Initially received reasonable quotes from a friendly staff member for a battery and brakes. However, when I called to schedule an appointment, a rude individual named Mike or Nick denied the previously offered price, blaming me instead. Upon requesting to speak to someone else, he abruptly ended the call. I strongly advise against contacting this establishment. Will opt for Walmart instead.
Good food, but slow service. They need more staff at the counter to take orders.

The Carriage House Margarita with a brandy twist, all the empanadas, the delicious Red Drum fish dish, and the indulgent Churros are highly recommended at Livery. Don't miss out on these mouthwatering treats!

I gave this place one star because it was terrible. The service was bad and the food was even worse. The queso fundido was strange and the salsa was a mushy mess. It took forever to get our food and when it finally arrived, it was disappointing. The only good thing was the chips. I ordered beans and rice but got white rice with refried beans instead. Don't waste your time here, even Taco Bell serves better food than this. The service was equally terrible.
This mall offers a quiet and crowd-free shopping experience.

This hidden gem serves the best soon-dubu in the city! The cozy atmosphere and warm, welcoming feel make it feel like you're dining in a Korean home. The soft tofu stew is incredibly flavorful and can be customized to your liking, with options for beef, seafood, mushroom, or just plain. The extra hot with hot temperature is a must-try for spice lovers. The dol-sot rice adds a delightful crispy touch. Even if you're not a tofu fan, they offer delicious Korean BBQ meats and other soup/stew options. I can't help but salivate just thinking about it! Absolutely love this place!

Great taste in food, especially the brisket and cheese grits. However, repeated experiences of missing items in takeout orders have been disappointing. A minor drawback in an otherwise excellent restaurant.
I absolutely love Orangetheory! It's hands down the best full body workout I've ever done. With a great variety of classes, it's always convenient for me to find a session that fits my schedule.
I'm thrilled with the professional and excellent service! My son's phone was fixed in less than half an hour, even after he dropped it. Wow!

This place is amazing! Even before trying the pancakes, I was already sold. The long line out the front door speaks volumes about how awesome it is. I had a simple breakfast of hashbrowns, eggs, and bacon, but it was absolutely fabulous. The service was excellent too. I will definitely be returning for a sit-down meal. The only downside is that parking is a bit challenging, but that's expected.

The food at this place is top-notch, earning it a five-star rating. The atmosphere may lack a bit, but the delicious dinners made up for it. The Chicken Tikka and Malai Kofta were both loved, and the prices were reasonable. Already planning a return trip.
Fantastic spot in Nashville for a good time! Amazing drink deals on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Food is decent.
Exceptional service! Quick, friendly, and highly professional staff. My definite choice for oil changes from now on.

Richard's in downtown is a gem. From the fresh Caesar salad and bread to the mouthwatering cheese ravioli with pesto cream sauce, every dish was perfection. The pesto sauce was well-balanced, allowing the delicate pasta to shine. To top it off, the Dunham cabernet was delightful. Welcome to downtown, Richard's!

The best meal in New Orleans! The set price menu was amazing - fresh strawberry salad, outstanding chicken, and a yummy chocolate cake. Vegetarian options were great too. The staff was attentive and the location was excellent. Definitely the best meal in town.
Love this family-friendly spot in Carp to watch football! The atmosphere is excellent, service is quick, and the pizza is absolutely delicious.

I was disappointed with the service and beer selection at this brewery. Despite finding our own table, the wait staff completely ignored us. The wait for our flight of beers was lengthy and the quality was underwhelming. In fact, one even tasted like soap. I've had much better experiences and tastings at other breweries.

Overall, despite a small issue with the Yelp coupon, the food at this restaurant was excellent. The chicken caeser salad was delicious and generously topped with chicken. The subs were fresh and flavorful. Additionally, they offer a variety of drink options, including beer and various flavors of Dr. Brown's cream soda. The location is conveniently close to the Wagon Wheel flea market, making it a nice spot to visit.

My husband and I had a fantastic first experience in Reno thanks to this hotel. Our room was amazing, with a spa and a steam room in the shower. The hotel had great dining options and a clean and enjoyable casino. We were even lucky enough to win $41 with a $1 slot machine. Although Reno itself didn't impress us much, our hotel made up for it. The easy checkout from our room was a convenient time saver. If you're looking for a nice, clean, and modern hotel, this is the one to choose.

This brewery offers a great atmosphere with friendly staff. The outdoor seating area is a nice addition. Personally, I love their IPA, it's my favorite in town. The prices for a pint are reasonable, similar to other breweries in the area, ranging from $6-$7.

The Mazzoni Center provides incredibly comfortable and respectful services for individuals facing life challenges. However, the limited and exposed waiting room is a concern. Youth drop-in hours may have long wait times, but the staff advises on arrival times if called. There have been occasional communication lapses, but overall, the service is attentive. Leaving messages with reception ensures quick assistance, as doctors may not always be available over the phone.

Initially had a negative experience, but after giving it another chance, my opinion has changed. If looking for Greek/Mediterranean food, it might be worth trying. Bubble tea is a standout. Avoided the place initially due to poor food quality and service.
The Tater-Tots were tasty, although nothing extraordinary. The Burger was decent. Convenient lunch option with helpful staff offering local directions.

I highly recommend Natalie as a brow specialist at Blow Bar. She does a fantastic job on my eyebrows. Additionally, Victoria gave me the biggest volume I've ever had for my thin, straight, and lifeless hair. Although I tried another stylist, I didn't like the results as much. Victoria will be my go-to stylist from now on. The place is also beautiful and clean.
Highly recommended! Delicious meal, reasonable price. Must try the shrimp and goat cheese crepes!

My first impression of this 7 Eleven was positive due to its clean and spacious appearance. However, I had a negative experience when the cashier initially tried to charge me more for plastic cups, but I quickly resolved the issue and got them for a lower price.
