The unscrupulous part was when the cashier and manager attempted to deceive me by claiming a higher price.

This place is a game changer for the neighborhood! The food is absolutely delicious, and I'm newly smitten by their southern Latin cuisine. The family who owns it is also very sweet. Exactly what the neighborhood needed!

Metamorphosis Tattoo Shop is worth giving five stars. Unlike other shops in Indianapolis, they run their business professionally and respect their customers. Trevor provided a fun and respectful 4-hour tattoo experience, giving me the tattoo I wanted in the location I desired. The prices are average, and they ask for a non-refundable deposit to ensure seriousness. Don't waste your time elsewhere, as Metamorphosis is a diamond in the rough. No rock star attitudes here. Can't wait to go back to Trevor.

I like the festive atmosphere and wide selection of Spanish music. The attentive service and ability to accommodate picky orders is a plus. The salad could be improved with better lettuce. The chicken soup is highly recommended and the friend who ordered it is a culinary expert. The queso fundido is also a must-try, but be cautious with adding chorizo to avoid greasiness.

I had a great experience purchasing a washer and dryer from Sears. Despite the negative reviews, I had no issues at all. The selection was excellent, the salespeople were knowledgeable, and the delivery was on time. The level of service exceeded my expectations, with the staff going above and beyond to give me the best price within my budget. They even checked for additional discounts. I received honest feedback and all my questions were answered. Highly recommend Sears!
Ordered food late at night and it took over 2 hours to arrive after calling twice. No utensils or napkins provided. Food was good, but terrible service. Will not order again.
Santa Barbara is an excellent place to eat, with quality food, exceptional customer service, and good value for money. The breakfast place is highly recommended for visitors.
I would not recommend this place, even if it's the only option at 2am. The basic general tso's did not meet my expectations. I suggest trying East Cuisine instead.

This place is absolutely amazing! The staff is incredible - from their exceptional work to their wonderful personalities. Jenne made me feel so comfortable during my first Brazilian and provided a fantastic blow-out. Plus, their sense of humor had me laughing throughout my visit. I'm eagerly looking forward to returning!

The fried rice is amazing and the Pho is the best I've had in Nashville. As a Seattleite, I'm picky about Vietnamese food, but this place exceeded my expectations. Highly recommend for first-timers and Vietnamese food enthusiasts!

Unless you fit a certain demographic, expect subpar service. Our waitress was more interested in socializing with older, wealthier patrons and neglected to check on us or our meals. Disappointed with the lack of attention despite the high cost.

I was excited to try Lee How Fook after reading positive Yelp reviews, but unfortunately, I was left disappointed. The small size of the restaurant didn't bother me, but it's advisable to make reservations due to limited tables. The service was adequate, although understanding the server was a bit difficult. As for the food, the appetizers were delicious with a flavorful dipping sauce. However, the sweet & sour chicken was overly sweet and the vegetables were undercooked. The pan-fried noodle dishes lacked flavor and the supposed spicy beef wasn't spicy at all. Overall, I left full but unsatisfied.

The best restaurant in Philadelphia with excellent food, attentive service, and a delightful dessert. The tahini and bread are addictive, the organic beef shishkabob is superb, and the purslane salad is dream-worthy. The chicken dish with black eyed peas, green peas, and fantastic rice is beyond words. The pistachio creme brulee is pure heaven. Despite the time constraints, the service was impeccable. This is a must-visit restaurant in Philly. Kudos to the chef!

This lunch menu is a real treat! The sandwiches are absolutely delicious, satisfying every taste bud. Although a bit pricey and on the smaller side, the quality makes it well worth it. Can't wait to try their steaks! Food and service both get a perfect 5/5, and the price gets a 4/5 for being a little high but great quality.

We were pleased with Terra's work as our wedding florist. She took the time to understand our needs and accommodate our budget. The florals were beautiful, and we loved the draping for the ceremony and reception. However, some flowers in the bouquets wilted during the day, possibly due to the heat. Overall, we were happy with Terra for our wedding.

I recently visited this restaurant and had a delicious meal. The beef dish and chicken on a stick were both fantastic, and I even took some food home, including a fantastic egg roll. The restaurant is a bit difficult to spot but can be found at the intersection of Keystone on Raymond, next to Burger King.
The food at this place is awesome! Fresh and delicious, especially the papaya salad and the spicy curry. The service was great, and they also offer take-out. Highly recommend!

The bakery not only offers delightful cookies, cupcakes, and puddings but also exceptional salted caramel cakes. The four-layered moist cake with caramel buttercream was truly amazing. I ensured the icing was made with real ingredients and it did not disappoint - the rich taste of butter and sugar was evident. The cake was both elegant and delicious, a rare combination.

Xtreme Tacos is my go-to place for delicious food and amazing service. I've ordered from them multiple times, and everything has been consistently delicious. The homemade chips are simply outstanding and must-have. The salsa and queso are perfect for dipping. In addition to the amazing food, the staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, especially the guy at the counter. Highly recommended!

Andres Richard Salon on Locust St is the place to go for exceptional hair care. Stephanie, a junior stylist at the salon, worked her magic and transformed my hair exactly as I wanted after a disappointing experience at other salons. I highly recommend their technical, creative, and expert services. This is now the only salon I trust with my hair.

This place is amazing! They serve the best burgers in New Orleans with excellent service. The food is fresh, and they make sure you are served promptly. We tried the Gator and deer burgers, which were delicious. Personally, I loved their buffalo wings. Their drinks are also great. We left extremely satisfied and will definitely return before leaving town.

Overall, the reviewer thought the restaurant was a little pricey but worth it. The service was initially slow, but improved once they got their menus. The food came quickly and was delicious, with the crab cake and fries being highlights. However, they had to sit in the bar area due to the time and the table was too small. The reviewer also mentioned a payment issue but was assured by the manager that it would be resolved.

HipCity offers a super lunch option for both meat-eaters and vegetarians. Their buffalo bella and crispy hipcity ranch sandwiches are amazing alternatives, and the green lemonade is a great pairing. The staff is friendly and efficient, but the small space can get congested and confusing during peak times. Overall, the food is great.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. The service was poor, with a rude and neglectful waitress. The food was undercooked and the wings were small. There was also a feather found in one of the wings, which was unacceptable. The manager was not very helpful either. I suspect we were treated differently because we were a same-sex couple. The only positive aspect was that the meal was comped. I will not be returning. 1 out of 5 stars.

Sally's offers a great variety of hair supplies, making it my go-to store for experimenting. The staff is friendly and products are usually well-stocked. However, I wish they had more knowledge about their products and the store appeared bigger, brighter, and cleaner. Overall, I'm satisfied with Sally's.

Merrigans is the go-to place in Tucson for honest and affordable RV repairs. While their phone communication may not be the best, their expertise and collection of parts for older RVs make up for it. Patience is rewarded with quality repairs at fair prices. Additionally, they offer a free 24-hour dump station and water. Choose Merrigans for a job done right without breaking the bank.
Highly recommended, perfect in every aspect - food, service, price, ambiance. Every menu item tried was delicious and healthy. Clearly prepared with love by the owner.

I had a must-have breakfast in New Orleans at a restaurant with a diner style atmosphere. The service was quick and our server was great. The Grits and Grillades, slow roasted beef with peppers and onions in a brown gravy over creamy Gouda cheese grits, was absolutely delicious. It exceeded my homemade version and will be a must-try again on future trips to New Orleans.
This Mexican restaurant exceeded my expectations - fantastic food, great drinks, and reasonable prices.

This place is fantastic! The brunch is delicious, the staff is incredibly friendly, and the cocktails are top-notch. The cute and comfy design adds to the overall delightful experience. As a lesbian, having a bar like this in the neighborhood makes me incredibly happy. I can't wait to bring my mom here for Mother's Day.
Highly recommend this place for brunch! The food is delicious, especially the grits with scallions and sour cream. Just remember to bring a sweater as it can get quite chilly in the room.

Overall, the staff at this dancewear store are friendly and attentive. They offer a range of quality products at reasonable prices. However, the limited options for men's dancewear can be disappointing. The location is convenient for city residents, and it's a good first stop when in need of new dancewear. However, there is a high probability of not finding the desired item three out of four times.

Modern Laundry is an exceptional establishment that I am thoroughly pleased with. The facility is always clean and has a pleasant ambiance, thanks to the employees who genuinely seem to enjoy their work. The fluff and fold service exceeded my expectations - my clothes were flawlessly cleaned and expertly folded, giving them a freshly-purchased feel. Notably, their use of environmentally friendly detergent further impressed me. Modern Laundry has effortlessly won me over, making laundry just another convenient stop on my to-do list.

I love this shop! The staff is friendly and always helpful with suggestions. The bait is top-notch and they have a great selection of tackle at unbeatable prices. I regret not shopping here sooner and now it's my go-to store for all my fishing needs. My only complaint is that there aren't more of these shops in town!
I highly recommend this local pho shop with a loyal clientele. The food is great, the staff is very nice, and the ingredients are fresh. Stop in and try their delicious dishes! 5 stars.

I visited this place during lunchtime on a Monday and sat at the bar. The service was prompt and efficient. Opted for the carne asada taco lunch special and was pleasantly surprised by its above-average quality. Extremely satisfied with my experience here.
Jake's is a decent franchise with delicious burgers, but lacks in ambiance and fries. Stick to the original location for a better overall experience.
Doan's is fantastic! Consistently great, friendly staff, and fast service. Perfect for a quick lunch!

This Philadelphia hotel is a gem. Cozy, modern rooms with chic decor that feels like a friend's apartment. Free breakfast delivered to your door and 24/7 lobby access to coffee, tea, water, and fruit. Polite and helpful staff. Some difficulty with parking and limited view from the room. Highly recommended.
Horrible service, slow and unprofessional staff, disappointing food. Definitely avoid this place.
City Parkの近くにある激安かき氷屋さんは最高です！夏のニューオーリンズの暑さにはぴったりで、公園に行った後にここでかき氷を楽しむのがおすすめです。味の種類も50種類以上あり、トッピングをしても５ドル以下なのでとてもお得です。値段も安く、ぼくはたったの$1.50で満足できました。最高のチョイスです！

Went for dinner on a Friday at 6pm, expecting a packed place, but luckily it wasn't. Staff is friendly, atmosphere is like Magnolia Journal. Food and drinks are pretty dang good. Minus a star for slow cocktail service and appetizer arriving with the main course. Understandable as they're new, and I've worked in hospitality before.

I absolutely love the convenience of having a groomer come to me instead of going to a salon. The price is competitive and possibly even better than others in the area. For my short-haired dogs, I pay $60 for my 65lb dog and $40 for my smaller dogs, which includes bathing, ear cleaning, nail grind, and anal gland expression if needed. The only drawbacks are no teeth cleaning, a fixed price regardless of the dog's size, and a slight feeling of judgement.

The lady who works here is a miracle worker! I brought in pants and a suit jacket that needed hemming and sleeve shortening, respectively. Despite the complexity and urgency, she completed the alterations in a day, delivering excellent, professional results. The suit now fits me perfectly for my business trip. They accept all major credit cards and have convenient hours. Will definitely come back.
This store has an amazing variety of products and exceptional customer service. It's a shame they don't have a branch in Ft. McMurray.

I recently used a gift certificate at this place after waiting for 6 months, and it was definitely worth the wait! It's the perfect lunch spot, and I fell in love with their mixed salad sandwich - absolutely delicious! The homemade ice cream is also incredibly tempting, and I can't wait to go back for more.
Excellent breakfast spot! Fluffy and perfect waffles, and the home fries were nicely smashed and crunchy. Friendly waitstaff, will definitely return!

The bar and staff are amazing, offering great service. However, the room upgrade for our honeymoon did not match our expectations. The bathroom had rust and stains, while the rest of the room was comparable to a Hilton. Despite these issues, I still rate it 4 stars due to the exceptional staff. The valet parking was expensive, so we chose to park a few streets away. Overall, I recommend this hotel if you want to be in the lively downtown area of St. Louis, with numerous bars and restaurants to explore on a Friday night.

Las Cazuelas is an excellent Mexican BYOB restaurant. The atmosphere is fun and festive, making it the ideal spot for a birthday celebration with friends. The margaritas made from our own tequila were a unique and enjoyable twist. The food is delicious, with fresh and tasty options like the guacamole appetizer and the flavorful shrimp entree. The restaurant accommodates dietary restrictions, as they cooked the vegetables in olive oil instead of butter for me. The prices are reasonable, especially considering the creative and inspired dishes offered. Overall, Las Cazuelas exceeded expectations and is a must-visit for a fun foodie experience.

This place is terrible. The hoagies are greasy and made me nauseous. The buffalo chicken sandwich was covered in too much blue cheese and greasy sauce, which was disgusting. All the food is overly greasy and over seasoned, they need to use fresher ingredients. The desserts are bland and not worth the money. The sodas are usually expired and flat. Overall, I hate everything about this place.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. The Chicken Marsala was thin, tough, and dry, while the pasta was undercooked and clumped together. Both dishes lacked flavor. The lasagne had a thin layer of pasta and lacked taste as well. Additionally, the staff cleared my friend's plate while she was away and had to bring her a new meal in a doggie bag. On the positive side, the atmosphere was great with live music, and I enjoyed dancing with my husband. However, the food was overpriced for its poor quality.
Highly recommend this place with its satisfying menu and trendy, clean atmosphere! Get there before 9 am to beat the crowd and enjoy the deliciousness without a long wait. Totally worth it!

I had a great breakfast experience at this place last weekend. The French toast with a side of fruit and a la carte fried egg was delicious. The staff accidentally dropped my egg, but they quickly replaced it. The vanilla latte was excellent, not needing any additional sweeteners. The patio seating was lovely, and even indoor seating provided a nice atmosphere with fresh breezes flowing through the open doors and windows. Overall, a really nice experience.

I'm thrilled this place is in Reno! The matcha and ube flavors are delicious and authentic. The staff is friendly and although they have room for improvement, their base is solid. The soft serve, cake, and sauces are perfectly balanced, not overly sweet. Can't wait for more flavors to be added!
I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this place. The atmosphere was pleasant, and it was a treat to have the brewery on-site. The drinks were great, and the waiter was both knowledgeable and kind.

Food has drastically declined in quality at this restaurant over the past year. The buffet offerings are overwhelmingly salty, the pulled turkey is tough, and the fish tastes like meat tenderizer. Vegetables are overcooked and have a putty-like texture. The only somewhat enjoyable dishes were the corn pudding and mashed potatoes. Desserts are mediocre, resembling store-bought quality. On a positive note, the service was good, with prompt drink refills and plate removal.
This place offers delicious food at an affordable price. The steak was tender and the shrimp were perfectly cooked. I would definitely return in the future.

I have purchased tires from Tires Plus in Flourtown multiple times, including this visit where I had 4 new Michelins mounted. The service was prompt, starting right on time with my scheduled appointment at 9:00. My car was worked on and returned to me within just one hour.

I stumbled upon this organic beer and burger spot and was pleasantly surprised. The menu offers both pre-made and customizable burgers, complemented by a selection of rotating beers and specials. The friendly staff and inviting atmosphere added to the overall experience. Just a heads up, burgers are served a la carte, so make sure to order sides if you'd like fries. Vegetarian options like sandwiches and salads are also available, making it a vegetarian-friendly spot.

The Gryphon Cafe is a hidden gem near Wayne Starbucks that attracts coffee aficionados with its serene ambiance and strong espresso lattes. While their baked goods may be hit or miss, the café supports a thriving local music scene with live performances on weekends.

Highly recommend this restaurant! Great old school atmosphere with 3 floors. The food is amazing, especially the veal, clams casino, mussles, pasta, and homemade garlic bread. The staff is friendly and helpful. Recently tried the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce and it became my new favorite dish. A must-visit place for food lovers!

The seafood restaurant on the edge of the pier offers a mixed dining experience. The clam chowder is excellent and worth ordering again, but the cioppino lacks flavor and variety of seafood. The crab salad sandwich is disappointing, with overpowering mayo and a lack of crab flavor. The overall atmosphere is better when seated outside, overlooking the ocean. Service is good, but expect a wait to be seated. While it's worth a visit, it's important to be selective with your order as the menu can be hit or miss.

Highly recommend this place! Love the organic, fresh, and delicious food. Variety of options and love that they support local farmers and fishermen. Carly's breakfast is a favorite with avocado, sourdough toast, fried egg, and sweet potatoes. Sooo good!

Delicious cakes, disappointing service. While the desserts were amazing, the service left much to be desired. Long wait time, inefficient packaging, and a barista who didn't understand how to make a simple iced coffee. The cakes were worth it, but the overall experience was not.

Tyson delivered exceptional service with a prompt and efficient turnaround. I approached him with an RV featuring a ford front end, and he promptly scheduled the repairs and completed them ahead of schedule. The necessary parts were ordered and ready the next day, allowing the team to quickly work on my vehicle. In just 3 days, my RV bumper was replaced, allowing me to hit the road again. I highly recommend Tyson's services and will only trust him with my vehicles in the future. Manny and Tyson are outstanding!
I stumbled upon the best burger joint on earth in Philly! Thanks to Alya & the Bareburger team for the healthy and delicious experience. Andrew von Gregor, LA guitarist.

Family-friendly and highly recommended, this pizza joint did not disappoint. As a self-proclaimed pizza connoisseur, I can confidently say this place ranks among the best. The staff was friendly and the food arrived promptly. A solid experience overall - I would gladly return and recommend it to others.

The hotel offers great value with a pleasant atmosphere. The king bed and tasteful furnishings were impressive. The Carousel bar was a fun experience, and the rooftop pool was perfect for hot days. However, beware of loud noise from the street-facing rooms, particularly on weekends. Additionally, ensure the removal of the extra $60 nightly charge for incidentals.

This restaurant used to be great, but it has gone downhill. The bathrooms were dirty, the service was rude, and the food was disappointing. We won't be returning when there are better restaurants in the area.

This Wawa store is a winner! Not only did they lower gas prices significantly upon opening, but they also offer a convenient automatic start/stop digital air pump. The staff is friendly and efficient, and the store layout is well-designed. A great experience overall!
Taco Review: Mediocre chips and salsa, average tacos.
This hidden gem is absolutely adorable! The staff is incredibly friendly and the cookie dough is to die for. We stumbled upon this place by chance and couldn't be happier. A definite must-visit!
I recently tried the pizza and knots at this beach location and I must say, it was fantastic! The spot had a great street presence and the staff really knew their stuff.

The Catbird Seat was underwhelming with a large, awkward entrance and strange seating arrangement. The drinks were average to bad, the crowd was stuffy, and the food was forgettable. The only highlight was the tenderloin, but overall, the experience was overpriced and disappointing.

Terrible experience! Bouncer was incredibly rude and refused to accept my passport and other valid forms of ID. Made me leave and refused to give me a chance to prove my identity. Very unprofessional and unacceptable behavior. Would not recommend.
I highly recommend these guys! Tony was incredibly helpful and fixed my flat tire for less than his initial estimate. Thank you!

The recent barbecued pulled pork burger at Johnny Rockets was a delicious and filling meal. The flavor was fantastic and the endless fries were a bonus. However, it's unfortunate that they no longer have the singing and dancing at this location since they moved. Overall, I've never had a bad experience here.

45 may not have any standout features, but it has a cozy "Cheers" atmosphere where everyone knows your name, even if you can barely see their face through the cigarette smoke. The smoke never bothers me, but it turns off some of my friends. The laid-back and divey vibe is what draws me here, and the spread of food during game days is a nice touch rarely seen in bars now. Baseball season is dominated by Red Sox fans, so keep your allegiances quiet. Don't forget about the food truck parked outside, a delicious treat. If you're going to Tipitinas for a show, 45 is a great pre or post-show stop.

Buckingham Pizza delivers the best pizza in town, especially their plain and speciality pizzas like the cool ranch. Stick with their pizzas and maybe some sides, as their entrees like the chicken piccata are just good.
New York Pizza Grill: Unwanted fliers, unsafe practices, and questionable employees make this a place to avoid.

Philadelphia, I love you! This place has amazing wood-fired pizzas with charred crusts, just the way I like it. The Marinara is simple yet delicious, and they even have a cheeseless option for my son. The Salsiccia with roasted fennel is brilliant and we couldn't resist the Rotolo with mortadella and pistachio pesto. The cocktails, especially The Brooklyn, are to die for. We ended our meal with perfect Italian cookies and an Affogato. I'm in heaven here. Great service and 5 stars all around! Can't wait to try Vetri's other restaurants.

I initially had a good experience at Music City Optical, but things went downhill when they switched my contact brand without proper explanation. I experienced pain, redness, and irritation, and when I reached out to them, they were unresponsive. Eventually, I managed to get my contacts switched back, but later found out that my eye irritation was due to not giving my eyes enough time to heal. When I posted a review on Facebook, they accused me of slander and lying, which was not accurate.
I highly recommend this small coffee place owned by the lovely, blond and friendly Karyn! Their coffee is fantastic and they even offer the convenience of a drive-through.

The service and cleanliness of the restaurant were excellent. However, the food was average, particularly the rotini primavera which should be avoided. Although the sauce had a delicious taste, the vegetables were clearly sourced from frozen products, which was disappointing. Considering the abundance of fresh produce available in Tucson, it is unnecessary to use frozen vegetables in dishes.

The staff is amazing, and everything is consistently good. The chili cheese etoufee is fantastic. Only deducted a star because it's cash only. However, the option to sit outside on a pleasant evening is a nice touch. Don't miss out on the garlic sauce!

This place offers the best of Jewish deli, Southern comfort, and Mexican cuisine. The brisket is flavorful, but don't expect a tomato-based sauce. The latke is a unique and delicious twist on the traditional round one. I also highly recommend the Jewish Apple Cake - even after a few hours on a flight back to LA, it remained delicious, despite being a little overcooked on the bottom.

The bouncers at this place are terrible, but given their height and rage-filled past, it's not surprising. This establishment epitomizes everything Reno should not be. Choose LEX only if your only other option is enduring waterboarding on Thanksgiving.

I had a negative experience with a cheap haircut in NY, resulting in a disastrous outcome. However, for my job interviews, I decided to try Domenick's and was pleasantly surprised. Robert did a fantastic job and the whole experience was worth $35. It was a bit expensive for me, but considering the final result, I felt human again. I'm not sure what the usual price range is in Philly, though. Overall, I would rate it a 4.

I had a delicious breakfast at Tuttini a few months ago, but my recent lunch experience was disappointing. Despite their sign stating lunch service until 2:30 PM, I was told that the kitchen was closing at 1:45 PM. The offer to make something to go contradicted their claim of being closed. Ultimately, I chose to eat elsewhere and spent my money at North Star Coffee instead.

Reviewer is extremely upset about discovering an unexpected $220 overdraft fee and being put on hold for 45 minutes when calling TD Bank for assistance. The representative was helpful but failed to mention the long wait. Learned that TD Bank's new policy charges overdraft fees instead of declining transactions with insufficient funds. The reviewer expresses frustration and plans to switch banks. Also mentions rebellious behavior toward the bank's cameras while making a deposit.
Terrible delivery experience. Pizza arrived over 30 minutes late, and was barely warm. Won't order from here again.

This Mexican restaurant on Main Street is average in terms of food and drinks. The pulled pork tacos and burrito were decent but nothing exceptional. It has a college-like atmosphere, so consider that before visiting.
The food at this dive bar is consistently delicious, however, the service is lacking.

This restaurant offers an outstanding dining experience with delicious food and unparalleled hospitality. The lamb and rice were perfectly cooked, with flavors that cater to both spicy enthusiasts and those with a milder taste. Even for someone who hasn't typically enjoyed Pakistani/Indian cuisine, I highly recommend this place to everyone and believe it's worth a trip to St. Louis just to savor their incredible dishes.

Fresh Market has helpful staff, specifically Thomas in the meat section. However, the overall experience went downhill from there. The Swiss cheese we ordered was poorly cut, resulting in one clump instead of slices. The ricotta cheese we bought was bad despite being within the expiration date. The tomatoes on the vine spoiled quickly, and prices were high while selection was poor. The pound cakes were dry and tasteless. Although the store was clean with parking available, it was ultimately a disappointing shopping trip. Additionally, conflicting information regarding cash withdrawal limits added to the dissatisfaction. It is recommended to shop at Weaver's Way, Whole Foods, or Wegmann's instead.
Highly recommend this place for a clean and relaxing pedicure experience. Friendly staff and great ambiance.
El Limon is a hidden gem. With fresh ingredients and incredible spices, this restaurant won me over. The nearby market sells the spices at unbelievably low prices. Don't wait, dine here immediately!

I tried the $12 tchoup wash at this car wash. Despite a short wait and entertaining waiting area, the results were okay. Some dirt and bird poop were still visible. While better than no wash, I miss my favorite car wash that offers more thorough cleaning for $14. This place is 85% as expensive as LA but only 66.67% the quality. Next time, I'll try a touchless system for similar results without the entertainment.

I am absolutely delighted with my haircut! The prices are incredibly reasonable too. Although the color wasn't exactly what I had hoped for during my first visit, it still turned out great. This is my second time here and I'll definitely keep coming back.

I recently moved to Idaho and had an amazing experience at Chipotle. Taylor, one of the staff members, comped one of my meals, making my week and day. Her exceptional customer service and friendly nature stood out among the rest. Taylor is absolutely awesome!

I had a negative experience at Peppermill due to their poor treatment and lack of response after I intervened to help during an incident. Despite restraining the assailant and calling for security, I was asked to leave or be considered trespassing. They did not address the situation or show any gratitude for my assistance. As a result, I have no intention of returning to Peppermill.
Disappointing service overshadowed the amazing beer selection. Will not be returning. Instead, try Brickside Grill for great beer, delicious food, and friendly staff.
Visited this Taco Bell near closing time, initially ignored by the staff despite the open lights. Eventually, a young man at the window helped us.

I had a fantastic breakfast at this NJ diner! The egg sandwich was delicious, especially with the top-notch hamburger roll and generous cheese. The home fries were sauteed with peppers and onions and had great flavor. The pancakes were fluffy, although the syrup could've been better. The server was friendly and attentive, and the coffee was surprisingly good. I can't wait to return!
Amazing Sno-balls with fantastic flavors, including all-natural options. Super friendly service. Can't wait to return!

This place is like a mini Whole Foods with a salad bar, fresh fruits, and a juice bar. It's a fantastic little grocery store and the only one of its kind in the city. They even have a parking lot. Conveniently located just a few blocks away from clothing stores, it's great for a quick walk.

This restaurant is a complete disappointment and not worth your money. Despite dining here twice, we've had such terrible experiences that corporate had to refund us. It's clear that this place is clueless and you will only be ripped off.

This boutique hotel is beautifully designed with a unique charm that sets it apart from typical hotels like the Hilton. I had my birthday party at the restaurant and it was a wonderful experience. The service was excellent and the rooms are stunning. The only downside was a slightly loud air conditioner in our room. However, its close proximity to the vibrant Printers Alley makes it even more appealing. I would certainly choose to stay in this hotel again.

The breakfast fare was great with delicious Eggs provençale, although slightly inconsistent in cooking. The tomato on the side was awesome. Omelets were well-executed and the pastries were impressive. However, the coffee was horrendously bad, which affected the overall breakfast experience. Additionally, the presence of misspellings on the menu makes it difficult to trust the restaurant, even if they are from another language.
I walked from our condo and discovered this amazing place! Delicious sliders, donuts, and unique drinks. The atmosphere is awesome and the staff is extremely friendly. I will definitely be returning!

I attended the #welldoneTBO tweet-up at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza and had a great experience. Amazing customer service, delicious menu items, and a personal favorite was the Philly Cheesesteak Pizza. The Cauliflower pizza was also a delightful vegetarian option. The carmelized onion-smothered wings were out of this world. Tasted other dishes like meatballs, ribs, and salad, all very good. Ordered a half and half pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms which was so good. If they offered liquor, I would have given them five stars. Thanks, Anthony's, for a fantastic evening. We'll definitely be back.

The grits at this brunch spot are my favorite and I can't resist ordering them every time. The portion size is huge and you can add toppings for a small fee. The grits are perfectly cooked and not at all grainy or watery. I can't recommend them enough!

The Wildflower Triple brunch option at this place is amazing! With the ability to substitute any item, we had a tough time deciding. The food was delicious and the service was friendly. We might visit again during our stay.

The courthouse is ancient, showcasing remarkable art. The spiral staircase is amusing, while granting a panoramic city view on the 5th level. The clock room is an unexpected delight, exposing intricate mechanical gears. Remember to book ahead for access. Allocate 2 to 3 hours—it's truly worthwhile.

Overall, this bar and casino combo offers a decent alcohol selection and well-mixed drinks. However, the higher than average prices and limited food menu, which also made me sick, were disappointing. The poor service mentioned in other reviews was unfortunately true, as we had to repeatedly track down our server. Given the many better options in Reno, this place is not my preferred choice.

Overall, I absolutely love the food at this place. The portions are generous, and the menu is constantly evolving, which keeps things interesting. However, I do have a few concerns - the seating is cramped and the noise level makes conversation difficult. Additionally, the coffee could be improved to match the quality of Sabrina's. Nevertheless, I must say that the latkas are consistently perfect and the bacon stands out as the best I've had in Philly.

I was thoroughly impressed with this place. The bed was comfortable, breakfast was good, and the internet was fast. Its great location and low price were definite highlights. However, be aware that staying on the top floors may result in waiting up to 15 minutes for an elevator in the morning.

Urban South Brewery in New Orleans offers the best IPAs we have discovered in the city. As Cincinnati natives, we have a knack for great IPAs, and Urban South does not disappoint. The brewery has a laid-back and relaxed atmosphere, perfect for a casual outing.

This chicken and rice plate was a major disappointment. Despite specifically requesting no sauce, the dish arrived drenched in oil, completely contradicting what I was promised. The excessive amount of oil made it unappetizing and far from healthy. The restaurant's claim to promote a healthy image is simply a joke. Overall, a horrible experience.

Overall, the atmosphere at this place was pleasant and cozy. However, be prepared for a bustling brunch crowd and a waiting time of around 30-45 minutes. The highlight of the menu was definitely the spinach, caramelized onion, and goat cheese omelet, although I would suggest requesting a smaller amount of goat cheese as the portion provided was excessive. Additionally, the fruit served was perfectly ripe. Just keep in mind that this establishment only accepts cash.
I recently had a pedicure at this place and it was amazing. The cleanliness and ambiance were impressive, and there was no wait time. They definitely know what they are doing.

Overall, the experience at this restaurant was underwhelming. The website lacked clear menu descriptions and prices, and the table placecard was more informative. The bar-like atmosphere wasn't an issue, but the temperature difference between the roast beef and roast pork sandwiches was disappointing. The sandwiches were also lacking in meat, compensating with excessive gravy that made the bread soggy. Opting for the "wet meat" option would have been a better choice to maintain the sandwich's integrity.
Mint is a must-visit spot in my neighborhood. Their menu offers endless good choices, and the Taro Tapioca Smoothie is an absolute delight for anyone with a sweet tooth.

I attended an alumni event at this cozy, dimly lit venue that is beautifully decorated like an old library. The ambiance was perfect for a quiet and casual evening. The drink selection was limited to a few beers and wines, but their happy hour cocktails, including Moscow mules and old fashioneds, were outstanding. Everyone enjoyed their drinks, and we had no complaints.

Overall, I had an excellent experience with this service. After requesting online, I received a callback within 30-45 minutes and was able to schedule an appointment swiftly. Shanna, the professional, arrived promptly and provided valuable information about prevention methods. She thoroughly checked both mine and my daughter's heads and provided full treatment. Although it was a bit pricey, I had already tried over-the-counter solutions and was not satisfied. The comb they used, which is not sold in stores, was highly effective at gathering nits. My only complaint is that the comb should be included in the session, rather than being an additional cost. However, I purchased it for future use.

Despite facing difficulties in reaching the restaurant due to parade-related obstacles, we had a fantastic dining experience as an alternative to Rio Mar. The service was impressively professional, striking a balance between attentiveness and subtlety. Although it was disappointing that two ingredients were unavailable for their signature cocktail, we understood the circumstances being the day before Mardi Gras. The bread and butter provided were exceptional, with a crunchy exterior and a soft interior. The uniqueness of the beet salad stood out, as the greens tasted incredibly fresh. G's Choucroute was a meat lover's delight, and my crab ravioli with Meyer lemon sauce was delicately flavorful. Our dessert, bread pudding, was exactly to our liking without raisins. Overall, this was a truly memorable meal surpassing the standards set by most hotel restaurants.

The customer service at Dish is seriously lacking. Despite making a reservation for three people two weeks in advance, we were seated at a tiny table barely fit for two. Adjacent to us, an extra person was added, resulting in an uncomfortably cramped dining experience. When we requested a proper table for three, we were rudely told it was a take it or leave it situation. This unpleasant encounter ruined what was supposed to be a special night out, and as a result, we will no longer be dining at this restaurant.

The Village pub has a great beer selection, welcoming atmosphere, and good service. The happy hour with half price beer and the dog-friendly deck are definite highlights. The key lime pie is also delicious. However, the smoking allowed on the deck is a downside. The food, particularly the pretzels and cheese dip, falls short. The pretzel bun sandwiches are pricey and underwhelming, with soggy buns. It would be better if the pub focused on serving beer and allowed customers to bring in sandwiches from next door.
Provi is an amazing person who drew me to this place. The chipotle chicken avocado sandwich and chicken noodle soup are delicious.

I had high expectations for a $16 haircut, but I was pleasantly surprised. The haircut was professionally done, complemented my face shape, and improved the health of my hair. The shampoo smelled great and the stylist was thorough. The only downside was the waiting time, but it was worth it for the quality result. The salon's focus on training and checklists ensures a great experience. Just remember to allocate enough time for the appointment.

The small aquarium in Tarpon Springs is primarily geared towards kids and offers a shark feeding show as well as the opportunity to pet stingrays and feed them. Although it might not be my first choice of attractions in the area, it is decent enough, especially for young children who seem to enjoy it.

I have been a member of this credit union for 4 years, along with my family. Despite some occasional errors, we have been quite satisfied with their service. The branch has been helpful in promptly resolving any issues we encountered.

Overall Rating: 3 stars

The adorable atmosphere and outstanding location of this restaurant receive 5 stars. However, the food experience was a bit underwhelming. The smoked turkey club I had was mostly good, but the meat was not impressive. The creamed spinach was enjoyable, but the mac n cheese was dry and bland, which was disappointing considering the additional cost. Despite this, I am not giving up on this place yet. I am determined to go back and try something else because I really want to love it.

Three Muses in New Orleans offers delectable tapas-style dishes meant for sharing. While the fish tacos were underwhelming, the lamb sliders and steak and cake were absolutely phenomenal. The lamb paired with goat cheese was exquisite, and the crab cake was the best I've ever had.

My girlfriends and I dined at the Creole House for dinner due to its proximity to our hotel. The bacon garlic oysters were average, as the flavors were overpowered by the cheese and bacon. The jumbo buffalo wings were tasty and well-seasoned. The jumbalaya pasta lacked flavor and was our least favorite, while the blackened red fish was just okay. The sautéed veggies accompanying the dish were excessively salty. The canal street red fish wasn't great and lacked garlic sauce. The paddle boat drinks tasted good but were more juice than alcohol. Overall, the food was underwhelming, earning the restaurant a solid 3 stars. On a positive note, our server, Alexander, provided excellent hospitality and tried his best to ensure our satisfaction.

I stumbled upon Player's while driving and had a fantastic experience! The staff is friendly, service is top-notch, and the atmosphere is wonderfully laid-back. I received an excellent shave and haircut at a great price. Overall, a great find!

The Frist's cafe is not my regular choice for lunch, but on occasional dreary days, I indulge in their Cobb Salad. Perfect for gluten-free diners, I recommend adding an extra egg for a protein boost. With affordable prices and quick service, it attracts museum visitors and local employees. However, be wary of Senior Mondays and weekend lunchtimes, as it tends to get busy around 11:30-noon.
The donuts at this place were amazing! I tried the plain glazed and the lemon filled one, and both were incredible. If I ever come back to Indy, I would definitely visit again.

I'm giving this new joint 4 stars because they have some kinks to work out, but they have the potential to be 5-star material. Despite some errors due to being new, they are willing to make corrections and accommodations. The food is really good overall, except the pizza which is greasy and might not use 100% mozzarella. However, the Quaker, fries, onion rings, spanakopita, baklava, and signature salad are all delicious. The turkey Greek burger is one of the best I've had, though it had a few discrepancies from the menu. If they maintain their high quality standard, I'll definitely be returning.

Burger Up offers an upscale take on burgers, with tasty flavors and a variety of toppings. The meat itself lacked flavor, but overall the burger was well-cooked. The truffle fries are a must-try. The beer menu is interesting, featuring unique options from the Deep South. It could be a good spot for post-meal drinks. Overall, Burger Up is a decent alternative to traditional dive bar burgers. 3.50 stars.

I used to love this place, but it has really gone downhill. The customer service was disappointing, with an unhelpful server who didn't even offer a tea to go. The food was okay, but not enough to make up for the poor treatment. The deteriorating benches with tape on them also looked tacky. Sadly, this is no longer my favorite lunch spot and I won't be returning.

Wow! Incredible experience. Initially, we had low expectations due to the appearance of the plaza. However, upon stepping into the restaurant, we were greeted with a cozy traditional Indian/Thai ambiance. We ordered the mussel appetizer, Tamarind Duck, and Panang Curry with calamari. The service was prompt and unobtrusive. The mussels were tasty, but the Duck and Curry were absolutely amazing! The portion sizes matched the prices, so no feeling of being shortchanged. We plan to return to try the sushi and other duck varieties. Our taste buds are very satisfied!

Exceptional customer service! Mary provided invaluable assistance in selecting frames and displayed a warm and personable attitude. The welcoming atmosphere from the moment I entered the store made for a delightful experience. I am definitely revisiting in the future!

Mr. X offers fantastic flavors with a friendly staff. Carry out wait time averages 20 minutes, much better than chain pizzerias at 45 minutes. The hand-tossed crust resembles traditional NY style pizza and delivers excellent flavor and texture.

Citizens Bank Park is one of the best places in the country to catch a ball game. The park offers plenty of interesting food and drink options, including a rooftop bar. The tickets are reasonably priced, especially compared to New York parks. There's not a bad seat in the house, but the outfield is a great option. The staff is helpful in recommending sections that avoid direct sunlight. Don't let the negative publicity about Philly fans deter you - the crowds are great and the park is well-policed. While you won't have the same sheltered experience as in your living room, it's still a fun atmosphere to enjoy a game with your family.

This place is absolutely fantastic! Exceptional food and impeccable service. The staff is incredibly nice and generous, creating a cool atmosphere. I'm a regular customer, dining here almost every weekend. And trust me, their Cuban espresso is unbeatable!

We arrived promptly at 8:30 on a Saturday and were seated and served without any wait. The sweet potato pancakes with cinnamon cream syrup were delightful, but the hash browns were disappointing. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth returning for, even without a wait. The bill came to $24.43 before tip. Sadly, the restroom lacked paper towels, suggesting a lack of attention to detail.

Dave was an incredibly friendly and helpful food cart owner. He took the time to explain the menu, and the hot dogs were prepared quickly and tasted absolutely amazing. The pizza dog and custom creation were both outstanding, and to top it off, Dave generously added grilled jalapeños. Santa Barbara definitely needs more late-night food carts like this one!

The ice cream was delicious, but the service was absolutely terrible. The staff ignored us, threw napkins around, and made rude comments. They lacked professionalism and showed no respect towards paying customers.

This college-town bar offers everything you'd expect – alcohol, pub/bar food, a great tap selection, and a lively atmosphere. It's a Villanova tradition with decent specials. Keep in mind it's not upscale or a lunch spot; it's simply a bar!

The burgers at this spin-off from Rouge are better than their flagship restaurants. The option to edit toppings on the placard is convenient, and the Kobe Beef burger is worth the extra cost. The brioche bun adds to the overall experience. The truffle oil fries are a must-try and being open late on weekends is a bonus.
This place is a blast! With its outdoor patio playing hip hop and an indoor dance area with salsa, you can easily switch up the music and scenery whenever you feel like it.

Lazos serves the best pizza in the Fairmount/Art Museum/Brewerytown area. The pepperoni and wings were delicious, with a delightful crispy texture. Surprisingly, the wings were not soggy like many others. Although they mistakenly gave me Sprite instead of Coke, the overall pizza and wing combo was excellent. Will definitely order from Lazos again!

Surprisingly charming and delightful interior. Food is tasty and reasonably priced. Recommended dishes include the refreshing papaya salad, flavorful triple flavor duck, and the winning king tofu soup. Don't forget to bring your own booze!

This place is a true American diner gem. With its long-standing history, it's not hard to see why it has stood the test of time. The waitresses are always courteous and the food is made from scratch, which is a rare find these days. Their fried chicken is hands down the best I've ever tasted, and it's always fresh. If you're a coffee lover, you'll be delighted to know they offer bottomless refills at a very reasonable price. And don't forget to try their delicious pie.

Jenna Moore is amazing! I have been trying to achieve an A-line bob for over a year with little success, until today. She listened to everything I had to say, ensured that we were on the same page, and delivered exactly what I wanted. I know my hair still needs some healing and growth, but I can actually see my desired look in the future now, thanks to Jenna. Highly, highly recommended!

I've been here twice for breakfast and the experience was really awkward. The staff on Saturday mornings seemed inexperienced and were often cursing and yelling at each other. The ordering system is confusing as they sometimes come to your table, but it seems random. The coffee and drinks are self-serve and not good. The lack of shades at the front window can make it uncomfortable. The food was okay, but my pulled pork wrap had a lot of gristle. The cornbread pancakes were tasty though. The payment process is inconvenient as you pay afterwards. I regret bringing my brother here for brunch, it's a dive. Don't expect traditional breakfast service or a nice atmosphere. It's cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Overall, the food at this BBQ joint was a mixed bag. The Mac n cheese was absolutely delicious and worth indulging in. While the ribs had great flavor, they were disappointingly tough. The pulled pork was sweet and enjoyable. The baked beans were passable, but the cole slaw had a strange aftertaste reminiscent of lake water. The unique ambiance of dining in an abandoned car wash adds a special element to the experience and is worth giving it a try.
The Waffle House offers consistent quality, but the business model with their yelling and limited dining area is not my preference. Nonetheless, I still eagerly anticipate their breakfast.

We arrived for lunch at 12pm on a Friday, and despite it being not busy, service was incredibly slow. Despite being pleasant and kind, we had to complain numerous times just to get our beverages. Additionally, it took them 40 minutes to inform us that a beer we ordered was no longer available. While the food was good, the prolonged wait and slow service made it not worth it.

Visited this place on a busy weekend, had to wait over an hour - not worth it. Came back earlier and had a great experience. Pancakes are amazing, especially the butter pecan. They also offer turkey sausage and bacon. Highly recommend going early and wearing loose pants.

I had an amazing birthday experience in SB with Wine Edventures! Sean was a friendly and funny guide who took us to 3 wineries and 1 brewery. He provided interesting explanations during the drive and lessons during the tastings. The lunch at the vineyard was delicious, and the souvenir wine glasses and bottled water were a nice touch. I highly recommend this adventure to anyone seeking a fun day in SB.

We decided to try this place after Terakawa had a long line, and we are glad we did. The service was excellent, and the staff was friendly. The waitress even helped my wife with her jacket while she was holding our baby. The Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen, Shrimp Katsu Ramen, and Shoyu Ramen were all delicious. The curry soup was flavorful, and the fried chicken and shrimp were cooked perfectly. We also enjoyed the pork buns, although they were not like traditional pork buns. Overall, we had a fantastic experience.

I was extremely disappointed with my experience. The glasses I received were horribly out of focus and the staff failed to properly measure my pupils for positioning. They attempted to convince me that the glasses could be repositioned, but it would have resulted in an uncomfortable fit. Despite requesting the lenses to be redone urgently, I still have not received my glasses.

Frank is a fantastic dentist and a genuinely kind individual. He possesses a gentle approach and a sincere concern for his patients. Overall, he is a top-notch dentist and an excellent choice for anyone seeking dental care. I have been going to him for years, and I know numerous others who have done the same.

This Walmart in Meadowlark is conveniently located near my doctor's office. It's smaller than the supercentre but offers a decent selection of affordable items in the food section, although the produce section can be limited. Snacks and canned food are reasonably priced. Other sections and items can be hit or miss, like the limited selection of lightbulbs and lack of helpful associates. However, the checkout lines are usually short, which is a plus.

Avoid this place at all costs! Our entire family fell ill after eating here and the frozen yogurt, while visually appealing, was incredibly disappointing in terms of taste. Absolutely not worth a second visit or recommending to anyone.

Attended a Yelp Elite event at Holy Mole and had an amazing time! The food was incredible, especially the specially crafted cocktail. The staff was attentive and friendly. Can't wait to come back for a full meal!

I had an incredible first experience at this restaurant! It exudes a cozy, homely atmosphere, and the waiters were friendly and entertaining. The food arrived promptly, and it was absolutely phenomenal. I will definitely return to this amazing place!

This brick oven pizza joint keeps improving with every visit. I can't get enough of their Rotolo, a doughy delight filled with mortadella, ricotta cheese, pistachios, and oil. It's a must-order each time, priced at $5 and the size of a bun. The prosciutto pizza is incredibly flavorful, with divine dough. The service is consistently excellent, and the beer selection is commendable. Easily one of Philly's best pizza spots.

Unfortunately, our recent experience with the chili beef nachos and chicken burrito was not pleasant, as both my boyfriend and I experienced stomach issues. Although we appreciate the shredded beef at this establishment and usually enjoy it, this time we were disappointed with the freshness of the ingredients.

I highly recommend Pure Design for large events. Their staff was professional, offered unique and beautiful arrangements within my budget, and created a gorgeous space that our guests raved about. I was also able to take home/give away the arrangements, which lasted several days after the event.

Butch did an excellent job on the tour - it was both relaxing and informative. The two stops to eat and see the cemetery were great additions. I highly recommend going on this trip at the beginning of your stay as it helps you know where to go during your trip. Butch was also a lot of fun!
Great spot for a drink with friendly staff. However, cleanliness concerns may deter me from dining there.

I highly recommend this place in Indiana! David's pink and whites are absolutely amazing. The shop is always clean, and the staff is professional and courteous. The new management, although they've been there for three years already, is outstanding.

The Sunrise Family Restaurant offers a cozy, small-town vibe and the service is prompt and friendly. However, the recommended Monte Cristo sandwich was disappointing - microwaved turkey and ham with limp french toast. The salad and fries were tasty though, especially the perfectly cooked thick steak fries. Despite the sandwich, I believe there may be great options on the menu, particularly for breakfast. I plan to give it another shot.
My husband and I have been regulars at this place for the past 8 years. The food is amazing, prepared quickly, and they offer fantastic drink specials.

I highly recommend Buff for a relaxing and accommodating nail salon experience. The modern and minimalist decor creates a clean and pleasant atmosphere. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate our group for 4 pedicures, even adding an extra pedicurist to the schedule. The complimentary drinks, including mimosas, wine, and champagne, are a delightful touch. The service was friendly and welcoming, and my polish lasted without chipping. The only downside is street parking only, but it shouldn't be an issue for regular customers. Overall, I will definitely be returning to Buff.

Unfortunately, my experience at this restaurant was highly disappointing. Despite waiting for 40 minutes to be seated, the hot breakfast was served cold and the food was not prepared according to my requests. The sausage links were burnt even after sending them back, and the eggs were not cooked as over-medium. Additionally, I had to repeatedly ask for coffee refills, and the waitress appeared indifferent to the deficiencies in the service. To make matters worse, it took over 10 minutes to receive the check, giving me ample time to write and post this review. At a price of $40 for a simple breakfast for two, this experience was certainly not worth it.
The restaurant's hype was unfounded. Average ambiance, limited menu, and unimpressive food. However, the location offers attractions if you choose to wait.
I have experienced three instances where I ordered a green tea lemonade but received a peach tea lemonade instead. Each time, I had to return to the store, go inside, and request a remake.
Terrible experience. Rude staff, incorrect salad order, and overpriced slices. Slow service even when we were the only customers. Save your money and go elsewhere.

The new Red Kings restaurant in Chinatown exceeded expectations with its flavorful, spicy Szechuan cuisine. The takeout experience was fantastic, with generous portions and perfect spice levels in the Dan Dan Noodles and Pork in Garlic Sauce. The sweet, earthy, and fresh flavors were delightful. Excited to explore more dishes and return for a sit-down dinner. Additionally, the karaoke rooms upstairs and BYOB option make it even more appealing.

Stopped by for Sunday brunch a couple of weeks ago. The food was delicious and satisfying, with great drink options. Our server was pleasant, and we loved the cool cafe atmosphere. Definitely recommend it.

This coffee shop is a must-visit in the city! Amazing food, fresh and delicious. Cool edgy vibe with plenty of comfy seating, both indoors and outdoors. Highly recommended, especially if you're craving good food along with your coffee.

Without a doubt, this small cafe serves the best breakfast in Philly! Despite being a breakfast fanatic, I've explored all the renowned spots in town and this one stands out. The flavors here are simply incredible, and the dishes are both fresh and simple. Although the space is cozy, the menu is so fantastic that it could easily rival a larger establishment like Parc in terms of popularity.

The food was excellent, but the hospitality was very disappointing. Despite the restaurant still being open for another 45 minutes, they refused to let us dine in and only offered takeout. This was especially frustrating as we had pregnant women and a child with us, and explained that we had a long drive ahead. We had to go back home and make everyone eat there. I'm extremely disappointed with their treatment of customers and will not be returning. It's hard to forgive them for denying dining to pregnant women.

Awesome family-friendly atmosphere with delicious Po boys that feature perfectly baked bread. We tried three variations and all were incredibly tasty. The Mac 'n Cheese had a delightful spicy kick, and the service was absolutely fantastic.

Excellent customer service! Absolutely thrilled with my new car purchase. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a well-maintained used car. Andy provided exceptional assistance and made the buying process seamless.

The Tuck Special at this Nashville establishment is worth a long drive from Texas just to savor it again. The blend of unconventional ingredients like brisket, egg, and pimento cheese creates an incredible flavor. While my husband wasn't fond of the BBQ sauce, the meat itself was quite satisfying. This place can get crowded, but with a little patience and menu research beforehand, it should be manageable.

I give this place two stars only for their good gravy fries, but their sandwiches are awful. The meat is badly sliced, tough, and dry, making it inedible. Locals who rave about this place haven't tried anything better. Go to Wawa for an edible sandwich instead.

I've visited Lush stores in multiple locations, but the one in New Orleans is my favorite. The scent of the store can be detected from a block away, which I love. I've visited this specific store several times, always on Halloween, and it's always a fun experience.

I recently tried Music City Dental after getting new dental insurance. Dr. Spurlin and her staff are amazing! They were gentle and ensured my comfort throughout the whole visit. Despite my fear of shots, I barely felt anything when Dr. Spurlin administered one for my filling. They even offered me a pillow, blanket, and the choice to watch a movie or listen to music. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I will be returning as a permanent patient!

We had an outstanding dining experience at this restaurant. The food was impeccable, from the perfectly cooked Jambalaya and Shrimp Etouffee to the fantastic Seafood Gumbo with a great mix of seafood and okra. The shrimp in the Etouffee dish was firm, clean, and tasted incredibly fresh. The Bread Pudding with praline sauce was a perfect match for the meal, and the Cafe du Monde coffee was a delightful addition. Undoubtedly, one of the best dining experiences we had during our visit to NOLA.
We highly recommend this movie theater/bar/restaurant. Excellent drinks, friendly service, and delicious food. Must visit!

I absolutely love their breakfast burritos! The bacon, egg, cheese, and potatoes combination is delicious. The well-seasoned and perfectly cut small potatoes prevent the burrito from being overwhelmed by mushy potatoes. The flavors of eggs, bacon, and potatoes shine through. I would prefer a little more cheese, but it's a minor issue. The salsa bar offers a nice variety, and the friendly staff adds to the welcoming atmosphere. I feel fortunate to have them just a mile away from my house. Hoping they stick around for years to come!

Termini Brothers is simply the best! Their desserts are fantastic, especially the cannolis. As someone from an Italian family, we always have Termini Brothers dessert trays for our family events. Highly recommended!

I have only visited this location a few times, mostly for sending packages, and I appreciate the presence of an automated machine which is lacking at my closest post office. However, the outstanding customer service we encountered during our visit to submit passport applications deserves special mention. The representative we dealt with was exceptional - efficient, friendly, and well-informed. We were in and out in no time, and she even provided me with follow-up forms and guidance regarding my name change. I hope to have more experiences like this in the future, and she should be recognized as a model for training others.
Great talent, but poor time management. Arrived at 11:28am and still waiting for service despite opening at 11am. Disappointed with Perfect Arch.
Excellent service and top-notch car wash. I am extremely satisfied with my first visit. Thank you!

I recently hosted my husband's surprise birthday party at Black Sheep's basement bar for around 35 people and it was an outstanding experience. James, the owner, was incredibly helpful and friendly during my initial inquiry call, and Adam, our bartender, ensured that everything ran smoothly on the night of the party. Dealing with the staff at Black Sheep was fantastic throughout the entire process. Overall, it was a great experience.

Overall, the reviewer had mixed feelings about the boba place. They were disappointed that the boba didn't have the same feel as in California and found some flavors to be lacking in real fruit taste. However, if one doesn't mind powdered flavors, the place could be enjoyable. The reviewer recommends trying boba and grass jelly. It's a good place for hanging out and doing activities. The reviewer feels that it could be better but acknowledges their own pickiness.
Chick fil A sets itself apart from typical fast food with exceptionally high-quality food that doesn't feel laden with fillers. Highly recommend even for non-fast food enthusiasts!
Mr. B's is a must-visit brunch spot in New Orleans. The Brandy Milk Punch is amazing and the shrimp and grits are to die for. Don't miss out on the fresh bread and butter too. Highly recommended!

Fantastic neighborhood grocery store with excellent deli, soup, hot bar, and salad bar choices. Affordable alternative to Whole Foods. Impressive weekend crawfish and lobster boils. A definite go-to store for locals. Plus, their fried chicken is absolutely amazing!

Just visited The Fat Ham with my girlfriend and had a great experience. Small but nice vibe with welcoming staff. Impressive whiskey display. Sat at the bar and received excellent service from bartender Dan. Margarita was tasty and reasonably priced. Pimento cheese, cornbread, shrimp & grits, and hot chicken were all delicious. Shrimp & grits was my favorite dish. Dessert (raspberry cobbler) was underwhelming, but the coffee was great. Decent price point, high-end comfort food, and overall, I'll be back.

This meal was absolutely outstanding! The service was top-notch and the food was some of the best in New Orleans. The oysters were a must-try, and the scallops with butternut squash purée and balsamic vinegar were divine. The dessert, cafe au lait panna cotta with mini glazed donuts, was the highlight of the meal. And their house made 'cellos, especially the ginger and limecellos, were unique and delicious. Overall, an amazing experience!
The ambiance wasn't up to par, but the service was nice and the food was decent. Might go back if I'm in the area and in the mood for sushi.
The food was great, especially the crab cocktail. My husband enjoyed his steamers. The only downside was the high humidity in the restaurant. A fan would have been a nice addition.

Located conveniently near Union Station Metro, this hotel is a great value on weekends. Prices skyrocket during the week due to business travelers. The room was clean, the bed was luxuriously comfortable with plenty of pillows. The spacious bathroom had a bathtub and an abundant supply of white towels. Deducted one star due to the poor coffee machine in the room and the thin door that allowed noise from the hallway. However, the main lobby is impressive and definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

I highly recommend this restaurant as the owners are incredibly kind and welcoming. The food is scrumptious, with the bacon pizza being my absolute favorite. It's wonderful that they have a play room for children, ensuring an enjoyable wait for our meal.

The food at this place was decently good, but way too expensive. The guacamole and Mojito were the highlights, while the peach pork medallions lacked flavor. The corn cakes with Barbacoa were pretty good though. The atmosphere was inviting and had a hip feel. However, the parking situation was annoying with limited spaces and no valet service. Ended up parking three blocks away and sweating in the summer heat to get to the entrance.

This hotel offers exceptional airport views and the exclusive feature of a revolving rooftop restaurant. Connected to the airport, it provides easy access to various dining and shopping options. The highlight is the panoramic view from the rooftop restaurant, encompassing the runways and control tower.

We have been loyal customers at this car wash for years and have no complaints. Wednesdays are great for ladies as they offer a discount on all wash options. The $5 car wash is not hand-wash, but it's perfect for a quick bath. They occasionally run a 2 for 1 special on auto detail packages, which we always take advantage of because they consistently deliver great results.
Fantastic spot for a family brunch: clean venue, exceptional staff, and delightful decor. A major win as my picky four-year-old even enjoyed the food. Impressive!

Great classic Greek diner. The Greek omelette with feta, gyro meat, tomato, and spinach was fantastic. Loved the classic griddle home fries and the service was outstanding. We'll definitely be coming back when we're in the area.
I always eat their oysters and they are absolutely amazing! Despite not knowing the type, they are the freshest and most delicious oysters I've had. Highly recommended, you won't be disappointed!

I stopped by for a drink yesterday and the atmosphere is exceptional, receiving an A+ from me. The remodel's attention to detail is outstanding, giving a Harry Potter-like ambiance. Background music is played at a low volume, perfect for conversation. Michael and Peggy, the bartenders, were friendly and fascinating to talk to. Although I didn't try the food, the prices for meat/cheese trays are better compared to other places in the area. I highly recommend checking this place out!

The best burger joint in Philly! Modest place with great food. Customizable menu, perfectly cooked burgers, and delicious hand-cut fries. Don't forget to download the SPOT app for rewards and free fries.
SRS is an exceptional management company. Highly accommodating and responsive to specific requests. Highly recommended.

Casa Garcia on Labor Day, 2015, was a mixed experience. The restaurant's interior and fountain were pleasant, and the chips, salsa, bean dip, and tortilla soup were delightful. However, the entrees fell short, with the quesadillas lacking flavor. While the meal was not terrible, there are better dining options nearby.
I called for a price on fixing a flat, and it was $35.99. Shocked by the legality of this price in a city with low wages. Tragic.

Despite it being my first experience with Nola food, I'm afraid my visit to this restaurant had a rough start. Our waitress seemed overwhelmed and made mistakes with our orders, including forgetting my drink and mixing up my friend's plate. The shrimp po'boy that I ordered was disappointing, with minimal lettuce and sauce accompanied by weak and soggy fries. Although other reviews indicate that this might have been an off-day for them, I sadly will not be returning and have to give a lackluster review.

Henry is an exceptional rock star in the storage locker industry. He is knowledgeable, professional, courteous, and personable. We had a great experience and even our dog, Marley, was warmly welcomed. Highly recommended!

I was disappointed with this restaurant located near the Peppermill. It seemed to attract customers from nearby auto repair shops. The Chinese food served here was of low quality and they had trouble getting our order right. Even when we tried a simple dish, it tasted awful.

This place offers creative and tasty food, decent house wines, and well-made but small cocktails. Service has always been good, although I haven't been during peak times. The patio is a great spot for hanging out with friends.

Despite my initial hesitation, I was pleasantly surprised by this strip mall bar. My friend John, who works here, highly recommended it and I'm glad we gave it a chance. The food was delicious, especially looking forward to trying their pizza next time. Additionally, their newly added craft bar is impressive and the prices are quite reasonable.

The cafe was adorable with a surprise jazz band performing when we arrived at 8am. The breakfast sandwich was scrumptious - the rolled egg and bacon pieces were a delightful touch. It was a reasonably priced and satisfying morning meal.

Meticulous attention to healthy, delectable cuisine with flavorful twists and thoughtful details. Extensive menu, accommodating dietary needs effortlessly. Outstanding sauces and exquisite desserts incorporating white and black sticky rice. A definitive choice for Thai cuisine going forward!

Poblano's used to serve a delicious Amiga bowl with shredded grilled chicken, rice, grilled onions and peppers, and queso sauce. However, on my recent visit, they substituted the chicken and rice with chicken crisps, which lacked moisture and quantity. When I voiced my discontent, the manager argued that this was the same dish they had been serving for years. Additionally, their soft tacos were stale and lacked flavor. It was disappointing that their cook had quit that night, resulting in a subpar experience. Sadly, Poblano's received a negative rating from me.

The server was excellent, very attentive and friendly. The maple wings were delicious. However, the paid performance by the "piano guys" was highly inappropriate and offensive, crossing all limits of decency. It completely ruined the experience and we left immediately. Moreover, for the price paid, we only heard a fraction of one song.

Dinner for 9 was an amazing experience! Celebrating a 70th birthday, we were treated with top-notch service throughout. Though pricey, the steaks and entrees were exceptional. Excellent service, delicious food, and a wonderful ambiance.

Love this little shop for its inviting aroma, extensive spice selection, and knowledgeable staff. Their products last a long time and taste fresher than alternatives. Prices are reasonable, making it worth the investment.

I recently tried out this Thai restaurant and I would give it 4-5 stars. It was my first visit and I found the food to be delicious. The shrimp spring rolls were especially fresh and the peanut sauce was tasty. The tom yum soup was a bit too spicy for my liking, but still had a good sour flavor. The pad thai and drunken noodle dishes were also enjoyable, although the noodles in the pad thai were a bit overdone. The portions were slightly smaller than other places in the area. The owner was friendly and attentive, even coming outside to talk with me about the food. The restaurant has a cute setup in a quaint house, but it may not be ideal if it's crowded. Overall, I think it's worth a try for Thai food fans. I used a Living Social deal, which made the total bill for two people, including an appetizer, soup, and a drink, to be around $24.

Terrible experience. Soggy and cold pizza delivered after 2 hours with zero communication. Promised refund, but still charged. Terrible service, extremely rude. Avoid at all costs. Don't order from here.

The beers were amazing, especially the porter, double IPA, and table gutt. The food, particularly the Russian cuisine like the sausage and sauerkraut special and pickled everything appetizer, was killer. This place rules!
I absolutely love this hidden gem in Creve Couer! The 9-hole course is both enjoyable and affordable. The staff is extremely helpful as well.
Highly recommended! This place is adorable and sustainable. The staff is amazing, and the food and coffee are extraordinary.

I love Weaver's Way and disagree with previous reviews. It's not meant for convenient shopping, but as a single woman, I find it great for smaller quantities. The community is diverse, not just "tree huggers" and "earth children." They offer locally grown produce and preservative-free foods at better prices than Whole Foods. Interacting with members and contributing to the community is enjoyable. The membership fee and work hours aren't prohibitive for singles. If you value Weaver Way's values, it's the perfect place to shop. Otherwise, stick to chain stores or pay the visitors' fee occasionally.

Initially, the take-out Chinese restaurant was average, neither exceptional nor disappointing. However, upon a recent visit, they impressed us with flawless delivery and outstanding food. The rating has now improved to 5 stars.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place in Reno. The Taiwanese food was excellent, surpassing my expectations. Highly recommend trying the 三杯鸡, oyster omelet, and scallion pancake. I'm already craving for more dishes and will definitely miss this place when I leave.

Overall, this restaurant is a great choice for a late weekend brunch when the morning rush dies down. The wait times are usually short, but the seating system could use improvement. The dishes vary in quality, with some being just okay and others being awesome. The chicken wings and onion rings are bland, but the club sandwich and egg/omelette platters are well-executed and tasty. The waffle stands out as the best item on the menu, being sweet, crispy, and delicious. The service is generally attentive, and the restaurant and bathrooms are clean. This place offers good value for the price.

The veggie wings at this place are hands down the best I've ever had. I can't stop thinking about them. The fried pickles are also great, but the drinks are a bit weak. Stick to the Mexican coke when you're here.
Extremely disappointing experience waiting 27 minutes for three teas in an empty store. Unacceptable wait time, particularly in Chinatown where efficiency is expected.
I replaced 2 old 70s Lennox units with new ones and they have been running smoothly for 3 years. Great job!
