Papertini deserves every single one of those glowing 5 stars! Their creatively designed wedding masterpieces go beyond traditional flowers with unique elements like papers, wires, and luxe fabrics. The team is not only talented but also friendly – a true asset to your wedding team. If you want something unique without being artsy-fartsy, I highly recommend them!
Terrible experience. Mediocre food, extremely slow service, rude servers, and lots of billing mistakes. Would not recommend.
Excellent experience! Delicious food, impeccable service. Enjoyed dining on the deck, witnessing a stunning dolphin display. Definitely a must-visit again!

Great spot with stylish sidewalk lounge seating, an awesome DJ playing outside on Friday nights, and a convenient walk-up bar. The interior decor is impressive, and the appetizers we tried were delicious. Located in a trendy waterfront area.

This place holds a special place in my heart since I was a kid. The staff has become like family, providing friendly and prompt service. Yoli and Frank are incredible. The food is mind-blowing, especially their shredded beef burro and cheese crisp. It's as authentic as it gets.
Mellow Mushroom is hands down the best pizza place in the bay with a great beer selection. The Maui Wowie is our favorite, with the perfect crunchy crust. Friendly staff and no wait for a table.

Chipotle's steak is my go-to remedy for an upset stomach. Avoiding peak lunch hours, I opt for a peaceful visit between 2 and 4 pm. Regardless of the crowd, their service remains friendly and efficient.
Fast service, quality ingredients, and pleasant staff combined to create the healthiest meal option in the mall.

Overall, the restaurant had some great dishes like the seaweed salad, shiomay, and sashimi which were fresh and delicious. However, the service was lacking as our waiter was unfriendly and made assumptions about our order. While the banzai roll was unique and tasty, the salad dressing tasted more like carrot purée. One star was deducted due to the subpar service.

Kmart lacks in quality and selection, particularly in electronics and movies. The store's atmosphere is unimpressive and attempts at creating a department store experience fall flat. However, they offer good deals on patio furniture during off seasons and clearance days. The pharmacy receives credit for efficient service and convenient hours. Overall, Kmart remains subpar and may appeal to a niche group of shoppers.

I've been a member at this convenient and reasonably priced gym for a few weeks now and I'm enjoying it. They have all the basic amenities, including plenty of cardio machines, weights, a lap pool, a spin class room, and a big aerobics studio. The staff is really nice and you get a free personal trainer session upon signing up. Your membership fee also allows you to use their other locations at no extra cost. They offer limited babysitting hours for those with kids. The only downsides are the late weekend opening time and the lack of early morning group fitness classes, except for a 5:45am spin class. Overall, if you're looking for a gym with friendly people and good equipment without the fancy extras, joining LA Fitness will save you some money.

Had an amazing lunch of fried green tomatoes and vegan barq. Excellent food, great beer selection, and a fantastic vibe. Super friendly and attentive staff, with enjoyable tunes playing in the background. Will definitely be returning!
Highly recommend this place! Daily visits led to noticeable improvements in my strength and flexibility. The diverse teachers offer beneficial classes. Monthly membership is a must!

This salon is terrible. I've witnessed bugs in the past, and during my recent visit, I opted for a spray tan. However, the outdated machine I was given had no heater, and I wasn't even offered a better option upon arrival. To add insult to injury, the person in the superior versapro room was still receiving sprays while I left, suggesting that I was shortchanged. From now on, I'll be going to Shine, where the rooms are consistently better.

I am incredibly impressed with this coffee shop in Reno. As coffee enthusiasts from Sacramento, my husband and I expected nothing but excellence, and we found it here. This place is an absolute gem that we wish existed back in Sac. It has become our go-to coffee shop, without a doubt. Their Matcha lattes are simply amazing. Sigh.
This draft latte is exceptionally good. 10/10. Plus, the guy at the register complimented my tie.
I am a sushi snob and this was the worst sushi I've ever had. It was warm and the side salad was just plain iceberg lettuce. I won't be returning.

Impeccable food and service at Sbraga! The chefs counter 6 course with wine pairings was worth the price. The front row view of the deliciousness being prepared was amazing. The talented team ran like a well-oiled machine. Highlights include the Gruyere popover with foie gras soup, saffron spaghetti with blue crab, crispy Arctic char, and even the chicken liver mousse (surprisingly delicious). The wines were perfectly matched. Special birthday celebrations were made extra memorable with a note from Sbraga and a thoughtful goodie bag. Already looking forward to a return visit!
I highly recommend this place! Fantastic food, friendly staff, and a peaceful atmosphere. The crepes are absolutely amazing, the best I've ever had. My friends also rave about this place.
The service was poor and the food was average. Regret choosing this place for my final dinner here.

The prices initially seemed reasonable, but I soon realized they charge extra for every add-on. Unfortunately, the food is subpar, with hard and dry rice and sad, limp burritos. The waitress had a terrible attitude on both my visits. The saving grace is their guacamole and strong margaritas. It seems their tactic is to intoxicate customers into not minding the mediocre food and rude service.
The chicken sandwich was absolutely amazing, making it a fantastic choice for the surrounding industrial atmosphere.

Had a great experience as a walk-in at this clean location with friendly staff. Tammy did an amazing job on my eyebrows, and as a first-time guest, the service was free. They offer fantastic packages for various waxing services. Will definitely be returning!

Overall, I had a positive experience with Young who did my pedicure. She was friendly, had a positive attitude, and provided thorough massaging. However, I was disappointed with the gel manicure done by the owner. The old gel polish was not fully removed, the polish application was uneven with noticeable bumps, and the sides of my nails were not fully covered. This experience has made me reconsider returning to the salon.

Tried the falafel wrap again today after a previous average experience. Disappointingly, very little flavor except for excessive saltiness. The falafels and pita were lacking in taste, and even the tzatziki sauce couldn't salvage it. The sauce resembled a tasteless glue rather than the flavorful one expected. The only redeeming aspect was the fresh diced cucumber and tomato, but sadly overshadowed by the unsatisfying white sauce that shouldn't be called tzatziki :(

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at this restaurant. The General Tsao chicken was delicious and my wife loved her Curry Chicken. The portions and prices were reasonable, and the customer service was excellent. The limited seating was not an issue for us. We will definitely be returning in the future.

Absolutely amazing food! Must-try BBQ shrimp and the truffle fries are a hit. Truffle butter filet mignon is a must for truffle lovers. Don't miss the delicious bread pudding and white chocolate brownie for dessert.

This place is amazing! The atmosphere is laid back and welcoming, and they even let us bring our dog. We enjoyed sitting on the cozy wrap around porch outside. It was the perfect ending to our trip, and the food kept me full for the long car ride home. I had the delicious but rich bananas foster French toast, and although I couldn't finish it due to the generous portion size, it was still amazing. My fiancé opted for the vegetable omelet, a healthier choice that was also delicious. I can't wait to go back and try something else from their menu, perhaps one of their famous juices next time.

The food at Mr. B was excellent, especially the shrimp and grits and barbecued shrimp. The appetizers were enjoyable as well. The bread pudding was slightly disappointing, being dry in a city known for it. The service was good but could have been more attentive. The location is great, although the restaurant was uncomfortably cold in July, so be prepared to wear long sleeves or bring a jacket.

Highly recommend this place if you're a lobster lover! The prices are great, the service is top-notch, and the food is absolutely delicious. It's a very casual dining experience, perfect for a quick lobster fix. Don't miss out on the Lobster special, it's a steal at $19.99. The clam chowder and lobster roll are also must-tries.

Henry's, the neighborhood coffee spot I recently discovered, unfortunately left a lackluster first impression. The atmosphere was standard with ordinary furniture, lacking uniqueness. The coffee, specifically the iced coffee, was bitter and disappointing. Hoping for a better experience with hot coffee or espresso in the future. Not off to a great start, Henry.
We consistently enjoyed impeccable food and service during our breakfast visits. Highly recommended!

Overall, the reviewer had a positive experience at the water park. The facilities were clean, the lifeguards were attentive, and they enjoyed the smaller crowd due to visiting during a non-typical time. However, they found the water and air temperature to be a bit cold, and the park was smaller compared to other indoor water parks. They were also slightly annoyed by the periodic closures of the big slides. The reviewer believes that timing is crucial for a pleasant visit and suggests using AAA cards for savings.
I highly recommend the Oyster Bar, especially if you're lucky enough to be served by Kentrelle. The "firecracker" dish will leave you amazed.

The Lemon Cake at Cake Life is a heavyweight in terms of both size and taste. Despite opting out of cupcakes, the decision was justified as their cakes are simply outstanding. Their cakes rock, and I can't wait for more visits in the future.

My second experience here was even better than the first. Despite some initial kinks during the grand opening, this time they had multiple beer bottle openers and improved the portion size of the garlic noodle. Although certain tables still seemed drafty, we were seated at a better table and it didn't bother me. The food was amazing as always, and I'm already excited for my next visit. Even on a Saturday evening at 5pm, we had no trouble getting seated. I'm so glad to have these guys in our local neighborhood. Highly recommended!

I recently tried their pre fixe meal for $22 and loved the combination of flavors on my plate. The chicken was moist and the vegetables were tasty, although slightly greasy. Overall, it was a great dining experience. 

Their take out/delivery service is also a favorite of mine. I appreciate how they package their food in reusable plastic containers, avoiding excessive waste. The food may not be exceptional, but it is consistently enjoyable. Although the prices are a bit high, the contemporary restaurant atmosphere, excellent service, and dependable food make it a reliable choice.

Ed's is a massive entertainment venue with a variety of activities and spaces, including restaurants, bars, video games, and more. It's great for young kids and birthday parties. They also host live bands, featuring lesser-known but interesting musicians who can attract a decent crowd. Overall, Ed's is a fun and affordable place to enjoy endless entertainment in E-town.

Overall, On the Border in Mount Laurel offers delicious chips and salsa, good beer specials, and a variety of vegetarian sides. The cheese enchiladas are particularly tasty. Dining service is usually great, although the bartenders can be hit-or-miss. While some, like Joann, provide friendly and attentive service, others, like Nikki, offer poor service with long waits and unfriendly demeanor. Despite this inconsistency, the restaurant provides good appetizers, cold beer, reasonable prices, and generally satisfactory service.

Overall, the takoyaki was tasty but a bit doughy and greasy, requiring a acquired taste or being drunk to fully appreciate. It's worth a try for a first venture, but be aware that they are heavy for their size. As for the curry chicken, it was disappointing with a rich roux and not the best I've had. Despite this, it's still worth another visit for Japanese fast food.
Great Mahi Mahi with a generous portion size, perfect for sharing. Ideal if you enjoy smoked fish. The server was friendly and pleasant.

My experience with Shalimar was absolutely wonderful. They accommodated my same-day request to resize my engagement ring for a very reasonable price. Even though I made a mistake in determining the size, they were understanding and resized it back up within an hour at no charge. Their excellent customer service has earned my loyalty. Very grateful for such a great experience.

I had a great time at this casino, conveniently located just an hour away from Orlando. Despite the typical casino atmosphere, the overpriced burgers and fries at the Hard Rock Cafe were a downside. However, I had a stroke of luck playing the Breakfast at Tiffany's slot machine, which was enjoyable as a fan of the movie.
The service was good, staff polite, but the food lacked flavor. Drinks were average. Suitable for a quick lunch.

New St. Louis Wok is a reliable local Chinese restaurant that delivers to our area. Orders are consistently delivered within an hour, and their online ordering website helps overcome language barriers. They request credit card information over a call for added convenience. Their food is excellent, avoiding excessive greasiness, and always arrives hot with a variety of sauces and fortune cookies. When we crave Chinese food, it is our top choice.
Nigel is amazing and his candy is worth the drive! My friends can't get enough of his delicious Bon bons.
Fantastic hot chicken! First time visiting and it was absolutely amazing. Hands down the best hot chicken I've ever had. Definitely a must-stop every time we come to Nashville.
The yogurt and crepes at this place are amazing! Highly recommend stopping by to try them.

Incredible place! Spacious, modern, and impeccably clean. Will, Amanda, and Sal are amazing. Always there to help, especially for a newbie like me. Wide variety of juices, mods, and atty's to try. Totally in love with this spot!

I had a negative experience at this venue due to the disrespectful treatment by the bouncer. Despite being on the guest list, I was accused of sneaking in for free and denied entry. I will not be returning.

Overall, the food at this Mediterranean food truck is tasty but not outstanding. It's a great late-night spot, perfect for satisfying late-night cravings. The portion size for the price could be improved, but it's fair enough. The restaurant has ample seating and provides a nice break from the nearby bar/club scenes. The place is clean, and the servers are quick and friendly. The dimly lit atmosphere and eclectic decoration may seem strange, but it adds to the unique charm of the place. Despite its quirks, I would definitely return.

I absolutely love this concept! The café serves an impressive range of coffees, teas, and breakfast items, while the other half offers delicious bar-style apps, salads, and sandwiches. The wide variety of beers available on tap, bottled, or in can is a major plus. This casual spot is perfect for spending hours with friends, reminiscent of the good ol' college days. And the best part? You can bring your furry friend along, as they are more than welcome here.

This restaurant offers a disappointing dining experience with slow service, a dirty environment, and mediocre, overpriced breakfast options. I strongly recommend trying other nearby options like First Watch or Pinky's instead, as they offer better quality and value. The claims of higher prices at these alternatives are unfounded. Avoid wasting your time at this deteriorated establishment.

Tina provided excellent service with quick attention, even on a Sunday morning. The wait time was minimal, approximately 15 minutes. The standout dish was the huevos bruncheros, an absolute must-try. It's hard to put into words how delicious it was, simply give it a taste yourself!

The Mandarin is a trendy dance club that offers a variety of cocktails and beers. The door charge for guys on certain nights is common in the industry. The enclosed patio is spacious even during winter. The music is hit-or-miss, ranging from enjoyable hip-hop and pop to un-danceable tunes. Talking inside is difficult due to the loud music. If you're in the CWE and in the mood for dancing, the Mandarin is worth a try.

The beer at this place was good, but not amazing. The location is a bit isolated and industrial, lacking in scenery. However, they do offer a discount on beer when a train passes by. I would give it a 3.5-star rating. Despite the location, it was still popular with a loyal following on a Sunday afternoon.

I purchased a used 09 Rav4 from Glanzmann Subaru last month. The process was simple, but I was disappointed with the vehicle's description. There were several aesthetic defects not mentioned by the sales team, which took away from the overall value. I expected a more honest and direct interaction from this family-owned dealership. I urge Mr. Jeff Glanzmann to prioritize honesty in their sales process.

I found this cute spot on Germantown Ave and they didn't disappoint when it came to satisfying my sweet tooth. They had a wide selection of cookies and bars, and I was intrigued by their "cake scrapple" cups filled with different flavors of cakes and icings. I chose the Red Velvet with cream cheese frosting, along with an M&M cookie. The cookie was soft, chewy, and had a nice texture from the hard candies. The cake was also delicious and moist. Overall, a delightful experience.

Standing in line and squeezing onto a wooden bench with strangers may not sound appealing, and the lack of heating or air conditioning may not be ideal, but trust me, it's worth it. The jazz show is incredibly fun and the venue itself is cool and legendary. Give it a try at least once, and I'm willing to bet that you'll keep coming back for more.
The food is excellent, but the bathrooms were in poor condition, deducting 1 star.

I enjoyed the modern and cozy ambiance with appropriate lighting for dinner. The waiter seemed impatient and rushed, not fully focused on providing a great experience. The Shrimp Breaux Bridge and Balsamic Salmon were tasty, but not extraordinary. The Pesto Crusted Idaho Trout was well-cooked and flavored. The Zangria White lacked advertised fruits, which was disappointing. Despite the shortcomings, I would give the place another chance due to the positive reputation of the menu and hopeful better service.

Enzo's is a solid takeout choice with a delicious meatball sub and tasty garlic knots. While I preferred nabruzzi's pizza, I'll continue ordering from Enzo's for their homemade meatballs. I do miss the old pizza options though.

Just had an amazing experience at this restaurant! Bailey provided exceptional service, being friendly and attentive throughout our visit. The food was absolutely incredible - the hummus plate, pretzels, mozzarella sticks, and caprese salad were all fresh and delicious. The generous portion sizes amazed us. It was our first time here, but we are already planning to come back!
The staff is amazing, always helpful even close to closing time. The website offers coupons for 40% off a regular priced item, so you're always getting a great deal. Great store overall!
Incredible diner with great food and generous portions. Biscuits and gravy were outstanding. Highly recommended (6/5 stars)!
The store is like Disneyland for adults - I love it! Prices may be a bit high, but I still enjoy going just to look around.

Absolutely loved my dining experience at Smiley's! Smiley is an amazing host and the food was simply delicious. I enjoyed it so much that I'm having it for lunch again today and I can't wait. I highly recommend this place to everyone in Manayunk, it's a gem that shouldn't be missed!
I highly recommend this place for smog tests on cars due to their excellent service and cheerful staff.

I've been a loyal customer for years, and this spot remains truly great. In my opinion, it offers one of the top 3 steaks in the city. Even after a name change, the quality has stayed consistent. For a delicious twist, I highly recommend trying their chicken cheesesteak.

I highly recommend this place! The staff is incredibly friendly and great with kids. The food, especially the hash browns, is amazing. You can also try their delicious tomatoes and grits on the side. Best of all, it's budget-friendly.
Incredible and distinctive dishes. Exceptional bobba and pork pancake.
The biscuits are amazing and (fill in the blank) is delectable. Cocktails are top-notch. Highly recommended, although it can get a bit busy.
I highly recommend Howard for all your Volkswagen needs. Despite the slight delay in getting an appointment, he surpasses expectations with his thoroughness, reliability, knowledge, and efficiency.

Impressive place! Incredible food, efficient chipotle-style line ordering, and top-notch Indian cuisine. The staff were extremely helpful, especially for someone new to Indian food. Can't wait to go back!

I had a disappointing experience with this restaurant. Despite quick delivery, my entire order was incorrect. They offered a free meal as compensation, but refused to provide it when requested. I threatened to dispute the payment and mentioned not returning as a customer. Overall, a frustrating experience.

The rental service had insufficient staff, resulting in long wait times and a delay in car preparation. The car was not properly cleaned and the customer was charged an expensive underage fee despite being close to the required age. They recommend choosing a different rental company like Hertz to avoid such issues. The fuel option was also misleading, with prices after tax being similar to those outside, and the return location address provided was incorrect, causing further inconvenience.

Santa Barbara's seafood market offers an unbeatable freshness, rivaling the renowned Tokyo fish market. Despite lacking ambiance, the ocean view from the outdoor seating compensates for it. Delight in a wide selection of delectable shellfish, tailored to satisfy your cravings. Although you might face a wait during busy times, the experience is undoubtedly worthwhile. Use the wait to explore the nearby pier and make space for the mouthwatering feast that awaits you.

The ambiance was delightful and I thoroughly enjoyed being pampered and feeling relaxed. However, it was difficult to place a drink order, which was the only reason I didn't give them a perfect score. I had to ask four different people before being directed to use the white phone to call room service.

If you manage to beat the crowd, you're in for a treat. The only downside is the small size. However, everything on the menu is simply amazing, including their options for vegetarians and vegans. I highly recommend trying their French toast specials. This place is a must-visit for breakfast before heading to the Mardi Gras parades.

I'm very disappointed with the food from this restaurant. The presentation was good and the delivery was prompt, but everything else fell short. The sushi was mushy and warm due to being packed with hot food, and the rainbow roll had avocado instead of raw fish. The calamari was undercooked and had breading falling off, so I couldn't eat it. The chicken lettuce wraps were also not as described on the menu. I won't be ordering from here again. I'll stick to Niji's on 5th.

Overall, the service was excellent and the chocolate cake for dessert was amazing. However, the disappointment came from the food, which was not up to expectations. The egg drop soup was hot, but the rest of the dishes were served at room temperature. The shrimp with candied walnuts was overly sweet and didn't complement the bland brown rice. Despite being accommodating to food allergies, PF Changs failed to impress.
Great rich food but a bit pricey. Delicious and ever-changing menu. The most unique donuts around.

I absolutely love this shoppe! The staff is awesome, creating a great atmosphere. They offer a variety of healthy and tasty treats, including delicious croissants. The menu for breakfast and lunch is impressive, and every dish I've tried here has been nothing short of fantabulous.
Highly recommend this small shop! It's definitely worth the drive. The wine cakes are exceptional. Went based on Yelp reviews and will be returning for sure.

This restaurant falls short in providing basic services; patrons are expected to fetch their own water, drinks, and endure a dirty outdoor seating area with uncomfortable chairs. The wait staff is minimally helpful, only delivering food after payment at the window. Comparable to New Orleans Hamburger and Seafood, with live music but lacks cleanliness. I wouldn't recommend returning.

This adorable local ice cream spot in Tucson serves high-quality and tasty treats. However, prices are a bit steep, with a regular single scoop costing $4.50. Overall, it deserves 4 stars due to the slightly higher prices.

Overall, I've had a great experience at this restaurant. The servers are dedicated and genuinely want to make your experience enjoyable. The seafood is decent, considering the limitations of getting fresh seafood in Tucson. The sauce they offer is similar to other popular seafood places, with an Asian twist. The price range is similar to other seafood restaurants, and while it may be expensive, it's not overpriced. I would recommend this place and would go back again.

I highly recommend this place, it might even be better than Halal Guys. Despite arriving close to closing time, the friendly staff, especially Jules, made me feel welcome and helped me navigate the menu. I ordered the steak shwarma with rice and all the sauces, and it was absolutely delicious! The food had a healthy quality to it and left me feeling satisfied. I will definitely be returning here.

I have been a loyal patron of this place for years, and despite living in Colorado now, I make it a point to visit whenever I'm in Philadelphia for work. The menu offers a variety of delicious options, with generous portions and affordable prices. My personal favorite is the Indian Mee Goreng, it's so amazing that I wish I could eat it every day. Perhaps one day I'll be lucky enough to get the recipe from the manager so I can enjoy it even when I'm in CO.
The food is delicious, but the service is consistently slow or poor, despite not being busy most of the time.

Yats is a must-visit spot with a variety of delicious options served in generous portions. The affordable prices and vegetarian choices make it even more appealing. The standout item is the incredibly flavorful garlic bread, available at a great value. Additionally, the owner, Joe Vuskovich, is a local celebrity and community supporter, adding to the restaurant's charm.
Terrible experience - caused stomach issues for my family. Used to be a favorite, but never again. Slow delivery.

First visit to this location was a disappointment. Didn't receive change or receipt, despite asking for it. No spoon for chili and old cheese on burger indicated lack of attention to detail. Burger tasted alright, but overall experience made me reluctant to return.

Prep & Pastry is a must-visit brunch spot in town. The trick of adding your name to the waitlist before arriving is a game-changer. The food, especially the breakfast sandwich, is consistently excellent, including their sweets. Their iced tea is top-notch. The staff is incredibly friendly. Highly recommended.

Overall, the ambience of the restaurant was okay despite being located in a mall in New Hope. The service was slow due to being understaffed, but the staff was apologetic and pleasant. The wait was worth it. The Vegetable Samosas were delicious, however, the chicken was slightly dry. The chicken tikka masala was flavorful and rich, while the chicken tagine was amazing. The restaurant has a laid-back atmosphere, and the menu offers a good mix of cuisines with just enough options. It is BYOB, so we were unprepared but would definitely return.

The hotel was a decent option in downtown Tampa. We stayed in the suite with a fold-out couch, which was comfortable. We unfortunately missed the happy hour with free drinks, but it's a cool amenity. The complimentary breakfast was amazing, featuring made-to-order omelets, fresh fruit, cereal, toast, bacon, sausage, home fries, juice, and pastries. The room was modern, with two TVs, clean, and had a strong shower.

The prices for unlimited food are unbeatable, but the overall experience falls short. While the sushi is delicious, the salad is mediocre and the crab Rangoon is disappointing. Nonetheless, I have visited twice and would still consider returning.

This is my go-to spot for fish tacos! The beef taco and chicken fajitas were average, but the fish tacos are amazing. The prices are affordable and two tacos fill me up. The interior and patio are awesome, and there's a Ben and Jerry's next door for dessert. Overall, a happy visit every time!

I had a disappointing experience watching Star Wars Rogue One in 3D at this theater. The ticket purchase and atmosphere were good, and the food was delicious. However, the screen was extremely dark, making it difficult to see the actors' faces. Even the 3D glasses didn't help, as the shadows in the background were double. The manager was unhelpful and refused to acknowledge the issue. I won't be returning for their 3D showings.
NOLA's healthy dining spot with great to-go options! Enjoyed the delicious turkey meatballs and spaghetti for a wonderful lunch.

Johnny Tucci and his crew exceeded our expectations as videographers for our wedding. Their professionalism, punctuality, and extraordinary talent made our wedding footage resemble a cinematic masterpiece, leaving everyone who watched it in tears. Investing in a videographer is worth every penny, and Johnny and his team will not let you down.

This place offers delicious food at a reasonable price. The escargot could have been more traditional, but still enjoyable. For an extra $50, you can dine with the ghost of the former owner who died on the second floor. The experience takes place at a solitary table in a cold, dungeon-like room.

Excellent customer service! They were incredibly accommodating, even picking us up outside their usual area. When we realized there was an overcharge on our bill, they quickly refunded the extra ticket. The tour itself was amazing. Our tour guide was funny, and we had a blast seeing alligators, turtles, and birds. Holding a baby alligator was a unique experience, and the boat ride back was thrilling. Highly recommended!

Wawa is a beacon in a cold world. The sandwiches are great and they offer the expected convenience store snacks and drinks. Though this location isn't as friendly, it still satisfies my snacking needs.

Hidden gem on the Westside with great food at a reasonable price. Must try the Indian taco and sweet fry bread. Daily specials like $1 tacos on Tuesdays and Fridays. I'm a regular, eating here at least once a week. Highly recommend.

Brother Rabbit at Compere Lapin is a fantastic addition to the New Orleans food scene. From the refreshing house cider to the phenomenal Oban 18, the drinks are top-notch. The house biscuits and butter are simply divine, a must-try. While the crispy chicken skins lacked flavor, the rest of the first course menu, including the daily oysters and marinated shrimp with jalapeño jus, were delicious and fresh. Lastly, the dobeger cake with lemon curd and chocolate ice cream topped with a heavenly chocolate sauce is a perfect ending. Whether you're with a group or on a date night, Brother Rabbit is a great choice.

Pina's in Roxborough is a highly underrated place to eat. Their stromboli and sicilian pie are both top-notch, but the sandwiches and pizza are just average. The chicken park dish is a standout, with a generous portion size and mouthwatering flavors. Overall, Pina's is a satisfying and filling dining option.

I highly recommend this new boutique taqueria near Rivers Edge Apartments. The head chef, nominated for a James Beard Award, has created a flavorful and diverse menu. With both indoor and outdoor seating, as well as a bar nearby, it offers a great dining experience. I've tried every taco and appetizer, all made with fresh local ingredients, and they are fantastic. The mushroom and short rib tacos are especially delicious, but I suggest trying them all. Whether for lunch or dinner, this place is a must-visit. I'll definitely be returning!
Always a delightful experience! Quick appointments with minimal wait time and the ladies are always sweet.

Unfortunately, I had a terrible experience with the service at this Bob Evans location. Despite loving their food, the service really needs improvement. My family and I were seated for 10 minutes without anyone offering us a drink or any service. Although there were waitresses constantly passing by, they didn't bother to acknowledge us. It took two servers to apologize for the misunderstanding about who would serve our table, even though the restaurant wasn't busy. The food was good, but the service was very slow.

I was excited to try this location of Naked Tchopstix, but I was torn between giving it 3 or 4 stars. The vibe is different, more geared towards takeout, but they have a good-sized dining area too. Ordering at the counter was convenient, and I liked the customizable sushi bowl concept. However, the vegetable choices felt limited, and there was too much rice in proportion to other ingredients. The Maui roll didn't meet the same standard as the 96th street location. Despite these issues, I would still go back for the sushi bowls. The service may be slower, but it's worth it as a healthier alternative to fast food. And don't forget to try the yummy bubble tea, like the strawberry flavor!

GRI provided an exceptional experience in finding a one-of-a-kind engagement ring. From the knowledgeable and attentive staff to the custom design options, GRI exceeded our expectations. The final product was stunning and the overall experience was relaxed and pleasant. Highly recommended!

Based on previous Yelp reviews, this place had a great atmosphere and a unique blend of art house, coffee house, and Animal House vibes. The service was friendly and laid-back, and the beverages were delicious. However, the food was good but not outstanding, so I would give it three stars solely based on that. However, the atmosphere and staff deserve an extra star, so I would still consider returning to try other items on the menu.

I stopped by for takeout and a drink during happy hour. Tried the dragonberry iced tea, pleasantly refreshing. Enjoyed the lemongrass chicken and rice, but crab rangoon could have had more filling. Overall, consistent great food and service.

Highly recommended by a colleague, we visited Red Mess and were greeted by Chris who provided exceptional service. From the appetizers to the drinks and entrees, everything was delicious. A memorable dining experience indeed!
This place in St. Pete is absolutely amazing. Everything on the menu is delicious and will surely leave you in a food coma.

My boyfriend and I tried Jesse's for the first time and had a great experience. Despite being busy, we were seated quickly by the window. The server, Nikki, was prompt and knowledgeable. The appetizers and soups were tasty, although the crab stuffed mushrooms were small. The Caesar salads were good and the pacing of the meal was perfect. The steaks were cooked perfectly, but there weren't enough sautéed mushrooms. Overall, Nikki's service was fantastic and we definitely plan to return.

I highly recommend this amazing restaurant with great food and a fantastic overall experience. It's best to go with a group of about 6 people to keep costs reasonable, but if money is not an issue, go ahead and splurge! The staff is helpful and knowledgeable about their wine selection, and they even let you take home any unfinished bottles. The cheese platter has a good variety, although I wish they had more cured meats. Finding a seat can be challenging, but worth the wait. The outdoor seating is lovely, especially with live music. Make sure to order the bacon wrapped dates stuffed with chorizo and the goat cheese and mushroom dish - both are outstanding. Everything I've tried here has been great. Just relax, enjoy the food, and have a wonderful time!

I attended a conference at this 5 mile wide/long convention center with 2,000 guestrooms and 6,000 attendees. Despite booking late, I didn't want to spend $200+/night on a hotel room, so I stayed at a budget hotel across the street. The convention center itself is massive and well-staffed, with excellent shuttle service and lunch/drinks. However, the food inside is overpriced. The surrounding area has popular chain restaurants. Overall, the convention center is immaculate, but on a student budget, I opted for a cheaper hotel.
Although the rave reviews are difficult for me to comprehend, the wonderful conversation and company during my dining experience made up for it.

After attending the Zurich Classic golf tournament, I stumbled upon Creole Creamery. The interior is charming and cozy, perfect for a break from the warm and humid weather. The extensive selection of flavors is impressive, and I opted for the delicious cookie monster ice cream on a cone. It was just the right amount of sweetness. Highly recommend checking out Creole Creamery!

We had a fantastic time on this Ybor walking tour with great food stops! Our knowledgeable guide, Raymond, made it an informative and enjoyable experience. The tour lasted about 3 hours, but we went over because we got sidetracked and chatted a lot. We learned fascinating details about the history, culture, and people of Ybor. The food tastings were delicious, especially the Cuban sandwich at Stone Soup Company. Whether you're a visitor or a long-time resident, I highly recommend this fun adventure. Plus, we walked over 5000 steps, which helps offset the calories from all the delicious food!

The freshly made donuts at this place are amazing! I had to wait a bit for them to cool down, but it was worth it. The clean and not overcrowded location is a great addition to the neighborhood. Plus, they have a parking lot, which is a bonus. Definitely the best donuts in Philly and the Delaware Valley.

We had an outstanding experience at this restaurant. The food, including Gumbo Ya Ya, BBQ shrimp, and crab cakes, was exceptional, and the service was fantastic. We enjoyed everything we ordered and strongly recommend this place.

This place is top notch with phenomenal service, fantastic ambiance, and amazing food. Best brunch experience ever, with delicious French toast and unreal chicken and waffles. The "flintstones pushup-pop" drink is creative and clever. Even the deviled eggs were the best I've ever had. Everything is done right, from the music to the overall experience. Ignore any review that's not 4 stars, they must be delusional.

This deli offers fast, delicious, and attentive service. The vegetarian breakfast sandwiches are a must-try, especially the veggie sausage with havarti on an everything bagel. The menu has options for everyone, including chicken cheesesteak hoagie and chicken salad on a croissant. The food tastes fresh and is priced reasonably. The staff is helpful and accommodating. Moreover, the deli has a great snack selection, including amazing chocolate bars, a variety of chips, and addictive hi-chew candies in every flavor. Highly recommend!

Excellent experience at this Chinese and sushi restaurant. The ambiance was lovely with a nice, quiet, and dark setting. We tried the szechuan chicken, hot and sour soup, and steamed rice which were all delicious. My husband enjoyed the prime rib and shrimp hot pot. The portion sizes were just right, and we didn't have to take any leftovers home. The service was exceptional.

Amazing bar with a fantastic atmosphere. Friendly staff, including the owner, create a welcoming vibe. The diverse crowd and staff make you feel right at home. Plus, the BBQ truck parked outside is top-notch!
The sushi at this place is affordable and the specialty menu is outstanding. The Snow Mountain and Volcano sushi are both remarkable.

Mixx offers a vast menu and affordable prices, making it a perfect option for those seeking fast and budget-friendly sushi. The quality may not be the city's finest, but if you're in a hurry, it's a great choice.

El Sol exceeded our expectations for my daughter's birthday celebration. The attentive service, delectable drinks and food, and the staff's surprise of a large cake, dessert, sombreros, and even fireworks made it truly unforgettable. We're thrilled to have found this gem nearby and look forward to returning for regular dinner visits. Plus, the generous portion of fajitas ensured a delicious lunch the next day as well. Great job, guys!
The falafel wrap was average, but slightly overpriced. The ambiance of the sitting area was unappealing, resembling a cold and unwelcoming cave. Manayunk offers better dining options.

Based on this review, I would strongly advise avoiding this pizza place. The reviewer described it as the worst pizza they have ever had, with a thin crust that was not crunchy, poor quality olives, and a salad that was expensive and lacking in quality. The cheese on the salad looked powdered and came in a prepacked divider, which the reviewer considered a rip off. Although the knots were okay, the overall experience was negative. The reviewer typically prefers ordering from other pizza places like Grimaldi's, BJs, or Mellow Mushroom, or buying organic pizza from Publix or Whole Foods, which they find to be cheaper and tastier. They criticize Dominoes for being a reminder of the need for corporate chains to fall and prefer paying for quality rather than preservatives and poison. They are also planning to request a refund. This review serves as a clear warning to avoid this pizza place at all costs.

I had a delicious meal at Puckett's with their mighty tasty meat-and-two option. The squash casserole and meatloaf were top-notch. The cornbread, while advertised as such, was more like a corn fritter or hoe cake. Overall, highly recommended for a traditional and flavorful experience.

This vegan fast food joint offers delicious food at reasonable prices, with a friendly staff. Although not the best for dine-in, it matches their fast food concept. While the buffalo bella is highly promoted, I recommend trying their tasty Cheesesteak. And don't miss out on their fantastic sweet potato fries—highly recommended.

The white meat fried chicken was slimy and salty, while the sides (Mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes) were cold and flavorless. The service was strange, as the server laughed awkwardly during our order, making us feel uncomfortable. Won't return.

Yuengling Lager is a smooth, sweet and cheap beer that remains one of my top five favorites. I appreciate its low alcohol content and the fact that its taste varies per batch. The tour was enjoyable, with a funny British tour woman who took a liking to my grandpa. The facility had a nostalgic feel to it. The tasting was fantastic, although they were out of Lord Chesterfield. The fact that Yuengling rehired laid off workers after a closure adds to its appeal as a family business deserving of support.

Redemption at an old church is an extraordinary dining experience. The beautiful setting adds to the charm, especially for architecture enthusiasts. The service was impeccable, providing a fun time for our group. The paneed smoked soft shell crab was heavenly, and the seafood stuffed filet of fish was superb, enhancing the flounder's flavors. This meal ranks among the top 10 in my life. If you haven't been, you must try it!

I was extremely let down by my lunch experience here. The food was bland and overpriced, lacking in both quantity and quality. It's hard to believe that Mexican food could be so tasteless. Not only did it waste my lunch hour, but I regretted not choosing a local, authentic restaurant like Mi Pueblo. Save yourself the disappointment and support the real Mexican dining options instead.

The menu and ingredients at this place are good, but their sandwich-making skills fall short. I tried their Turkey and Brie Wrap and the Spinach Florentine Wrap, both of which were poorly assembled and resembled crumples rather than wraps. The staff seemed confused and unenthusiastic. Additionally, clearer signage for ordering, picking up, and paying would be greatly appreciated.

The lunch today was absolutely amazing. The pulled pork and smokehouse bowl were accompanied by incredibly delicious sides of sweet potato casserole and red beans and rice. The red beans and rice had a nice kick to it, while the sweet potato casserole was absolutely yummy. The meat was perfectly smoky, juicy, and there was plenty of it. This place is definitely a must-visit.
The food and coffee are great, although I wish they had a bigger espresso bar with more options. The baked goods and other food are absolutely spectacular.

I had an excellent lunch experience with my group of eight hungry people. Despite expecting a crowd, we didn't have to wait and the parking lot was empty. The server was amazing, although I can't remember her name. The cheeseburger and fries were cooked to perfection, and we all had a great time without any complaints.

The restaurant's name and logo may not hold much meaning, unless it represents three individuals pooling their resources to start the business. Regardless, the food was excellent, the staff was friendly, and they offer an extensive menu ranging from breakfast to dessert. The fact that it is open 24 hours makes it a definite go-to spot next time I'm in town.

We had a fun and festive time at the bar, with Santa and Mrs. Claus making a brief appearance. The service was a bit slow, but we didn't mind as we wanted to take our time. Overall, it's a great place for a drink or two with a nice ambiance.

This place is a must-visit for donut lovers! Even if you're not into sweets, their apple fritter and chocolate long john will change your mind. Skip other donut shops in St. Louis, this one is absolutely fantastic!

I arrived early for a reservation, but the hostesses ignored us and gave priority to a walk-in party. They blamed their mistake on a new employee and showed no remorse. Terrible customer service and lack of professionalism. Will not be going back.
Stopped in for lunch with my girlfriend and were impressed by the spotless environment. The food was outstanding and reasonably priced. Can't wait for our next visit!
I absolutely love this place! The pizza is fantastic, the staff is incredibly friendly, and it's a perfect spot for some quality time with friends and family.

This place is a hidden gem! The food is consistently amazing, and the atmosphere is just right. The service is top-notch too. Although it can be a bit pricey, the Belgian Waffle topped with Nutella is worth every penny. A must-try for anyone who loves Nutella!

Farmhaus was worth the wait. Despite a slight delay in seating, the menu helped us plan our meal in advance. The smoked fish dip and escolar with prawns were fantastic, while the meatloaf was a bit dry and bland. The service was good, considering how busy the restaurant was. I am excited to try their blue plate special lunches and would love to go back for dinner when there is outdoor seating.
Great happy hour experience with amazing service from Vaughn and Mark. The free appetizer was awesome and the slot machines brought us luck. Must visit!
I highly recommend this independent store for holiday gifts! It was such a fun experience with pleasant staff. Hooray for finding unique gifts!
This is my go-to nail shop in the city. The peaceful ambiance is perfect, and the staff is always friendly and efficient. Plus, at just $25.00 for a pedicure in the South, it's unbeatable!
Modesto in St. Louis is a standout Spanish restaurant, even among the many excellent options in NYC. It's a fantastic place that I truly miss since moving away.

The Smoked Salmon Frittata at this spot is as good as it sounds. The combination of smoked salmon, egg, potato, red bell peppers, goat cheese, horseradish-dill crema, and fresh fruit is delicious. Highly recommend for brunch, dinner, or private dining.

Pancake Pantry in Nashville is a must-visit institution. With the chance to spot country stars and enjoy a delicious breakfast, their pancakes are a definite highlight. Be prepared for a wait, but the vibrant conversations make it worth it. A truly essential Nashville experience.

Belinda and Jerry were incredibly helpful and kind during my storage experience in Boise. As a travel nurse, I needed a place to leave my car for the winter. Belinda stayed and waited for me on a snowy December evening, while Jerry drove me to my storage shed and assisted with my luggage. I am extremely satisfied with the service I received and highly recommend them!
Fantastic first day! The place was packed, but impressively well-organized. My family and I had a great time and we'll definitely be returning multiple times a week. Thank you for coming to Reno!

My husband and I reserved a Corolla-sized car online, but requested an upgrade to a Camry at Avis Rent A Car in Reno. After some discussion, we received the Camry we wanted. The staff was professional, but the rental price of $800 for five days seemed high. We had already purchased insurance for $150. The car itself was great during our vacation. However, upon dropping off the car, we found out that a weekly rate would have been just $15 more. The upgrade had cost us an extra $20 per day. I will not rent from Avis again, opting for Hertz or Dollar and making phone reservations instead. In hindsight, the extra insurance was unnecessary as my personal insurance covers everything.

Overall, my experience at Casselli's was disappointing. The waiter's unpleasant attitude, coupled with the overdone food and disruptive opera singer, made it difficult to enjoy my visit. Although convenient parking is a plus, the opportunity cost of returning to Casselli's is too high compared to other good Italian restaurants. Furthermore, the fact that it is cash-only adds an inconvenience. I will likely not be returning.

Overall, the service for our large group was adequate but not exceptional. One member received their food late, and the closeout process could use improvement. Adding a tip for the large group made the bill easy. 
I ordered the lamb kebab plate with rice and babaghanoush. The rice was well-cooked and aromatic, while the babaghanoush was delicious with extra olive oil. The presentation of the dish was pleasant. Unfortunately, the meat was dry and lacked sufficient marinade. This area needs improvement.
I've visited this restaurant before, and previous experiences were better, particularly during Ramadan when they offer an attractive and diverse buffet. The Ramadan buffet starts at 8:30, but it's best to arrive early due to high customer demand.

The food was good, but the service was terrible. Despite ordering orange juice for my kids, we only received it when we were almost done eating. Additionally, the fact that they only accept cash or checks was inconvenient. Overall, they need to improve their service.

I generally prefer independent restaurants, but the overpriced center city Philadelphia hype didn't impress me. The restaurant was spacious compared to other places in south Philly where we usually celebrate my mother-in-law's birthday. However, the prices were surprisingly high compared to what was listed on the online menu. The food and portions were average, but the dessert stood out as unique. The coordination between the bus help and waiter was off, with the bus help asking if we were done with our plates just as the waiter was discussing desserts. As expected in Philly, the bathroom was small considering the size of the restaurant.

Greko is a must-try! I had an amazing experience trying their rotisserie chicken pita and fries for lunch, and I loved it so much that I went back for dinner and lunch the next day. The Horta Greens salad and Athenian Chicken are also highly recommended. This casual restaurant truly focuses on providing great food.

Terrible experience! Delayed over an hour without any notification, and their customer policy offers zero assistance or accountability. All passengers stranded at the bus stop, wasting precious time. Avoid this company at all costs!

The BBQ Chicken Sandwich is a great deal at only $5.75! The chicken was perfectly grilled and you have the freedom to choose your own toppings/sauces. The option of grilled sourdough, wheat bun, or white bun adds variety to the sandwich. Overall, a neat and affordable choice.

The new Randall's in West County is a welcome addition. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The beer selection is impressive, offering a wide range of styles. Prices are competitive, making it a worthwhile shopping experience.

Yats is hands down the best Cajun food we've ever had. Not only is it delicious, but it's also affordable. The menu is always a pleasant surprise, with an eclectic variety of dishes displayed on a chalkboard. It has become a regular spot for my wife and me to enjoy delightful culinary surprises.

The worker was outstanding; however, the expensive price does not align with the service provided. While the worker is motivated by hourly pay, I suggest exploring hiring alternatives such as outsourcing services. Overall, hiring someone off craigslist and paying them for the service might be a more cost-effective option.

The Terrace Lounge falls short as a cocktail venue. The cocktail was weak and watery, and the liquor selection throughout Peppermill is disappointing. The service is inconsistent with overwhelmed bartenders and no designated bar areas. The atmosphere is affected by the presence of typical casino gamblers, some of whom are inconsiderate smokers. Cin Cin is a better choice with excellent cocktails and no machines at the bar. Peppermill should improve by removing the machines, training staff, and offering independent liquors.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. The combination dinner of pad Thai and coconut soup was delicious. The restaurant had a charming Thai decor and the staff provided excellent service. It's a great alternative in a town with limited food options. I might just make this my regular spot in Carp.

This place is highly overrated with subpar food and terrible service. My order was completely messed up and there were no apologies. With plenty of other options around State Street, I would strongly advise avoiding this place.

Wow! What a lucky find! With two meaderies within such a close distance, we are truly spoilt for choice. The meads at this new establishment are absolutely perfect. We tried Goober Vitis, Suzy's Cherry Pie, and the coffee flavor, and they were all exceptional. The flavors are pure and the aromas are delightful. The spacious interior with big tables and an L-shaped bar, along with picnic tables outside, make for a very pleasant visit.

This place is a hidden gem for Cinco de Mayo enthusiasts. With a diverse menu combining flavors from various cuisines, they create unique and tantalizing recipes. Despite not being specifically Mexican, they excel at margaritas and tequila. The newly opened wine bar next door is perfect for overflow and specialty bottles. The on the rocks margaritas and house-made sangria are outstanding. A must-visit destination!

The bar attached to the Alexander Hotel is a must-visit. With a menu featuring vintage pre-prohibition cocktails, the standout is "The Elephant in the Room," a bourbon cocktail served in a decanter filled with cherrywood smoke. You control how long it infuses, adding to the experience. The comfortable seating and spacious deck, complete with heating, provide a great spot to enjoy the bustling street below. Additionally, you can watch people work out at the CityWay YMCA through the glass. Don't miss the truffle oil and sea salt popcorn - it's addictive! Grab a beer and start collecting bags - you won't be able to resist.

Unfortunately, my experience at this Starbucks location was disappointing. The iced coffee I ordered was completely ruined with an excessive amount of coffee grinds at the bottom. Not the relaxing start to my busy day that I had hoped for.

Katie's is a classic neighborhood restaurant in New Orleans with a touch of Italian-American influence. Their meatballs are outstanding, and you'll encounter plenty of friendly and traditional locals dining early in the evening. Adjust your expectations, and you'll have a satisfying dining experience.

A group of us tried a variety of dishes and the squid steak was truly outstanding. The flavor was exceptional. However, the slow service and overly expensive prices were disappointing. Despite this, with improved service and more reasonable prices, they would have earned 4 stars.
The beer selection was excellent, although service at the bar was a bit slow.
First time here and not disappointed. Amazing seafood seasoning. Ordered oysters, $45 combo, and garlic chicken wings for family of six - more than enough for us. Only complaint is order mix-up.

Arrived late for food, limited options available. Opted for a pizza, crust was too thick. Explored the store and discovered Scharffenberger chocolate, which satisfied our cravings. Staff seemed tired at 8pm.

I absolutely love their food delivery service! The gyro was incredibly delicious and generously sized - I had to save half for later. The fries were unnecessary, as the gyro itself was filling. The tzaziki was perfect and the meat was tender. I will definitely be returning!
Amazing food and worth the drive! Authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Loved the Chicken Basil and their Boba Tea is great too! Don't listen to the negative reviews, try it and judge for yourself!
This breakfast sandwich on a biscuit is absolutely amazing—possibly the best ever! So delicious!

Always fresh and delicious homemade food. Friendly staff and great Italian specialties. The rolls are also excellent. Disregard the negative comment, the owners truly care about customer satisfaction.

I enjoyed my experience at this new restaurant despite some slow service. The margarita and cilantro chicken enchiladas were great. The outdoor seating area was pleasant. Overall, I liked it and hope they improve their flow over time. The prices are reasonable and it's a refreshing addition to the neighborhood. Hope Loco succeeds!

I had a disappointing experience at this shop on Broad Street. Despite needing a jump for my car right in front of their store, I was told they couldn't assist me because they couldn't leave the store. Even when I suggested that another employee could help or they could assist me later, I was met with a firm refusal. It's ironic and frustrating that a place servicing cars couldn't even offer a simple jump. The service was lacking and definitely not customer-oriented. The employee behind the counter seemed more interested in surfing the web and playing on their phone. Overall, it was a disappointing and frustrating experience.

Stopped by this bar on the way back to the hotel for a second drink after a disappointing experience elsewhere. Opted for the hand grenades without studying the menu and boy, were they worth it! At $9 each, they packed a punch and we were definitely feeling it by the end. Great atmosphere with a band playing and open air. Enjoyed singing along and had a lot of fun. Close to Jackson Square, highly recommend.

We ordered pizzas to take away from this place while on vacation and wanting to avoid cooking. The restaurant was located 500 meters from our accommodation. The atmosphere inside was pleasant, clean, and comfortable for dining in. The staff, particularly the friendly and attentive man who served us, was excellent. We tried various flavors including prosciutto, ham, pepperoni, onion, mushrooms, anchovies, and basil with tomato. The pizzas took around 25 to 30 minutes to be ready, and all of them were delicious. The stone-baked style, with the perfect amount of tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese, was delightful. The warmth of the service reflected the experience of dining in. Overall, I would rate this place five stars.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant mainly due to the poor service. While the food was good, the staff member who took my order was rude and unhelpful. Despite being referred by the front desk of my hotel, I was told that the hospitality discount was only available to front desk employees. The staff member reluctantly applied the discount after some arguing. Overall, I was shocked by the lack of professionalism and will not be returning.

I absolutely loved the atmosphere, Connor's excellent service, and my dinner at this restaurant. The cakes, barley soup, and shrimp ravioli were all delicious, and the Malbec wine complemented my meal perfectly. It was my first visit, and I was thrilled to discover that they serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I highly recommend this place and will definitely return in the future.

Unfortunately, Millers did not live up to expectations. Despite convenient location, ample parking, and spacious tables with a fireplace for ambiance, the consistently long wait times suggested a less than average dining experience. The guacamole portion was huge but lacked flavor, while the zinger boneless wings were enjoyable, along with the attractive hostesses. The server was pleasant and attentive, addressing issues promptly. However, the wilted side salad was disappointing and the main dishes lacked flavor and presentation. The plastic dishes and high price for a lackluster experience were discouraging. The desire for dessert was overshadowed by the risk of disappointment. Overall, the experience did not meet expectations, and the reviewer does not plan to return for dining in, although the husband might order wings for takeout.

The lamb gyros plate is a must-try, worth driving the distance for. The tiramisu is delicious as well. Dolmas are decent, but a bit too vinegary for my taste. The Greek salad accompanying the entree is also enjoyable.

Despite the higher-than-expected crowd, the staff at Chick-fil-A in Reno was amazing. Despite waiting in line for 8 minutes, we got our food within 5 minutes of finding a table. The restaurant ran smoothly despite the large number of people. Although one sandwich was messed up, the issue was promptly resolved. The staff was attentive, going around to ask for refills and feedback on the food. Overall, we're glad to have a Chick-fil-A in Reno, as they maintained their high standards even on opening day.

Had a terrible experience at this place. Called ahead to request a deboned duck, but the girl answering the phone had trouble understanding my order. Ended up receiving a whole duck with stuffing I did not ask for. When I called to complain, they offered no compensation, only a trade-in option. Disappointed with the terrible customer service overshadowing the food.

Avoid this place at all costs. They prioritize money over customer satisfaction and are hesitant to accept returns. Their cash-only policy and focus on selling damaged items should raise major red flags. Do yourself a favor and steer clear, as they don't deserve any support.

This place was awful. The service was terrible, with no acknowledgment or attention from the staff. The menu was limited and overpriced, with poorly seasoned and overly breaded food. The only positive was the good music and the food being decent, but overall, I would never recommend this place. However, their takeout could be repurposed as great dog food.

I expressed frustration regarding the lack of contact information for the owner and the state of cleanliness and maintenance of the columbarium. Despite my request for improvements, the person I dealt with did not acknowledge the need for action or display any empathy.
The live Jazz music at this place is simply amazing. With no alcohol or food distractions, it truly celebrates the soul of NOLA city culture. At $15, the tickets offer exceptional value.

Hidden gem in Brentwood! This shop offers innovative flavors like pumpkin and whipped cream cheese. The owner, Michael, is incredibly friendly and generous with samples. Can't wait to try out his next creations!

Ghini's serves incredibly delicious food, especially for French breakfast lovers. The eggs provencale, with basted eggs, hot house tomato, and fragrant herbs, are a unique and tasty choice. Don't forget to try the baguette toast and add the affordable hashbrowns. The crepes, both sweet and savory, are also delightful, with the spinach and Swiss being a personal favorite. Highly recommended.

This restaurant offers a pay-as-you-go style dining experience. The food was neither exceptional nor disappointing. The server accommodated my request for spicier salsa and pico de gallo. However, they did not inform me that only bottled drinks were available for Coke. Additional charges were applied for condiments, resulting in a higher bill for condiments than the actual food. It is advisable to inquire about extra charges when ordering.
The large turtle tank has been replaced with a vibrant fish aquarium, with no information about the turtle's whereabouts. However, I still highly recommend it.
The service was good and the mesquite wings were excellent, perfect for sharing or saving some for later. However, the weak lemonade was the weakest I've ever had.
I discovered this breakfast spot thanks to a local's recommendation. They were right. No line, amazing food, and I'll definitely be going back when I'm in the south.
This DQ lacks quality and is not recommended. The staff seems inexperienced and it's best to look for another location.
Great food, excellent service! Only minor issue: our entrees arrived a bit too soon after the appetizers. Overall, a great experience.
We had an amazing experience at this clean and inviting restaurant! All six of us enjoyed delicious burgers and left thoroughly satisfied. Don't miss out on their must-try sweet potato tots.
Terrible service. Put on hold multiple times, rude staff, wrong order delivered, and unhelpful response. Avoid at all costs.

Overall, the restaurant had a lackluster atmosphere upstairs, but the food was delicious. The Catfish Acadian was a standout dish, with a tasty and mysterious sauce accompanying it. The vegetables were also well cooked. However, the pork chop was underwhelming, so seafood might be a better choice. The waitress, Bria, was exceptional and made the visit enjoyable. While the reviewer is unsure about returning, they might give it another chance for dinner on the balcony as recommended.

Cuenelli's Peruvian Style Rotisserie Chicken offers a flavorful and tender chicken that is marinated and seasoned to perfection. The smoky element from the charcoal oven adds a unique touch. The chicken is served with delicious dipping sauces, and the sides, such as cilantro rice and spicy pinto beans, complement the meal well. The maduros, or sweet plantains, are a must-try with their caramelized exterior and soft interior. Refreshing drinks like Inca cola and chicha limena complete the experience. This chicken is made with love and will redefine your perception of rotisserie chicken.
Had a great experience with JT at Ashley Furniture store! He was extremely helpful, especially when I needed to modify my order.

I was disappointed with my recent visit to this DSW location. Compared to the Marlton store, I found fewer shoe options and lower quality in the clearance section. The new layout made it feel like a warehouse, which was not the experience I expected. The lack of assistance and attention from staff was also frustrating.

Bab Cafe is a must-visit Asian restaurant in Reno, offering incredible flavor and a sauce bar to mix things up. The friendly and knowledgeable staff make ordering a breeze. The Jeyuk Top-Bab (spicy pork) is a must-try dish with unbeatable taste. The included miso soup and convenient downtown location add to the great value. Whether taking away, dining in, or getting it delivered, Bab Cafe is a fantastic culinary experience.

I have been a fan of this place for almost 25 years and continue to love it. It started as a Delaware treat, but I'm glad it's expanding to more locations. I hope they come to the Huntsville AL area soon. Although this review is not about this specific location, if it's as good as others I've been to, it will be great! The seating was plentiful, the place was clean, and they were playing good music while I waited. The only downside is that they don't have Herrs chips like the Delaware locations, but that's not a big problem.

The sliders at this place are fantastic! Perfect size allows you to try more than one, and the fried chicken slider, BLT slider, monte cristo, and Cuban were all delicious. Now it's time to get some donuts to go!

Overall, I had a mixed experience at this restaurant. The location is great, being at Hotel Palomar, but one pretentious waiter left a negative impression. However, the bartender, Ben, was exceptional and made us feel welcomed and valued. The room service was also excellent, with delicious dishes like bacon wrapped dates and chocolate cake. It's a shame that one bad egg could have tainted an otherwise great experience.
I am absolutely obsessed with this store! Being an addict, I just can't resist. The price I paid for a Bebe top, a Banana Republic skirt, and a BCBG skirt was only $4.13. Ridiculous savings!

I love browsing in this trendy shopping area near Mass Ave. Silver in the City is my first choice for unique home and style items. They even allow dogs inside, which is a huge plus for me. The only downside is that the employees tend to watch you closely, which limits privacy while browsing and deciding on purchases.

Fellini's Cafe in Newtown Square is a romantic BYOB with big portions at decent prices. Although there were some hiccups in service and minor issues with the food, overall it was delicious and the manager's gesture of allowing an expired gift card was appreciated. I will continue visiting this restaurant as they do most things well and it's affordable.
Hands down, the bayou burger is the ultimate burger experience. The staff is fantastic too, earning a resounding thumbs up.

The museum offers an incredible collection for free, with beautiful exhibits that include African and Modern Art. The outdoor sculpture garden and gift shop were also impressive. Highly recommended, but remember no photography in the Modern Art section!

I absolutely love this hotel! The lobby is adorable with comfortable seating and eclectic decorations. The staff, including Jasmine, Kayla, and Roshid, are amazing and friendly. The rooms are immaculate, especially the fantastic bathrooms in the king spa rooms. The decor is attractive and everything is in perfect condition. This hotel is a must-visit in Philadelphia, with a great location near historical sites. Stay at the Monaco, you won't regret it!

I highly recommend this place! The crab cake appetizer was delicious with a refreshing dill sauce. The chicken tenders were generous in portion and satisfying. The service was fine, although it can get busy at times. The prices were unbelievably reasonable. The ambiance is nice and overall, it's a lovely option for great food at a reasonable price.

I had a fantastic experience at this place. The service was outstanding, the food was fresh and delicious, and the atmosphere was beautiful. Lisa, our host, was amazing and made our evening even more enjoyable. We will definitely be returning soon!

I went to this place on a Wednesday night. Despite being quiet, all tables were reserved except for the tall ones in the bar area. The location is not appealing, but the interior is stylish and masculine. The staff was knowledgeable and attentive, and the menu was intriguing. We ordered 3 small plates and a side dish, which was a bit too much for two people. The food was varied and unique, with reasonable prices. The smoked trout and venison hot dogs were fantastic, while the mini monte cristos were underwhelming. Overall, we paid $52.05 for the meal and left satisfied.

Found this place on Yelp and the reviews were spot on. The sandwiches are delicious, and despite the wait in line, the fast and friendly service made it worth it. We ordered four different sandwiches, filled up our sodas, and in no time, our food was delivered to our table. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

My husband and I, being older, thoroughly enjoyed our time at this Par-Tee. The friendly server made us feel welcome and was knowledgeable about the drinks. The beer and liquor selection impressed us, and we were pleasantly surprised by the small but excellent bar food menu. The pork belly sliders were a standout, and we highly recommend them. We hope they add more delicious tapas in the future. The staff was engaging and we will definitely be returning.

Best pizza ever, hands down! The people running the place, especially the former hockey player and his adorable but tough wife, are hilarious. They make their own sausage and mozzarella, and their attention to detail is unmatched. Don't even think about mispronouncing Ricotta! Every pizza on the menu is fabulous, and even the crusts are worth savoring. Try dipping them in olive oil or their delicious vinaigrette for an extra treat.
Excellent pizza! Beautiful ambiance and inviting atmosphere. Friendly and efficient service.

Pizzaville exceeded my expectations! The prices are a bit high, but the quality of the food is outstanding. The pizza had a perfect crust, with crunchy ends and a slightly chewy middle. The generous amount of mushrooms and extra sauce added to the deliciousness. The "breadsticks" were actually garlic bread strips, so buttery and garlicy that I couldn't stop myself from finishing the whole order. The employees were friendly and the store was clean. I can't wait to go back and try their lunch buffet.

Terrible experience. Made an appointment to fix "check engine" light, but car wasn't even looked at until the next day. Had to wait an hour for them to give me my car due to poor parking management. No repair or maintenance needed. Won't be going back.

I really wanted to like this place, but my experience was disappointing. The chicken was average, lacking flavor. The sauce options were limited for me, but the recommended mayo sauces weren't impressive. The mac&cheese was salty and mediocre, making a messy combination. The bananas foster pie had a great crust, but the filling lacked bananas and was mostly empty. The highlight was the birch beer, which was refreshing. The concept, decor, and menu are good, but the food quality doesn't match the price. 2 stars.
Joyce is amazing! The painless experience is worth the drive from Palm Harbor. With high-tech equipment, it surpasses the horror stories told by my friends. Love it!
The food is amazing, and the atmosphere is great. The carne asada tacos take me back home.

I always end up going to Jones. The experience is consistently amazing - from the friendly staff to the delicious food. It's the perfect place for comfort and great dining. I don't think I'll bother going to any other restaurants again.

Hidden gem serving delicious Senegalese and West African cuisine, including a tasty Thiboudienne without tomato sauce and a flavorful Jollof Rice. Cozy atmosphere with a few hightop tables or takeout option available. Friendly service.

After reading good Yelp reviews, I tried this place out. It was empty and the food was average. Disappointed, I ended up going to Charlie's across the street. The bustling atmosphere and amazing redtop pizza made me regret not going there first. This place is decent for a sit-down meal but for great pizza, go to Charlie's.
Service was excellent, but the pizza did not meet my expectations. Won't be returning.

This is by far my favorite cafe in the city. Their black and white latte is the best I've ever tasted, with its perfect balance of sweetness and foam. The soups are consistently delicious, even for those who aren't typically soup fans. The spacious environment is ideal for working, with a perfect noise level and just-right music. Plus, it's always a delight seeing patrons bring their furry friends along. I'll continue to be a loyal customer for as long as possible.

This place offers great food, especially the fish tacos and nachos. It has a nice atmosphere suitable for both family settings and night dates. They have a music beach bar, homemade ice cream, and a small playground, which makes it a great spot overall.

This chill backyard bar is my favorite spot in New Orleans. The local music options are amazing, but make sure to go with a smaller group as seating can be tight. The wine and cheese bar up front is perfect for grabbing a delicious tray of cheeses and accoutrements. Their wine selection is excellent and reasonably priced. It's a great place to escape the tourist crowds and have an unforgettable night in New Orleans.
The restaurant had good food, with a reasonable price for the meal box. Cashier Alessandra was very polite and respectful. The food tasted great too. I would definitely come back if I'm in the area.

My son and I were instantly satisfied with the efficient and friendly service at this busy burger place. We enjoyed delicious Highland stouts and a fresh garden salad as starters. The Black and Blue burger with regular fries was incredible, perfectly cooked with a balanced blue cheese flavor. The sweet potato fries were some of the best we've ever had. The burgers were devoured in blissful silence, a sure sign of their excellence. We'll definitely be back.
The dishes at this place were delectable and beautifully presented. We tried the J Sushi and Fire Roll, both of which were fantastic. The service was top-notch and the overall value was excellent.

I had a terrible day with a migraine and sinus infection, but Massage Envy came to the rescue. They fit me and my father in for massages, provided great service, and even taught me some techniques to try at home. The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was calming, and the membership program is worth it. I already feel so much better and will be going back for a longer session next month. Recommended!

Tried the pulled pork, green beans, Mac n cheese, and cornbread. Mediocre barbecue with a dry pork but decent smoky flavor. The sweet/syrupy original bbq sauce was okay. Might return, but would prefer a better option closer to home.
The catfish, chicken, gumbo, and mac & cheese at this recommended local place are simply irresistible. The lunch buffet offered piping hot and fresh dishes. Definitely worth trying!
