This place is a must-visit! I had the amazing chocolate chip pancakes and the line was manageable. However, the sausage side dish wasn't remarkable. The efficient payment system helps keep the line moving quickly. To avoid waiting, go early in the morning or around 7:15.

This place was fast and efficient, despite being busy. The building is spacious and offers entertainment for kids. They have a variety of items for purchase to keep you occupied while waiting. The car was well-cleaned and vacuumed, except for a missed spot on the front window. The staff was friendly and the price was fair. I will definitely return in the future.

The restaurant was able to accommodate a large party on short notice, which was impressive. However, the black spaghetti I ordered was disgusting with a weird texture and plastic-like taste. It was the worst plate of spaghetti I've ever tried. My co-workers thought their food was just okay though. Despite the disappointing dish, I would give them another chance if I return to Nashville, as their drinks were excellent.

Moreno is a fantastic family-owned bakery located conveniently in the heart of Brandon. They offer a wide range of delicious baked goods, from fresh bread to enormous cupcakes, flan, and cookies. Their Cuban sandwich, served with their special sauce spread, is outstanding. Personally, my favorite treat at Moreno is their almond sticks, which are bursting with almond flavor and loaded with almonds. If you have a craving for something sweet, Moreno is definitely the go-to place for you.

This sandwich spot used to be reliable, but the last two experiences were disappointing. The cheesesteak lacked meat, and the roll was one of the worst and stale. Hopefully, it was just an off night. I'll give it another chance, but not anytime soon.

Awful experience at Marmont Steakhouse. Cold soup, tasteless calamari, and wrong entree. Waiters argued with us about the mistake and caused illness from beef ravioli. Unapologetic staff. Avoid this place.

Overall, the hotel is a great choice for those looking to stay on Bourbon street. The staff is friendly and the food choices are good. The rooms are spacious and nice. However, be cautious of room 263 as it is closer to the vending and ice machines, leading to thin walls which allow for noise from conversations in the hallway to be heard. If not for this issue, I would have given the hotel a 4-star rating.

Overall, this burger joint is decent. The bacon cheeseburger was impressive, with perfectly cooked bacon and a nicely toasted bun. The fries and chocolate shake were also enjoyable. However, I found the burger lacking juiciness and the portion size for the price was disappointing. Additionally, leaving the place smelling like burger grease was not ideal.

Great takeout experience from Village Whiskey! Despite the pricy Whiskey Burger at $26, it's absolutely worth it if you enjoy a greasier burger. It's super tender with awesome bacon, and a generous portion size. Highly recommend if you don't mind the price. The Duck Fat fries are also rich and delicious.
Great dental service for wisdom teeth extraction. However, inconsistent dentist rotation over the past 5 years.
Potito's has the BEST cannoli in the city, far superior to Termini's and Isgro's. I highly recommend their cannoli over any other place. Trust me, it's worth it.

The best Mexican food in St Pete! It may be small, but the flavors are incredible. Avoid the weekend rush and go on a weekday. The chorizo tacos are a meat lover's dream and the fish tacos are fantastic for seafood enthusiasts.

Yesterday was my first visit to Paris Parker and I had a great experience! I usually rely on recommendations when choosing a stylist, but I needed to find someone quickly near my home. I was assigned to Stacey for a full highlight appointment and she did an amazing job. She eliminated all the brassy tones from my hair and made my blonde look natural and vibrant. I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't have to go back multiple times to get the color right - Stacey nailed it on the first try. She was also a pleasure to talk to, which made the hours in the chair fly by. I highly recommend Stacey, although I might regret it if she gets too busy.

I found this laundromat to be safe, clean, and well-equipped with friendly staff. The laundry and dryer worked efficiently, allowing me to complete several oversize loads in just under 2 hours. The facility has security cameras, amenities like flat screen T.V's and wi-fi, and a pleasant atmosphere. Overall, a wonderful place to do laundry. Thank you, LAUNDROMAT!

This is hands down my favorite sushi spot in Delaware. The menu is simple yet executed perfectly, with reasonably priced rolls that are bursting with fish. The use of flash-frozen sashimi grade fish doesn't compromise the flavor, as the color, texture, taste, and smell are all flawless. The spicy tuna roll is nothing short of incredible, thanks to the combination of kewpie mayo, sriracha, and sichimi powder. I can't get enough of this place, often having it for lunch every day for weeks. The addition of short-grain brown sushi rice has been a fantastic touch. Watching YC Park, The Sushiman, work his magic is mesmerizing, as he effortlessly skins a cucumber with a sushi knife and transforms it into a nori sheet for his rolls. The temaki rolls are massive, packed with fish, and the nigiri is beautifully presented. While I save my 5-star rating for places that serve locally caught fresh fish, Tokyo is a must-visit for sushi lovers. Support the owners in these challenging times and skip Kooma and save Mikimotos for a special night out. If you crave sushi, look no further than Tokyo!
Amazing atmosphere, unique flavors, and a must-try Cuban Lamb Frita (add the egg!). Delicious side dishes with friendly and efficient staff. My new favorite brunch spot!

Ichicoro Ane gets it right with its perfect combination of ambiance, food choices, and whiskey selection. The servers have been helpful and pleasant, making the experience even better. The katsu is a must-try for those seeking a filling dish, while the bao buns are perfect for a lighter option. The portion sizes vary, so be sure to ask your server. The cocktail selection is excellent, especially the Japanese Old Fashioned, although slightly pricey. Exploring the menu little by little is a delightful experience, best enjoyed in a group setting that reminds me of Japanese pubs.

Federal Doughnuts at the ballpark is a delicious addition, serving up both doughnuts and fried chicken. And for those with dietary restrictions, the new gluten-free concession near 136 offers a variety of tasty options including pizza, cheesesteaks, brownies, and cookies. A satisfying treat for everyone at the game!

Great decor and wait staff, but the portions were small. The fish special was delicious, but the fattoush salad was disappointing with limp lettuce and no olives. Pricey for lunch, won't be returning.

This Whole Foods location is a gem. The variety of natural cosmetics and handmade soaps in the personal care section is unmatched. The produce, seafood, and cheese are also top-notch. The deli offers a delightful selection of soup, salad, and sushi to-go boxes. And don't forget to try the lavender soda for a truly calming experience.

Despite the convenient location and great bar atmosphere, this place falls short in terms of food quality. We gave it three chances, but each dish we tried was subpar, except for the overly sweet Asian shrimp. On the first visit, we attributed the issues to a new restaurant finding its footing. However, the second visit only resulted in a dry turkey patty without informing us about the lack of buns. The manager did comp that meal, but the most recent experience with fish and chips served from a box and greasy chicken salad was the final straw. We won't be returning.

I reached out to Jay Fatimo at the auto repair shop via email for a written estimate on replacing my factory navigation unit in my Denali. Despite his initial suggestion to email him, I never received a response after multiple attempts. The lack of communication has made me question their reliability and ability to handle the repairs. As a result, I will be taking my business to the GMC dealer nearby.

This place is an ideal spot to catch a sunset. A bit of a drive from Tampa but definitely worth it. The energetic music and lively ambiance make it enjoyable. The rocky beach means no swimming, but it doesn't matter because the view and atmosphere are incredible. Been coming here with our boys since they were babies, and it never disappoints. The food and drinks don't leave a strong impression, but that's not what we come for.

Freddy's offers the best fast-food style burgers with great toppings and fresh meat. Their fries paired with the "fry" sauce are delicious. Additionally, their custard is rich, creamy, and absolutely delicious.

Fellinis of Media is my top pick for dining out! Their extensive menu caters to all tastes, and the friendly staff goes above and beyond to meet your needs. The elegant and serene ambiance adds to the overall experience. In my view, this restaurant offers the finest Italian cuisine in town.

I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Port Richey and had a mediocre experience. The staff were friendly and helpful, and there was free wifi. The breakfast options were good. However, the beds were too soft and uncomfortable, and the a/c controls were unreliable. It was just okay, and I prefer the Hyatt hotels.

I highly recommend this salon based on their professional and clean environment. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about their services and prices. I had a great experience getting my armpits waxed, with Despina being a skilled specialist who made the process relatively painless. The hard wax used was effective on my stubborn, thick hair. The price was also reasonable at $16. I have already scheduled my next appointment and may come in sooner for a bikini wax. Overall, the service was excellent with a great atmosphere. Trustworthy salon!
The recent change in ownership resulted in a disappointing experience with both the food and service. It's a shame as I used to love this place.

I love this place! Conveniently located near my home, I visit every other week. They regularly change flavors and have hidden toppings. The intense EDM music playing adds to the unique experience. Awesome!
While better than the Philadelphia location, Szechuan House in Hamilton, NJ still remains the ultimate best.

Overall, Smokey offers a variety of dining options, beverages for a fee, a pricey hotel, free parking, various entertainment, an ATM for those concerned about self-control, and gambling for those willing to take the risk. As a non-smoker with allergies, the experience was slightly hindered. However, even as an observer, there is still enjoyment to be had.

I had a terrible experience at Spa Aria. The receptionist was unattentive, the staff was unhelpful, and the spa was small and dirty. The nail technician was sick, which was unsanitary, and gave a rushed and subpar manicure. The hand/arm massage was awful and the technician made snarky comments about my dry skin. The receptionist was also unprofessional and there were extra fees for putting services on my room. Overall, I would not recommend Spa Aria and suggest going elsewhere.

The breakfast was outstanding, conveniently located near our hotel. The crepes with fruit were delicious and definitely worth ordering again. However, the tea had a slight taste of fennel seed, which could be a hit or miss for some.

Dr. Ferrel is nothing short of a hero. As an amateur athlete, I first met him after a severe injury during a softball game. Despite my financial constraints as a single mom and teacher, Dr. Ferrel went above and beyond to provide treatment. When I initially sought a second opinion, I was told it would be months before I could play again. However, I reached out to Dr. Ferrel, who not only kept his promise but also healed me within weeks. Time and again, he has delivered remarkable results. Thanks to Dr. Ferrel, I am forever grateful and consider him my hero.
Gennaro's never disappoints. Thin crust, sweet tomato sauce, and fresh mozzarella make every bite delightful. The meatballs are also superb. Adorable vintage decor adds to the charm. Love it here!
This place has the best spaghetti & meatballs I've ever had. Cozy atmosphere, now my favorite Italian spot.

This small donut bakery in Hermitage's oldest shopping center offers a delectable variety of treats, including unique options like bacon-topped donuts and doughssants, a delightful fusion of donuts and croissants. With affordable prices, such as $1.99 for a doughssant, it's worth a visit just for this one-of-a-kind pastry. The sweet donuts also make excellent gifts for teachers, and the bakery serves coffee as well.
Terrible experience - found hair in both appetizer and friend's noodles. Waiter was good, but no effort made to rectify the situation. Won't return.

The espresso is top-notch, making it my go-to spot for an Americano. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed. Worth noting, there are no power outlets, but WiFi is available. Clean and well-maintained facilities overall.

Overall, the dining experience at the restaurant was average. The hostess was friendly and the remodel looked impressive. However, there was a strong unpleasant odor upon entering. The menu was limited, but the food came out within a reasonable time. The "Knuckle Sandwich" was delicious, earning the two stars. On the other hand, the mushroom swiss burger was small and bland, while the chicken strips lacked seasoning. The fries were unremarkable. The server was nice, but difficult to hear in the loud dining room. Hopefully, the restaurant improves to achieve success.
The staff includes friendly and helpful ladies, although one may be unfriendly if provoked. It becomes evident quickly. Just a heads up.

I have dined at this place three times and each experience has been enjoyable for both me and the kids. There is no smoke or noise, and the food and service are consistently good. Perhaps the late Tuesday afternoon timing has contributed to our positive experiences. I have tried different dishes each time and have always been satisfied and happy with my choices. I will definitely return to dine here again.

The bakery is AMAZING! The tres leche is just like grandma used to make, minus the liquor. The cannoli and Italian wedding cookies are delicious, and the dark chocolate florentine is an unexpected delight even for coconut haters like me. We will definitely be returning!
The Shop is an exceptional space with meticulous attention to detail and unparalleled services. It offers ample options for private meetings and productive work.

I have been to this place many times and every experience has been great. My husband and I used to go there almost weekly after working on our house. The place is always clean, they never rush through the session, and they focus on problem areas. Felicia is amazing and highly recommended. I recently had a therapeutic massage with her for my neck pain and it was truly incredible. She is extremely talented.
The depot burger and shishito peppers are incredibly delicious. The food, atmosphere, and drinks are all perfect.
The outside tables offer a pleasant view, although the food and service are standard for a beach setting. However, it's a great spot to enjoy a drink while soaking in the scenery.

Milktooth is a popular brunch spot in Indy with a great breakfast cocktail selection and unique twists on traditional brunch dishes. Despite the wait, the experience is worth it. The menu is ever-changing, but the Dutch pancakes and raclette grilled cheese are exceptional. Don't forget to try the michelada, and if weather permits, sit outside.

This review praises the Sonoran Dog for its bun, comparing it to a cozy snuggie. It acknowledges initial skepticism but highlights the bun's warmness, softness, and fragrance, attributing its success to surpassing other Sonoran Dogs. The reviewer suggests that the hot dog or bacon could have more texture to balance the strong flavors of mustard and onions. They also express admiration for the carne asada caramelo, particularly praising the tortilla, cheese, and carne flavors. Finally, they mention that the meal is affordable and convenient as it can be purchased via a drive-thru.

I walked into Blaze at 9pm only to be told they were closed, despite their stated hours online and on the door. Disappointed with my first experience at this new pizzeria. A simple explanation for the time change would have been appreciated.

I highly recommend Stigma for tattoos! I got two tattoos by Eddie and he did an amazing job. The entire staff is friendly and accommodating, especially with my back issues. I also received a discount through Yelp and bought their tattoo ointment, which is soothing. Overall, great artists and great experience.

Cafe Piazza, the new replacement for Benton Park Cafe, offers a fantastic ST. LOUIS atmosphere with a captivating mural on the ceiling. The restaurant's decor is eclectic and the food is both unique and reasonably priced. It's a great choice for a slightly upscale breakfast that won't overwhelm you. Highly recommended for its ambiance, convenient location, and delicious, creative cuisine.

BARRA was absolutely amazing! We went for Restaurant Week and were blown away by the delicious food and excellent service. The blood orange margaritas were strong and delicious. The veal and beef meatballs were melt-in-your-mouth and the grilled cheese appetizer was amazing. The fishermen stew was full of flavor and well balanced, while the steak with cauliflower puree and vegetable medley was juicy and tender. The service was top-notch, with a knowledgeable waiter who helped us with our order and checked on us frequently. BARRA is intimate, reasonably priced, and the perfect place for good food and great service.

The sweet and sour chicken and chicken chow mein were both excellent, with particularly delicious chicken cuts in the chow mein. I've also tried the sushi a few times and thoroughly enjoyed it. While a bit pricey, the food is undeniably great.

Courtney is an outstanding hairstylist who always knows what will look best on me. She understands my style preferences and consistently exceeds my expectations. Her talent and expertise are truly impressive. Without even specifying, she knows exactly how to enhance my look. In addition to her exceptional skills, Courtney has a wonderful personality and a wealth of knowledge. I highly recommend her to anyone who wants to look their absolute best.

I stayed at this hotel for one week after Christmas. Unless you book adjoining rooms, you'll be disturbed by strangers’ conversations, coughs, clearing throats, fights, and dogs barking as if they are in your bed. Only managed to sleep for two out of seven nights after the hotel cleared out post New Year. The connecting doors are inadequately insulated. The staff at the hotel is exceptional, but Starwood needs to address this issue to improve guests' experience. I have stayed at many places with connecting doors and have never encountered such poor insulation. Possible poor materials used?

My partner and I shared the veg platter and left completely satisfied! Mouthwatering dishes, delightful and helpful staff. They assist you in making choices and are trustworthy. We're definitely returning.

Stunning and contemporary venue with a lovely view, only drawback being its proximity to the train tracks, where slight noise can be heard. Overall, it's a fantastic spot and even boasts a yolk on the nearby corner.

The hotel is too big, expensive, and far from Downtown. The meals are overpriced and there are limited options nearby. Getting the car from valet and going to restaurants off the property is time-consuming. However, the property itself is gorgeous, and the room was spacious and well-equipped. There was an issue with the billing and the check-out process was a nightmare. Despite potential future conferences, the reviewer is not looking forward to returning.

Petra Restaurant near our home offers delicious Middle Eastern cuisine. We randomly decided to try it with my family and were pleasantly surprised. The Friday and Saturday special rice with lamb is especially delicious, reminiscent of Indian fried rice. The other menu items are also very good. Despite the location, the inside of the restaurant is nice and the service is good too.
Highly recommend going on a Tuesday for their 1/2 price tapas and $5 Sangria/margaritas. Fried Manchego, Hot Cauliflower, and Camarones were outstanding. Unique and flavorful experience overall!
The Buffalo chicken salad was amazing! Fresh and crispy greens, delicious chicken, and a perfect blue cheese dressing. Will definitely be returning for this salad.

Cake Life Bake Shop in Fishtown is a great find! The shop perfectly blends with the neighborhood vibe, and the clean and inviting interior is a plus. The assortment of stunning cakes assures top-notch bakers on board. I indulged in a variety of treats such as Bourbon Pecan and Chocolate Chip cookies, along with vanilla cupcakes with buttercream and raspberry icing. The Bourbon Pecan cookie stood out with its mild sweetness and delightful pecan bites, best paired with a hot coffee. Although the cupcakes were tasty in terms of cake, I wasn't entirely fond of the icing. Sadly, I didn't try the Chocolate Chip cookie, though everyone raved about it. Despite this, I'll definitely return and have Cake Life create a custom order; they have piqued my interest.

Interesting destination with great decor, noisy atmosphere, and funky vibe. Hip servers, but rushed and inattentive service. Not safe or knowledgeable for gluten-free individuals, awful GF buns. Parking is a challenge for those with cars.

I was thrilled to have a Chick-Fil-A nearby, but the incompetence at the drive-thru and peculiar layout left me disappointed. However, I appreciate the free WiFi while enduring the long wait. I'll stick to the locations in Rivergate or Cool Springs for top-notch waffle fries.

Spice n Grill in St. Louis offers the best Indian food with perfectly spiced beef nihari, palak paneer, and naan. The dishes were adequately spicy and crave-worthy. Despite limited seating, the friendly owner makes up for it. If you're in the mood for delicious take-out, I highly recommend this restaurant.
The food is amazing and fresh, especially the Wonton Soup that my kids love. They clearly put time and effort into cooking it.
Incredible breakfast pizza, bottomless mimosas and bloody marys, with exceptional service! Rare to find such an amazing experience these days.

Finally tried this place after passing by so many times and I'm glad we did. Despite the small size, the interior is visually pleasing with wooden palates and two-tone gray walls. The prosciutto fig arugula Parmesan flatbread appetizer was tasty and ample for two people. The main dishes, particularly the grass-fed beef burger with truffle-dusted fries, were impressive in size and flavor. I also enjoyed the seafood soup with a coconut and curry broth. It had a delicious spicy kick without overpowering the taste buds. Overall, I would highly recommend this place. Just a heads up, it gets crowded and doesn't take reservations, so best to go early. Don't forget to try their great selection of wines and craft beers.

Based on the previous Yelp reviews, we decided to take the kids to this hibachi and sushi place. It definitely lived up to the hype. The sushi was incredible, the hibachi was fantastic, and the dessert of fried bananas and ice cream was the perfect ending to a wonderful experience. The service was excellent and attentive. We will definitely be coming back for more!

I highly recommend this place for those looking for a taste of Japanese cuisine without the focus on sushi. Their rice bowls and tempura are delicious, and the restaurant is rarely crowded. They also offer catering services for sushi and maki platters. The service is quick and the place is great for a fast lunch or dinner when you're in a hurry.
Delicious, authentic New Orleans cuisine. Busy but got seated quickly. Opted for the a la carte and it exceeded our expectations. The highlight of our trip!

This place is undeniably adorable with friendly servers and delicious food. However, I was disappointed by the minuscule portion sizes. As a result, I left feeling unsatisfied. It's disheartening when even neighborly restaurants are stingy with their servings.

Allegro's offers deliciously affordable and speedy pizza, with the sicilian and meaty options being exceptionally tasty. The stuffed varieties are also worth a try, although some centers may be cold. While they sell beer, I cannot comment on it due to my age during my time in Philadelphia. However, the service can be occasionally rude, and the presence of individuals talking to themselves can be off-putting.
The food was average, disappointing for fried green tomato experts. Meatloaf was good but the sides were just average. Entertainment was also disappointing with limited songs played per hour.

I highly recommend this wine and cheese shop! The unique atmosphere allows you to select your own bottle of wine and choose from an array of cheeses and meats. The staff then creates a beautiful cheese board with extras like nuts, spreads, and sliced artisan bread. It's like magic! We were so satisfied with the platter and wine that we didn't need to order from the kitchen.
Superb ice cream store with delicious and generously portioned servings. Pleasingly unique flavors set it apart. A must-visit spot that sets the bar high for others to follow.

Fun place with an inviting interior and great outdoor seating. Brunch food was delicious and the beer selection was outstanding. However, our experience was dampened by a rude and unhelpful waiter who seemed unfamiliar with the menu, frequently disappeared, and brought out the wrong order twice. Disappointing service, or else this place would have earned four stars.
Highly recommended spot! Fantastic beer selection, lively music, and outstanding service. Don't miss it!

I highly recommend this place! Great service, convenient payment system, and fresh, delicious food. The chicken taco salad and plantains were excellent. The drinks, especially the mojito, were tasty as well. Can't wait to come back and explore more of their menu.
Disappointed to discover that this location is closed when I specifically came for their delicious fish tacos.

Always awesome! This place has the best crust, fresh ingredients, and a friendly staff. They offer unique toppings not found elsewhere. Don't miss out on their delicious salads. The patio area is perfect for relaxing with a beer or glass of wine while enjoying the best pizza in town.

The restaurant provides a quiet and nostalgic 1960's business ambience perfect for dining. Their menu offers both Tony's specialties and bar options; personally, I highly recommend the Risotto. Our table tried the special linguine with shrimp and lobster, as well as the strip steak, and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals. The service was exceptional, striking the perfect balance between attentiveness and not being overbearing.

I had dinner here with a friend on Sunday. The seating arrangement surprised me - we were seated next to another party with a small partition separating us. The restaurant is small and can get noisy. However, the service was great. The food was decent - we ordered the Kale Caesar and the Fried Chicken with Mac n Cheese. Unfortunately, they were out of watermelon so the accompanying salad had to be substituted. The Kale Caesar had a delicious soft egg with a crispy crust and runny yolk, which impressed me.

Stopped in Santa Barbara for some fish tacos last Tuesday and tried the #2 ranked place for Baja fish tacos. Pleasantly surprised by how delicious they were. The kitchen accommodated our request for shrimp tacos on the side with a generous portion of battered shrimp. Sat outside on the veranda, enjoying the yummy food and lovely December weather. Friendly staff. Will definitely be back next time in town.
Amazing 20-minute workout! Skeptic turned believer, I'm now addicted and feeling fantastic. Chelsey is an awesome trainer to work with too!

Plaza Deli in La Cumbre Plaza is my go-to place for delicious and fresh sandwiches. Their bread rolls are superb – soft and not too crusty. As a long-time Santa Barbara resident, I've been visiting this spot for years and have never been disappointed. Their wide variety of sandwiches makes it challenging to choose a favorite. Don't forget to try their excellent soda selection. While Plaza Deli may not offer extravagant options, it's the perfect place for locals and visitors alike seeking a fantastic sandwich made with quality ingredients.

This place exceeded my expectations! The ice cream was fantastic, especially the pumpkin cake and pralines and cream flavors. The brownie sundae was a masterpiece, with a perfect combination of brownie, ice cream, whipped cream, and nuts. The customer service was exceptional, with friendly and patient staff who even let me sample multiple flavors. I regret not trying their hot chocolate, but I had an amazing experience nevertheless. No judgment for devouring the brownie sundae by myself!

We had a fantastic private tour with Carrie today. Despite the rain and less crowded park, her enthusiasm and extensive knowledge about the Civil War were truly captivating. The Battle of Franklin is undoubtedly deserving of its own remarkable memorial.

Unique is a highly professional and reputable company that operates with utmost integrity. They are responsive, transparent, and honest in their dealings. Their technicians are efficient, clean, and pleasant to work with. Pricing is extremely fair and the quality of their work is exceptional. Based on my direct experience with their sales person (Mike P) and manager Chris, I can confidently recommend them. Additionally, comparing their prices to similar-sized companies is encouraged.

We were pleasantly surprised by the food but disappointed with the service and rude staff. The pulled pork, brisket tacos, and pulled chicken were delicious, although the sides were average. The bill for five of us, including a kids meal, came close to $60. Two main complaints were the lack of ribs for lunch and dirty bathrooms.

We recently visited this restaurant for the third time since its reopening. They have daily specials, offering a plate with ice-tea and soup at a reasonable price of $7.95. Today's special included Carne Asada with rice n beans, a fried fish plate, and 2 chicken enchiladas with rice n beans, all accompanied by tea n soup. We both opted for the Carne Asada plate, and they kindly let me substitute my rice n beans for a salad. The steak was enjoyable, and overall, the food was good. Additionally, the service was attentive.

I absolutely love Phillies games and this stadium enhances the experience. Despite my initial 10,000th loss, the open atmosphere avoids feeling claustrophobic. The only inconvenience was sitting beneath the scoreboard. I appreciate the ability to roam around while still having a great view of the game. The wide variety of delicious food and clean facilities also contribute to a positive experience. I'm eagerly awaiting baseball season to cheer on the Phillies!

I gave this place multiple chances, but unfortunately, the service was consistently disappointing. The first wax was with Despina who was uncommunicative and missed chunks of hair. The second wax with Amy Jo was friendlier, but still sloppy, leaving a significant amount of hair. The timing was also rushed, with the appointment lasting only 8 minutes. Considering the price, I expected much better. The staff at the front desk were rude and unhelpful, and asking about tipping was uncomfortable. I'll have to continue my search for a decent Brazilian wax in Philly.
This place is amazing, reminiscent of the past. The music is fantastic. However, I deducted one star as seating is limited to the first 15 people in line.

We had a delightful stay at this beautiful and charming hotel during our family trip to the Big Easy. The staff, from the doorman to the wait staff for brunch, were incredibly friendly and helpful. The Carousel Bar is a must-visit. With its great location, we will definitely be returning next time we're in New Orleans.

Review:

This place serves some damn good ice cream. The freshly made waffle cones and the option of having bananas foster are a major plus. The atmosphere is adult-friendly and the owner, despite being a Harvard grad, is down to earth and easy to talk to. My only small gripe is that I wish this place was located near the movie theater for a more convenient outing. Other than that, it's a top-notch joint that even a 5-star establishment can benefit from some constructive feedback.
Extremely disappointed with the customer service. Don't count on finding any assistance, good luck.

The salad was enjoyable, but unfortunately, the pizza was disappointing - boring, flavorless, and unsatisfying. I was very disappointed, especially considering this was my third visit. Additionally, the interior was cold on a chilly night. I won't be returning.

Spasso in Media is highly recommended for a great dinner experience. The service provided by Oana is outstanding, with her extensive knowledge of the menu and willingness to assist. They offer a unique twist on Italian cuisine, with delicious starters like the refreshing eggplant/pepper topping. The Caesar salad is perfect, and the pappardelle porcini dish is a must-try, with its flavorful combination of sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, and chicken. Grabbing a high top in the bar area was a great decision, as there was no wait despite being full service. Don't miss out on this gem in Media!

Angela Clifton Photography has exceeded our expectations in every way. We've worked with them 3 times now, and every single picture captured has been outstanding. The photos are not only beautiful but also reflect the fun and enjoyable experience we had during the sessions. Considering the amazing quality, their pricing is more than reasonable. We are absolutely thrilled with our pictures and they will always hold a special place in our hearts.
Had an amazing lunch with an awesome beef brisket sandwich—juicy and tender. The pulled pork was equally delicious!

Delicious top shelf pastries with exceptional service. Shocked by the low ratings. If you prioritize flavor over cheapness, this is your spot. As an extremely demanding customer, I've always received great service. Can't wait for them to create macaroons for our wedding.

I would rate it 3.5 stars. They didn't have what I wanted and weren't willing to accommodate my requests. The glazed donuts were thick and dry, but the sliders and sundae were tasty. Probably won't come back.

Extremely disappointed. Sandwich bar closed, settled for a reheated burrito at an inflated price of $8. The taste was unpleasant with creamy chicken and old cheese toppings. Questionable how this can be considered edible. Taco Bell would have been a preferable choice.

Don't be discouraged by the shopping center location! Outstanding place with an exceptional staff. Curtis epitomizes superb service and genuinely cares about your dining enjoyment. Don't miss the scallops small plate, but overall, the entire dining experience is absolutely remarkable.

This Greek-owned pancake house is a fantastic alternative to larger pancake chains. They offer delicious breakfast options like freedom toast and freedom fries. Every New Year's Day, we visit this place around 2 pm and they always accommodate our group of 12-15 people. The service is fast and friendly, and the owner ensures everything runs smoothly. In my opinion, the food is even better than the chains, and I think the secret ingredient is love.

The pub offers a delightful English ambiance, creating a cozy atmosphere. The skillful bartenders take pride in crafting great drinks. However, be prepared for high prices, as a standard mixed drink costs $7. Additionally, bear in mind that seating is limited.

My daughter's wedding at the Presidio Chapel was an absolute dream come true. Rain Longo, the coordinator, was incredibly patient, supportive, and enthusiastic throughout the entire process. The chapel itself provided an outstanding and authentic atmosphere, and the beautiful adjoining room was perfect for getting ready. The 6-hour rental was affordable and all the staff made our special day absolutely perfect. Thank you to everyone involved!

Extremely disappointed with the service and quality of tea latte at this Starbucks. Despite waiting 15 minutes with four people working, the drink turned out watery. Even after returning it twice, the offered replacement was no better. The baristas need to improve their skills. Disappointing experience overall.

The restaurant offers a creative menu and the food is great. However, the lack of reservations can be a downside, especially on weekends. Additionally, waiting for a late friend can be a bit inconvenient since everyone in the party needs to be seated together. We also enjoyed the neighboring La Mulita.

I absolutely recommend this place for blow outs! The talented staff, convenient online booking, and friendly service make it top-notch. I personally love Krissy and Bianca, but everyone is great. Don't forget to try the vital shot, it's a game-changer for conditioning blondes like me and lasts about a week!

I had a wonderful experience at the Nashville location and was excited to learn that there was now one in New Orleans. However, our visit to the New Orleans location was disappointing. We arrived at 10pm and waited for 10 minutes without being greeted. When we went to the bar for assistance, we were informed that the kitchen was behind on orders. After waiting for 25 minutes with no service or apology, we decided to leave. This was not the experience I expected from such a well-known establishment. I hope this is not indicative of their usual service.

Despite being initially concerned by the reviews, my experience was excellent. There was a minimal wait time, and the staff was welcoming and helpful from the moment I entered the lobby to interacting with the office staff.
The smoothies here are the best in the world, and their fresh bread is amazing. The staff is extremely knowledgeable.

I highly recommend this place! I was referred here and it was a fantastic experience. I got my hair done in just five hours, with three women working on my medium-sized individuals. The cost was $150, including the hair. The staff was very nice, and I will definitely be returning.

The Hollander Hotel provided an unforgettable experience for our wedding. The charming property, beautiful lobby decor, and spacious Tap Room created the perfect atmosphere. The rooms were clean and cozy, with great prices and a convenient shuttle. The brunch was delicious and reasonably priced, with friendly staff and a lovely patio. Most importantly, the management and team at the Hollander were exceptional, treating us like family and ensuring every guest had a wonderful experience. Highly recommended!

The carrot cake was a disappointment with a taste reminiscent of licorice and baking soda. It's a shame because the overall appearance was appealing, but the addition of chocolate chips did not complement the flavor either.

The dinner experience was inconsistent; some dishes were authentic while others resembled American Chinese food. The duck had a high fat content and minimal meat. The stir-fry combinations were odd and didn't blend well. Additionally, the service lacked friendliness, typical of a Chinese restaurant.

I tried the Sonoran hot dog at this highly recommended place during my visit. While it wasn't my personal preference due to its complexity, I have to admit it was good. However, the standout for me was the fantastic guacamole. The taco combo with chicken and carne asada was delicious, but the cabeza option was disappointing. I loved the convenience of BK's salsa bar and the efficient service with quick food delivery. Do note that it gets crowded during lunchtime on weekdays.
Brooke's music isn't up to par anymore. A significant change from pop edm is necessary.

The baked goodies from this kitchen are simply outstanding. Each treat is filled with immense flavor and has the perfect texture. The delicate and decorative detailing is absolutely phenomenal, reflecting the time and love put into each piece. The signature flavors are all fantastic, and I particularly adore the classic cream cheese frosting. If you're seeking cakes, cupcakes, pies, cookies, or anything sweet, do yourself a favor and indulge in Sugar Coated. Treat yourself and your loved ones to this incredible experience!

Fantastic lunch spot! A unique and funky atmosphere at Nashville airport. The food options are both delicious and healthy, and I highly recommend trying the sweet potato casserole with coconut and dried cranberry.

Great pizza with a variety of fantastic options such as the California, Meatlovers, and Veggie pizzas. Owner Pete is friendly and always present. Unfortunately, the shop is temporarily closed due to fire damage from the neighboring laundry mat. Can't wait for them to reopen, as I miss their amazing lunch special and delicious pizzas. Definitely the best local pizza in Hatboro.

I had a disappointing experience at Copabanana during restaurant week. The outdoor seating was disturbed by noisy kids playing football, even after we moved. The food was subpar, with overcooked steak and stale mashed potatoes. The only positive was the friendly waitress, but even she couldn't salvage the experience. I won't be returning. 1 star for the waitress.

Lobster Haven exceeded our expectations with its authentic New England seafood. Great service, fast and friendly, with a huge selection of favorites. A must-visit place for those craving genuine flavors, and they even offer live lobster and fresh seafood to take home and cook yourself.
The service was quick and friendly, the portion size for the price was great, and the pancakes had the perfect consistency.

This hotel had the potential to be great with its charming location and unique rooms. Unfortunately, our stay was ruined by a bed bug infestation. Despite the management's efforts to resolve the issue, it was a gross and inconvenient experience. I ended up throwing away valuable belongings and am still concerned about bringing the bugs home. I would not recommend staying here unless significant measures are taken to ensure the elimination of bed bugs.
Called after a negative experience with another locksmith. They responded punctually, completed the job within an hour, and even provided 4 complimentary keys. Truly exceptional service.

I was introduced to Brio's by my foodie friends at work, and I absolutely love it! From the complimentary bread and chips to the bruschetta, pasta, and salads, everything is delicious. The restaurant itself is beautiful, and the service is top-notch.

Meijer is convenient and amazing, but the Starbucks inside is hit or miss. The employees seem untrained, as they constantly need to check prices and they can't consistently make my drink. This morning, my drink didn't look right and when I mentioned it, the lady poured some out and added more milk. I didn't want to pay $4 for a cup of milk, but she didn't seem to care, so there was no point in complaining.

This neighborhood BYOB place is a hidden gem. Excellent food, welcoming service, and reasonable prices make it stand out. The menu offers a variety of delicious Italian dishes, both traditional and unique. The specials are always a good choice. The atmosphere is friendly and the staff makes you feel like a regular. Conveniently located near sports venues and accessible by public transportation. Make sure to make a reservation as it can get busy. Overall, a must-try if you're in the area.
Stopped by after a morning walk - amazing food, coffee, and service! Love the vibe!

The Paris Hair Salon is an exceptional place with skilled professionals who genuinely understand hair. They provide a warm and welcoming atmosphere, taking the time to effectively handle even the most difficult hair types. I am extremely satisfied with their services, as they consistently deliver perfect results for cuts, colors, and highlights. Moreover, their prices are reasonable. Highly recommended! - Maureen Kerfoot

We stumbled upon this incredible cafe while traveling in our RV and it was an absolute gem. The staff was amazingly friendly and the food was just like home cooking. We ended up eating here twice because everything was fresh, delicious, and felt like a homemade meal. Highly recommended. Yum!

The service at this place has significantly improved since my last visit. I received great service from a staff member named Dillon. The ambiance is casual, where you can simply order and sit while they bring the food to you. The food options are delicious and plentiful, although not fancy. What's great is that everything is very affordable, and a family of four can eat here for around $30, which is an excellent deal in today's pricey market. If you're seeking a quick and casual Asian dining experience, I highly recommend giving this place a try.

Just discovered a new Chick-fil-A location in Bloomingdale and had a great experience! Despite a busy parking lot, the staff efficiently managed the drive-thru lanes. Every employee I interacted with was friendly and welcoming. The food was tasty, although the fries could have been cooked longer. Overall, a good addition to the area. Welcome to Bloomingdale, Chick-fil-A!

This motel offers great value for the price. It is clean, comfortable, and well-managed. The breakfast buffet is average, but reasonable considering the rate. However, the pool is a disappointment as it is too small for laps. On a positive note, the lobby area is spacious and comfortable. If you are seeking a moderately priced, clean, and comfortable place to sleep, this motel will meet your needs effectively.

This Acme store was generally what you would expect, with the only noticeable difference being slightly narrower aisles. While it may not offer as much variety as larger stores, it had upgraded sections like frozen and refrigerated foods. The service provided was satisfactory.

Target is a great alternative to Walmart, offering a wide range of products from clothes to electronics. Their affordable makeup and well-stocked grocery section make it a convenient shopping destination. Quick checkout process with ample open registers is another plus.
The sales staff was friendly and Mike was extremely helpful. He took us for a ride in one of the Razors, which was a great experience. It made us consider getting one ourselves.

This Italian restaurant has very friendly employees and offers reasonably priced dishes. The homemade salad dressing is excellent and the overall food quality is good. A great choice for Italian cuisine.

This place is a Tucson gem and my absolute favorite! The flavors are amazing; they taste even better than you imagine. My personal favorites include strawberries & champagne, toasted marshmallow, and cheesecake. I was thrilled when they opened locations in the valley after I moved to Phoenix. I will definitely keep visiting over and over!

I recently went to a birthday party at this place and it was definitely worth checking out. It was my first time there and I was really pleased. It was quiet on a Tuesday and the service was good. The beef n lobster dish was cooked well and the mashed potatoes and asparagus were very good. However, the crab and cheese balls appetizer was disappointing, lacking flavor and seasoning. The Creme Brule was solid and I would definitely order it again. Overall, I would rate it four stars due to the subpar appetizer and a shaky table, which is unnecessary for such a nice place. Despite that, I would happily go again and would recommend it to friends.

Dr. Dayley is the best dentist I've ever been to! I used to have a lot of anxiety about dental work due to a traumatic experience in the past, but Dr. Dayley is extremely personable and helps calm my nerves. He removed all four of my wisdom teeth and I completely trust him with my dental care. I highly recommend him to everyone I know, and my entire family also sees him. The front desk and staff are welcoming and sweet. Thank you for being the best dentist office!

I had a disappointing experience at The Praline Connection in New Orleans. The BBQ Oysters were served in a soup cup with a bland "BBQ sauce" and had a gooey texture. The garlic bread tasted stale and frozen, and the appetizers were cold and appeared microwaved. The Chicken wings were undercooked, cold, and had an unpleasant sauce. The rest of our party also found their entrees unsatisfactory. The only positives were the great service and the clean, pleasant ambiance. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This hidden gem in the Marigny is a must-visit for those willing to venture off the tourist path. While not perfect, this affordable spot offers delicious food with the convenience of an all-day breakfast menu. Vegetarian and vegan options are available, although the concept of cheese in these dishes seems questionable. The French fry po'boy, mac 'n cheese sandwiches, and Saturday Blue Plate BBQ Chicken legs are outstanding. With every entree under $10 and $5 Bloody Mary's that are worth it, why complain?

Overall, the restaurant was pretty good. The milkshake was amazing, one of the best I've ever had. The food and service were good too, but there was a slightly strange vibe that I couldn't pinpoint. Could just be me though!

I joined the MBSC thrive program at City Fitness and found it lacking in personalized training. The trainers have a set program and you have little input. Sessions can be crowded, and you may have to wait for the trainer. The sessions are intense but lack consistency, making it hard to master the moves. The atmosphere and music cater to a younger demographic. If you want to push yourself without personal attention, MBSC might be for you. However, if you prefer individualized training and learning about muscle groups, it may not be the best fit. Consider trying an introductory program before committing to the pricey monthly fee. I rate MBSC at City Fitness 1.5 stars for an overall rating of 2.5 stars.

Authentic and delicious Mexican cuisine reminiscent of homemade meals. The enchiladas with mole sauce are incredible and the carne asada tacos take me back to Rosarito Beach. Highly recommended for a taste of California-approved Mexican food. Yummy!
This restaurant is my absolute favorite! The ceviche is pure perfection. The atmosphere exudes fun and the service, led by Alex, is top-notch - friendly, attentive, and thoughtful.

The Fringe festival in Edmonton offers a fantastic variety of performances, street performers, and musicians. The venue and play options are diverse, and there is a convenient online schedule for show times and ticket purchasing. The addition of food and artisan vendors adds to the overall experience. Don't miss the delicious gourmet mini donut truck hidden behind the farmers market. Even without watching a play, it's enjoyable to explore the street performances and shop at the vendors. The location is excellent.

Federal Donuts definitely lives up to its hype. As a vegetarian, I can vouch for their amazing donuts and coffee. The staff is exceptionally friendly, even during busy times. My husband is obsessed with their chicken, particularly the buttermilk ranch. It's an all-around wonderful experience.
Milktooth is an incredible gem in Indianapolis, highly recommended by locals. I'm grateful for the opportunity to have experienced it.

I highly recommend Franzone's. The owner is always present, incredibly friendly, and genuinely invested in the quality of the food. Their sweet sauce isn't my personal preference, but they also serve a decent cheesesteak, fries, and more. The exceptional experience I have every time I visit pushes their rating up to a solid 4 out of 5 for me.

Great theater recliners, but beware of limited aisle space. Enjoyable lounge experience with a delightful bartender. Drinking in the theater is a bonus. However, concessions were disappointing with slow service and burnt popcorn. Consider eating beforehand and sticking to the bar next time.

I highly recommend asking for Phil at this place. Although he can be chatty, the service he provides is outstanding. The recommendations are great, although the octopus can be overdone sometimes. You can enjoy a cheap yet satisfying meal here. Expect to spend around $100 for two people, including wine, dessert, and various tapas. Overall, it's worth trying, but not ideal for private parties. Four stars.

I've only tried their vermicelli bowls, but they are reasonably priced, a good size, and consistently prepared. Located conveniently for Alberta Ave residents, my orders have always been ready within 15 minutes, even during busy times like Friday nights.

I highly recommend this small cafe for its popular breakfast and brunch options. The salmon scramble with egg whites and tofu with brown rice breakfast plate were both delicious. The service was efficient, and I was seated promptly.

I had a great experience at Keystone Discount Tire! As a new customer without an appointment, they took my car in for a PA State & Emissions inspection while I waited. The technician was kind enough to let me see a minor issue with my tires that can be fixed with an alignment. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and didn't try to upsell me. My car was fully inspected and stickered in less than an hour. I highly recommend signing up for their mailing list for coupons!

This hotel is decent, especially for business travelers. The rooms are comfortable with essential amenities. The cafe offers a decent deal, but it's unclear what is included. The hallways could use some maintenance, but it isn't a major issue. However, room cleaning can be inconsistent, as evidenced by a previous experience of finding food in the mini fridge.

JB Dawson's exceeded expectations, with a friendly hostess, attentive servers, and delicious food. The twisted shrimp appetizer was better than a popular competitor's version. The Four Cheese Mac & Cheese and fish tacos were both tasty, and the asparagus was perfectly cooked. The only drawback was the limited craft beer menu, but the waiter kindly offered a suitable alternative. Overall, a great experience, though I may bring my own craft beer next time.

This review highlights the frustration and disappointment the reviewer experienced with their stay at Hyatt. Despite clearly stating their request for a "feather free" room multiple times, feathers were still present in their assigned room. The reviewer questions whether Hyatt will ever grasp the importance of this issue, potentially risking another emergency room visit. Additionally, the high nightly parking fee of $29 in St. Louis is regarded as absurd. The repeated apology from the staff becomes tiresome for the reviewer.

Stopped by the Haven during the Seahawks/Saints game and it was packed for a reason - the Haven burger I had was fantastic. Despite the bustling crowd, I'll be returning, perhaps for a less busy lunch on a Tuesday.
The best sushi spot with the friendliest staff! A top menu choice, making every meal exceptional!

I used to love Skyline Chili but unfortunately, the Clearwater location is not up to par. Poor service, slow food service, and frequently out of ingredients or equipment issues. The cheese coney hot dogs are still delicious though. Hoping they improve soon.

We love everything we've tried here, especially the Backyard Bowl. The portion sizes are satisfying, even with the kids' size or splitting a large. Good quality ingredients at a reasonable price. Can get busy, but worth the wait.

I have been going to Susanna Foo since I was 6 months old and have fond memories of the restaurant. The food is reliable but lacks excitement for me as an adult. The service, decor, and ambience are always impeccable. I hope Susanna adds new flavors or embraces her Chinese roots for a more ethnic menu. I am hopeful for a revitalization and to rekindle my love for Susanna Foo.

I highly recommend Buddy Brew in Tampa. Their flavorful coffee and beautiful latte art are a treat. The modern design reminds me of New York's coffee shops. Free parking is a definite advantage, but limited seating and uncomfortably cold temperatures may encourage taking your coffee to go and exploring Hyde Park Village instead.

We had an excellent experience at this restaurant! The food was delicious and the service was top-notch. Despite a long wait on the formal side, we opted for the bar area and were pleasantly surprised that the full menu was available. The firecracker shrimp arrived quickly, and we enjoyed live music from a great band. The attentive servers made our visit even better. We ordered a variety of items, including alcohol, appetizers, entrees, salad, and dessert. Both the salmon and swordfish were fantastic. We also loved the huge fish tank, which we recognized from the famous TV show "Tanked". Overall, this restaurant offers not only good food and a nice view but also a memorable dining experience. We will definitely be coming back.

This place used to be excellent with a wide selection of items, reasonable prices, and helpful staff. I once returned a faulty part and got a refund without any hassle. Also returned an unnecessary purchase and received a prompt refund. While the quality has declined slightly, it is still a decent establishment.

I recently discovered this hidden gem for brunch and was blown away. Despite living so close, I had never heard of it before. The honeybee crepe and almond croissant were absolutely delicious, leaving nothing for leftovers. The seating area is cozy, but it's best to arrive early if you're with a group. Perfect for smaller groups and I will definitely be returning.

The ice cream was mediocre but satisfied my sweet craving while passing through Belmawr. The service was friendly but a bit slow. The charming decor adds to the ambience. I might return if I lived nearby, but wouldn't make a special trip for it.

Highly recommend the Steamboat Natchez trip in NOLA. Extremely informative and enjoyable, with great service from the well-organized staff. JoJo went above and beyond to reserve us a window seat. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

I stumbled upon Crabby Bill's after a long day at the beach and craving seafood. The $25 bucket of steamed seafood was decent, but not the freshest. It served as a quick snack to hold us over before our dinner reservation at Bern's Steak House.
This place is a gem! The ramen is excellent, and I'm thrilled to have discovered it. The service and food are exceptional.
Terrible roast pork sandwich with lifeless broccoli rabe and freezing temperatures. Cheese didn't even melt, bread was soggy. Avoid, unless you're stuck in an airport.
The donuts are simply perfect - flawless dough and perfectly balanced icing.

A perfect afternoon in the gulch would consist of a shopping spree at Blush, a beer at Hops and Crafts, and lunch at Turnip Truck. Turnip Truck offers a great selection of organic fair, including tasty hot buffet options and made-to-order sandwiches. They also have all-natural beauty products and lip balms. The only drawback is the lack of a rewards program. I highly recommend trying their chipotle chicken salad wrap on whole wheat with chipotle mayo.
The hotel is nice with great service, awesome restaurants, and clean rooms.

This high-end store in West Edmonton Mall offers great clothes and excellent service. The friendly and non-pushy staff cater to your needs without being overbearing. While they carry casual clothing, their specialty lies in suits, dress shirts, and fancy attire. Although it may be pricey, the quality and overall shopping experience make it worth it.

Burger Up is one of our favorite Nashville restaurants with a cool hipster vibe. The burgers are outstanding with endless options. Try the Woodstock with amazing Jack Daniels Maple Ketchup and delicious Benton's bacon. Don't miss the truffle fries! Vegetarians will love the troyathalon. The customer service is attentive and knowledgeable. Parking can be a bit challenging, but it's worth it. Definitely worth checking out!

I highly recommend Circle of Friends daycare. Linda and the staff have been incredibly helpful and my kids have thrived both emotionally and academically. The low turnover rate is a plus and my children have learned fascinating facts that even surprised me. Despite a few behavioral issues with other children, I am overall happy and content with this daycare.

Despite being located in a less trendy strip mall near Cool Springs, this version of Twelve South's hipster gourmet Burger Up still delivers in terms of taste. The burgers are delicious and messy, made with fresh meat and fixings. The regular fries are satisfying, but the truffle fries are outstanding, with a non-greasy finish topped with parmesan cheese. The chocolate milkshake, although simple, is perfectly made - creamy, not too sweet, and not overly chocolatey. For those looking for an upscale burger experience that still satisfies the burger-fries-shake holy trinity, this place is a must-visit.

Incredible experience! The Steak Tartare was the best I've ever had and the Caribbean Seafood Pepper Pot and Curried Goat were absolutely wonderful. The unique combination of sweet curry and gnocchi in the goat dish was a pleasant surprise. Even with just a bite, the lime cheesecake was top notch. With no drinks due to post-Mardi Gras recovery, the service still stood out as exceptional. Great place, highly recommend!

I had a mixed experience at the waxing salon. Miriam, the wax specialist, was knowledgeable and efficient. However, she focused more on promoting products and criticizing my regular shaving instead of providing a satisfactory experience. While my brows and lower legs were well done, there were stray hairs left on my underarms. Additionally, small traces of wax were left on my skin. Overall, I left feeling unprepared for the beach.

I highly recommend visiting the preserve! The hikes are enjoyable with abundant wildlife, and the paths are well-marked. The birds of prey aviary is impressive and the learning center is both educational and comfortable. The staff and volunteers are friendly and helpful. Don't miss the chance to see the birds up close with the handlers in the mid afternoon.

I rate it two stars due to excellent service and friendly staff. However, the food was subpar, possibly due to a bad day. My order from the German section turned out to be just a pretzel and a piece of sausage in a box, disappointing overall.

Overall, this restaurant is small but conveniently located on the wharf. Despite the limited seating, the wait time was short. Sitting at the bar was a good option. The noise level was a bit high due to the small space. The service provided was excellent. The crab sandwich was disappointing, served on plain white bread. However, the fried shrimp was enjoyable - not greasy or heavy, with moist and flavorful shrimp. It is worth noting that the menu only offers shellfish options. As a non-seafood enthusiast, I was pleasantly surprised by the shrimp and onion rings. However, my seafood enthusiast husband did not enjoy the crab sandwich. If you love shellfish and appreciate the great location, this place could be worth a try.

Unfortunately, the food at this place is really below average. It was similar to a Waffle House experience. Despite the positive reviews, the pancakes tasted like frozen processed ones and the "homemade" maple syrup was watery and artificially flavored. The hash browns were greasy and lacking in taste, while the bacon was overcooked and hard to chew. It was clear that the food had been sitting for a while. Overall, the lack of inspiration in the dishes was disappointing. This restaurant seems to rely on an outdated reputation and there are definitely better options available in Nashville.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Despite my initial hesitation as a vegetarian, they offer a delicious veggie burger and a great variety of local microbrews. Don't miss out on their homemade ice cream! I'll definitely be returning when I'm in St. Louis again.
Ann was incredibly helpful and positive during my first visit. She went above and beyond to ensure that I had an amazing experience. Thanks to her, I am now a regular customer. Thanks, girlie!

Casa Video is hands down the best video rental store out there. The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, but it's their exceptional selection that truly sets them apart. Whether you're after the latest releases or vintage VHS tapes, they've got you covered, all at an affordable price. I only wish there was a place like Casa Video in Chicago.

Screamagedon is an awesome and thrilling attraction, definitely worth visiting again next year. Some of the houses feel incredibly realistic, adding to the overall experience. The haunted hayride with fire torches, machine guns, chainsaws, demonic priests, and churches is absolutely spectacular. Walking through the woods with only a glow stick is both awesome and scary, giving a very real feeling. Forget about other popular Halloween events like Bush Gardens Howl-O-Scream and Halloween Horror Nights, Screamagedon has it all.
Incredible results! My neglected car underwent the executive detailing and now it looks brand new.

Despite good cocktails and a nice atmosphere, we were disappointed with the food. The Brussel sprouts and fries tasted like pure salt, even after replacement. The burger was just okay and the flank steak was nothing special. We won't be returning.

Kingsway Mall is a great alternative to West Ed for shopping with its variety of stores like lululemon, Jacob, Danier, Gap, Club Monaco, and American Eagle. Unlike other malls, it is typically less crowded, making browsing easier. The food options at the mall, such as New York Fries, Orange Julius, and Booster Juice, are also plentiful. The food court is spacious with ample seating available. However, it would be even better if Kingsway had a Bay and a movie theatre. Overall, Kingsway Mall is a satisfactory and convenient shopping destination.

Overall, the tour of the Mississippi on the steamboat is a good option for a relaxing day with a passive activity. The cost is average, around $28. The downside is that there are typical tourist traps like photographers, but you can decline those options. It is recommended to do some research beforehand, especially about the Natchez Native American Tribe, which adds an interesting element to the boat ride. Getting a drink can enhance the experience as well. Overall, it's a pleasant way to spend a few hours.

Jasmine Rice is a good, laid-back Thai restaurant recommended by Yelp. The pan-fried dumplings were decent, but not worth ordering again. The green curry fried rice with duck was fantastic, with the tastiest duck ever. The chicken pad thai was a bit sweet, so we would try a different noodle dish next time. Service was good, but others had some issues. Despite that, the overall experience was great and we would definitely return.

Attended a company event with over 2K people at the fantastic Tuscan Tower. This resort surpasses all others in the area, resembling a luxurious cruise ship. Despite being a non-smoker, I did not encounter the usual second-hand casino smoke. The highlight was having breakfast at the coffee shop and having an enjoyable conversation with the CEO/GM. It doesn't get any better than this!

I enjoyed my visit to this cute new coffee shop in town. The iced coffee was refreshing and they offered a variety of milk and sweetener options. The vegan banana bread was tasty but a bit dense. The only drawback was the lack of outdoor seating, but we found a nearby spot. I look forward to trying more of their fancy coffees and hoping they expand their food menu.

Amazing breakfast spot! Located just a short walk from the French Quarter, this place exceeded my expectations. The bananas foster was absolutely incredible. The vibrant and lively atmosphere perfectly captures the essence of New Orleans. Highly recommended!

This is a typical Broad Ripple charming spot with a small, trendy, and bustling atmosphere. Unfortunately, they do not take reservations, which can be annoying for those traveling from another part of town. However, the cocktails were creative and delicious, and the server's suggestions were on point. The guacamole was tasty, but came with nuts despite requesting them to be left off. The Harvest salad was a highlight with its delightful combination of fruit and root vegetables. The Veracruz Trigger fish and Serrano Scallops were both delicious, accompanied by interesting white sweet mashed potatoes. The Tostones were a bit dry, but dipped in the Stewed Black Beans, they tasted great. Unfortunately, there were no gluten-free, dairy-free dessert options available. Overall, it's worth a visit, just make sure to arrive before 7 pm on a Friday to secure a table.

Despite its outdated appearance, this place offers surprisingly delicious food that will remind you of grandma's cooking. The 1950's decor adds a charming small-town vibe, complete with ice skates on the wall and a Christmas tree in the corner. While it may not offer the best food in the world, their breakfast dishes are consistently amazing. The pancakes are fluffy and light, especially when topped with a bit of butter. The bacon is thick and tasty, albeit slightly overcooked. With reasonable prices and excellent service, this is the perfect spot for a satisfying homemade breakfast.

Earl at the airport offers a decent selection of sandwiches, including turkey, tuna, and Hawaiian. I opted for the roast beef sandwich and it did not disappoint. The sliced beef was cooked perfectly and paired well with cheddar cheese and a delicious horseradish sauce. The sandwich is best enjoyed without lettuce or tomatoes. Conveniently located near the security station and Delta SkyClub, it's easy to grab and enjoy at the gate or onboard.

Chef Sbraga's lavender honey fried chicken at Juniper Commons is some of the best I've had in a long time. The crunchy coating and juicy inside pair perfectly with the sweet honey glaze. The biscuit is also delicious. Every dish at Juniper Commons is top-notch. Chef Sbraga knows fried chicken.

I had a great takeout experience at this restaurant near closing time. The puttanesca I ordered was delicious, with a perfect balance of saltiness and spiciness. I appreciated the diverse menu options and the ability to customize my own dish. The only downside was the lack of a gluten-free dough option, which might cause some discomfort later on.

I absolutely love my local Sweet CeCe's! The product is amazing, and the selection of toppings is great - a good balance between healthy and indulgent. However, occasional lapses in service where the staff seems distracted can be a minor inconvenience. Despite that, my love for Sweet CeCe's earns them a solid 4 stars!

Overall, my dining experience only deserves two stars. However, I'll add one extra star for their appealing menu and innovative design. Unfortunately, the tomato-basil soup tasted like a weak marinara and the tuna melt had an unpleasant, sharp flavor, possibly due to overpowering lemon zest. Next time, I'll opt for dishes featuring cured Italian meats like mortadella and prosciutto, as well as their enticing baked goods, with the Nutella bruschetta being a standout option.
The Bridgeport Rib House offers tasty take-out options with fair prices. However, the bar service for pick-up orders falls short compared to other local barbecue establishments.
Unfortunately, The Taint failed to live up to its hype. The apathetic atmosphere and unsavory crowd in the Garden District left me unimpressed. Not my scene.

The dental clinic impressed with its TVs in the exam rooms, but it turns out they're more of a pricey perk than a useful distraction during dental work. The dental work done was of good quality, but the price was high and it's uncertain if it was truly necessary.

At the Collingswood Art Festival, we tried these pricey yet absolutely worth it fried cheddar curds. They are not greasy at all and have a perfect flavor. Once you have a taste, you'll be craving them again. The light batter doesn't overpower the deliciously stringy and melty cheese. The sauces provided are a delightful addition. An indulgence that is definitely worth the price.

My husband and I have had multiple wonderful experiences at this restaurant. The staff is knowledgeable and always accommodated my dietary needs as a Celiac. The wine and cocktail menus are excellent, and the food is divine. The only small downside is the lack of gluten-free desserts, but that won't stop us from returning again and again.

The store's quality and selection have significantly declined in recent years. The produce is not fresh and overpriced, while organic foods are more expensive than Whole Foods. Additionally, the store's organization and customer service have worsened, with aisles roped off and difficulty reaching the register. I faced frustration from staff while trying to purchase soup. Overall, a disappointing experience and I will be switching to Wegmans for my shopping needs.

My wife and I highly recommend this place! Great management, attentive service, and delicious food. Don't miss the Tiger Roll, Pink Lady Roll, and Tornado Roll. Ask for Billy, he's our favorite. Overall, a must-visit spot in the area. Enjoy!

Sierra and India from JOTSB provided exceptional care for my family during our recent reunion in Santa Barbara. They went above and beyond by not only purchasing all the necessary items in advance but also anticipating our needs and restocking drinks and food throughout the event. Their flexibility, enthusiasm, attention to detail, and overall fabulous service made the experience truly memorable. I highly recommend JOTSB and hope to have the opportunity to use their services again in the future.
This Cuban restaurant is decent but average. It's convenient for me to grab lunch at, and their daily specials are worth trying as they are always freshly made.

I regret to say that I will not be returning to this location. Despite contacting the manager about a poorly made pizza, their response was unresponsive and they failed to address the issue. Even after providing photo evidence, there was no further communication from their end.

Five stars! This food truck provides excellent and efficient service. The meat is consistently juicy, and the BBQ sauce is delicious. Prices are reasonable, and if you come across this truck, don't miss the opportunity to try their offerings. You won't be disappointed.

I've been going to Jonny's dive bar for years and it's great. Amazing happy hour, laid back atmosphere, and surprisingly delicious food. The homemade dough and naked wings are a must-try. They also offer games like trivia and bingo, with awesome prizes including 1 cent pitchers of beer. Just be aware that it's a smoking bar and can get crowded on game days. Overall, a fantastic spot for cheap drinks, half-price pizza, and hanging out with friends.
We had a breathtaking wedding reception at Hendel's Cafe - a truly perfect evening shared with loved ones.
The chicken and French toast were amazing! Patio could use more shade, but overall enjoyable experience. Pet-friendly. We'll return!
I was disappointed with Tony Luke's at terminal F. The Philly Cheese Steak didn't resemble the picture and the meat tasted unpleasant, like dog food. Not worth the $10.

Muriel's is a must-visit restaurant in the French Quarter offering a fantastic lunch special. The Bloody Mary was flavorful and reasonably priced, and the wait time was manageable with the convenient text message system. Although the servers were a bit forgetful, the overall experience was still enjoyable. The turtle soup was outstanding, and the generous portion of pork chop with red beans left me satisfied until bedtime. The historic location and ambiance added to the dining experience, making it worth a visit when in the Quarter.

This hidden gem on Bourbon St. is a great alternative to Cafe du Monde. The beignets were delicious, if not better, and the best part was no line! It's a calm oasis in the morning, although the lack of live music was a downside. The full breakfast options like the crawfish omelet and Cajun hashbrowns were decent but, let's be honest, the beignets steal the show.
Excellent service and delicious food at this pricey establishment. A special thanks to Douglas for the outstanding service. The atmosphere rivals top tier restaurants nationwide.

Conveniently located near my hotel, this shop offers a great buy one get one deal. The staff is extremely friendly, and the hot wings were delicious with a generous amount of sauce. Will definitely return for their tasty pizza on my next visit!

The best casino in Reno! Their 4 deck and 2 deck blackjack options are a gambler's dream. Say goodbye to plastic cups, they serve drinks in real glasses. The dazzling decor will leave you in awe. The in-house restaurants outshine those on the strip by a thousand-fold. The rooms are top-notch for the price, especially the ones with hot tubs. Chill out and enjoy!

Love this place for cocktails! Prices are a bit steep, but the unique glassware and designs are worth it. The Dragon's Tear and Blackmail are delicious, and my friends loved them too. Laid-back ambiance with great music and quirky decor. Not a fan of the food, but I'll be back for drinks.

This restaurant deserves a 3.5-star rating due to the absence of alcohol, which was disappointing after a long week. Nevertheless, the margherita pie was delicious and fresh. We also enjoyed the appetizing Greek salad, brimming with tasty veggies. Yum!

Kelly's has undergone a change in ownership and menu, which is clearly a sore subject for the new team. While they do emphasize the improved cleanliness of the establishment, I found the classic burger and fries to be disappointing. The burger lacked flavor and was dry, making me wish I had opted for a cheaper fast-food alternative. The fries were average. Additionally, it was surprising to see the restaurant almost empty during dinner hours, a stark contrast to its previous popularity.

Recently, I dined here twice and was extremely dissatisfied. The service was lacking and the food failed to impress, which was quite disappointing considering our previous enjoyable experiences. Regrettably, I don't think I will be returning, as this restaurant is no longer worth the expense.

This place is a disappointment. The service is terrible and the food is overpriced and mediocre. I had hoped my first experience was just an off night, but the second visit was equally disappointing. There is nothing innovative about this place, and they don't seem to care about the high prices they charge. I would recommend saving this one for the tourists.

Finally got to try this place last night. Eclectic menu for foodies. The onion tart and veal meatballs with polenta were delicious. The red gravy tasted homemade. The citrus short ribs with fat noodles and brussel sprouts were amazing, couldn't finish it all. Small and crowded, but a great friendly atmosphere. Will definitely be back to try more interesting dishes.
I recently tried this place and unfortunately, the pizza was quite disappointing. The previous establishment I visited had much better quality, offering delicious homemade food.

I love Mr. Wizard's for their healthier frozen yogurt option compared to frozen custard. The option to choose pre-select combinations or create your own is great. However, limited outdoor seating can be inconvenient in cold weather, so eating in your car might be necessary.

This historical building is meticulously preserved and offers an exclusive experience. Our visit granted us a private tour with a knowledgeable Park Ranger. Moreover, collectors of National Park Stamps will be thrilled to find a selection here.

First time visit, friendly service, waived minimum credit order. Average American-Chinese food, some greasy sauces. Good vegetarian options. Lunch specials with rice and drink/soup/egg roll for $5.75. Overall, decent but not exceptional.

Had a fabulous night at Spasso with friends. Our meals were incredible, especially the seafood special. Leftovers were delicious too. Service was fantastic, and the wine selection was spot on. Can't wait to return!

Great live music venue with the best local beer in town. The concept is a step up from Fig Mountain. Topa is the preferred choice. The added bonus of ordering amazing food from the Nook Restaurant and being able to walk to Lama Dog makes it even better. Love it!

This sushi spot is simply amazing! Their rolls are huge, service is excellent, and my personal favorites are the heat attack appetizer, Sapporo roll, and honey roll. The deep-fried rolls are a must-try, and everything looks incredibly fresh and appetizing. The presentation is top-notch. If you're feeling adventurous, go for the spicy sashimi bowl.

My experience at Dinardo's was unpleasant and disappointing. The interior was run down and unclean, and the food quality did not match the high prices. The server made snarky comments, which added to the unwelcome atmosphere. The mussels were small and the sauce was unimpressive, while other dishes were bland and salty. I would recommend trying seafood elsewhere, as there are better options available. I am surprised that this place is still in business.
When it's late and you're craving munchies, this is the perfect place to order from.

The front desk staff, specifically Kris, provided excellent service by going above and beyond during a heavy rainstorm. They walked the reviewer and their pet, Leo, to the car with an umbrella. The reviewer has been taking their nervous pet, Leonidas, to the clinic for two years. Since seeing Dr. Deutsch, they have found him to be the best in terms of thoroughness and ensuring Leo's comfort.
